excerpts: We ordered quite a bit as we wwere starving: Pastel Puertorriquenos, Platanos Maduros, Alcapurria, Tostones con Mojo de Ajo, Cubano sandwich, Passion fruit shake, and sweet potato fries.
Everything tasted fine.. just not out of this world.
On the other hand, service was really good.
The place is cute, I like the location at the Mission.
Not a bad place at all.
pastel puertorriquenos.author: Vol T.
pastel puertorriquenos.review: I'm a fan of Puerto Rican/ Cuban food and have eaten quite a bit of it. This was just ok. We ordered quite a bit as we wwere starving: Pastel Puertorriquenos, Platanos Maduros, Alcapurria, Tostones con Mojo de Ajo, Cubano sandwich, Passion fruit shake, and sweet potato fries. Everything tasted fine.. just not out of this world. On the other hand, service was really good. The place is cute, I like the location at the Mission. Not a bad place at all.

excerpts: Lastly, I had the Alcapurrias
and I would recommend people to try that one also.
alcapurrias.author: Faith W.
alcapurrias.review: The food was really good. I enjoyed the ropa vieja, the meat was tender and just right. For appetizer I got the yucca Frita ( It was my first time trying it and it was definitely interesting taste. Kind of taste like fries but it wasn't.) Lastly, I had the Alcapurrias and I would recommend people to try that one also.

excerpts: I had some of the alcapurrias (fritters) stuffed with picadillo (ground beef) and they were bomb.
alcapurrias.author: Ana M.
alcapurrias.review: My mom's Cuban and my dad's Puerto Rican and I actually grew up in Puerto Rico and I can honestly say this place is the bomb. Super authentic and delicious in every way. I went last night in need of some home cooking in the wake of Hurricane Maria and this spot delivered. I had some of the alcapurrias (fritters) stuffed with picadillo (ground beef) and they were bomb. Then I had the vaca frita (shredded flank steak) with rice and black beans and it was amazing. This is my favorite dish my mom makes, and this was up there with hers (actually even a more flavorful). I also had the passion fruit mango juice and it was super tasty. In short, I can't recommend this place enough!

excerpts: Kind of dry, the alcapurrias were oily and it didn't really appeal to my palate.
Fast forward 9 years later, and under new ownership, the place is awesome.
Food is fresh and cooked made to order, the setting is cute and quaint and displays the flags of Cuba and Puerto Rico adjacent to each other.
alcapurrias.author: Jill P.
alcapurrias.review: This place is amazing.  I went here for the first time back in 2008 and food was not all that great.  Kind of dry, the alcapurrias were oily and it didn't really appeal to my palate.  Fast forward 9 years later, and under new ownership, the place is awesome.  Food is fresh and cooked made to order, the setting is cute and quaint and displays the flags of Cuba and Puerto Rico adjacent to each other.  We ordered the plantains, pollo a la española, pasteles, yucca frita, and they gave us tostones on the house! The service is soooooo warm and inviting.  Food is great! Can't wait to come back to this beautiful gem on 24th street...

excerpts: The alcapurrias were a disturbing orange color (more than just too much annatto) and frankly weren't worth eating.
alcapurrias.author: Lisa K.
alcapurrias.review:
So we'd come back since 2012, and things had taken a turn for the better. But revisiting tonight showed that once again, things are worse - and worse than ever, sadly. We noticed that the menus have changed - there's no more soup, unfortunately. The alcapurrias were a disturbing orange color (more than just too much annatto) and frankly weren't worth eating. The ropa vieja flavor was heavily dominated by green peppers, was tough, and the sauce was too runny. The cuban sandwich was fine though!

Furthermore, the service was pretty paltry too. We were quizzed about if we were willing to pay the $1.25 for pink beans instead of black when we'd asked for the former (this at a restaurant where the alcalpurrias are now $9!), and when we confirmed we wanted the pink beans and were fine to pay for them, black beans were still brought to our table - and when the situation was remedied, the beans themselves tasted terribly burned! Our "appetizer" arrived by the time we had almost finished our entrees. We asked if the platanos could be cooked without the butter, and were told this was impossible - too bad, since they have accommodated that request before. We were pretty sad to see what's going on here.

excerpts: I've been craving mofongo, alcapurrias (
although a bit overcooked and hard, they were still delicious), and a real deal Cuban Sandwich for quite some time now.
I've had pretty bad luck with Cuban Sandwiches lately in the Bay Area.
The last one had arugula and tomatoes and no Swiss.
It was a hipster ABOMINATION.
Cuban Sandwiches are absolute perfection and the ingredients should NEVER EVER be altered.
The only thing that should vary is the amount of love one puts in em.
And not the amount of arugula like Habanas in Alameda.
Yuck!
We did have to wait 10 minutes to be seen when we sat down.
The young waitress, seemed to be a bit distracted by some young bucks sitting at the bar.
She did, however help us a lot after our 10 min wait.
The co-owner was super helpful and nice as well.
We're from the East Coast and my wife is Boricua
The mofongo was delicious, but they brought us 3 very, very little shrimp with garlic sauce to add.
alcapurrias.author: Themane D.
alcapurrias.review:
The food was pretty good. I've been craving mofongo, alcapurrias (although a bit overcooked and hard, they were still delicious), and a real deal Cuban Sandwich for quite some time now. I've had pretty bad luck with Cuban Sandwiches lately in the Bay Area. The last one had arugula and tomatoes and no Swiss. It was a hipster ABOMINATION. Cuban Sandwiches are absolute perfection and the ingredients should NEVER EVER be altered. The only thing that should vary is the amount of love one puts in em. And not the amount of arugula like Habanas in Alameda. Yuck!
We did have to wait 10 minutes to be seen when we sat down. The young waitress, seemed to be a bit distracted by some young bucks sitting at the bar. She did, however help us a lot after our 10 min wait. The co-owner was super helpful and nice as well. 
We're from the East Coast and my wife is Boricua, so we know what to look for.

The mofongo was delicious, but they brought us 3 very, very little shrimp with garlic sauce to add. The cuban sandwich was good, but a bit salty.

Had to drop my review by 2 stars because the restaurant was closed when we showed up at 6 pm on a Wednesday for dinner. Drove all the way from Oakland took 30 mins to find parking and BAM CLOSED for no apparent reason. Sign on the door stated "Open."

Stay thirsty my friends

excerpts: The alcapurrias were burned, but still tasted ok, but why would you serve your customers burnt food,
alcapurrias.author: Daniel S.
alcapurrias.review:
The beans did not have any flavor,  the pernil was ok, but did not have that authentic Puerto Rican flavor.
The tostones were decent. 

The alcapurrias were burned, but still tasted ok, but why would you serve your customers burnt food,

I ate at this restaurant a few years ago and the food was a lot better. 

I was very disappointed,  I spent over $100 and threw away most of the food (ordered the food to go).

excerpts: The Cubano sandwich with extra mustard will be forever my favorite... or is it the Alcapurrias... or maybe the Ropa Vieja,
alcapurrias.author: Chelsey B.
alcapurrias.review:
This spot is a must to visit when you're around the Mission.
The Cubano sandwich with extra mustard will be forever my favorite... or is it the Alcapurrias... or maybe the Ropa Vieja, I JUST LOVE IT ALL!! 

When my boyfriend and I go here.. he always has to order a Sangria.
This place is awesome for a modern mom and pop type of restaurant.

excerpts: We ordered (2) papa rellena, mofongo, alcapurrias, empanadas, and the appetizer combo (tostones, yucca con mojo, platanos maduros).
And another appetizer like a tamal, Puerto Rican version.
Made with plantains/platanos, tara root, and more!
We ordered one main dish we shared - paella.
We both ordered tropical smoothie drinks.
Like smooth tropical milkshakes.
Made with Caribbean tropical fruits.
I'm lactose intolerant, so I ditched the milk, and replaced with water.
Still so good.
All that was mentioned, you're going to have to cross-reference the menu to the pics posted on Yelp!
alcapurrias.author: Roger S.
alcapurrias.review:
I have been going to El Nuevo Fruitilandia for about 25 years! When it was kind of a dive, but great food. When I moved into the neighborhood. Yes, it's been around that long. Shows how old I am! I haven't been there in a couple of years. So I took my niece - her first time to El Nuevo Fruitilandia. As much as I love this restaurant, when operated by the former owners, I really believe the new owners have tweaked some dishes, making them just as good or better. And added some new dishes and appetizers on the menu.

My niece and I went mostly for appetizers (tapas). We ordered (2) papa rellena, mofongo, alcapurrias, empanadas, and the appetizer combo (tostones, yucca con mojo, platanos maduros). And another appetizer like a tamal, Puerto Rican version. Made with plantains/platanos, tara root, and more! We ordered one main dish we shared - paella. We both ordered tropical smoothie drinks. Like smooth tropical milkshakes. Made with Caribbean tropical fruits. I'm lactose intolerant, so I ditched the milk, and replaced with water. Still so good. All that was mentioned, you're going to have to cross-reference the menu to the pics posted on Yelp! to see the actual plates.

Did I eat everything we ordered? I could have! But I just wanted to sample and gave the rest to my niece to take home.

The decor hasn't changed much since the last owners' remodel. Actually, some of the same wall decor from the very orignal restaurant, 25 years ago. The restaurant is clean and quaint. They no longer have a guitar player in the front window area, like they used to on Friday and Saturday nights. Would be nice to have. The waiter/server was very friendly and helpful.  We ate lunch when they opened. I know dinner must get crowded.

El Nuevo Fruitilandia is an even more special place to dine for me. If you want to try Puerto Rican-Cuban cuisine, El Nuevo Fruitilandia stands out! I give them a high-5 rating! They compete well with all the new restaurants on lower 24th St (Calle 24/Veinticuatro). I think they surpass a lot of the newer trendy places. And it still has the flavor of the Mission heritage. El Nuevo Fruitilandia has been there longer than folks know. And I hope it will be there for many more years!

I showed my Yelp! coupon on my smartphone and got the discount. That paid for an appetizer+. So don't forget to mention and show when your first order. And check if they're Groupon-friendly too.

excerpts: At the time they had run out of Alcapurrias, a tasty fried dish, which didn't surprise me.
I could probably clean them out by myself.
They also have Coco Rico, a popular coconut soda.
I guess we'll have to go back.
alcapurrias.author: Mike D.
alcapurrias.review:
To my great surprise we found this restaurant on the way to a cultural event. 

I was excited when I saw they had Malta, a sweet non-alcoholic refreshing beverage,  which goes good with the Puerto Rican Pasteles we had.  My wife who normally is not fond of them was pleasantly surprised. I explained to her she never had them so well prepared, and flavorful.

We also had shrimp with rice, Papa Relleno (potato balls with meat inside them),  At the time they had run out of Alcapurrias, a tasty fried dish, which didn't surprise me. I could probably clean them out by myself. They also have Coco Rico, a popular coconut soda. I guess we'll have to go back.

excerpts: Plantanos Maduros and Alcapurrias.
Unfortunately, they did not have any pastels.
The plantains were nice and sweet and the  Picadillio was well seasoned.
We each ordered a main dish.
The Lechon and the Bistec.
Everything tasted great, it just lacked flavor.
Both meats were tender.
The reason I give this place 4 stars is because their service was superb and their drink specials (pitcher of Sangria) was just what we needed to quench our Sunday thirst.
I would say, give it a try, it's probably the closest in Puerto Rican/Cuban food you will come in contact with in the Bay Area.
alcapurrias.author: Claudine P.
alcapurrias.review: Let me start off by saying that you cannot compare this place to anything you've ever eaten in New York or Miami. With that said, overall the food was delicious. It lacked a bit in the true Latin flavor but I am assuming that it may be harder to get some of the ingredients on the west coast because I cannot find them. We ordered several items off of the menu. Plantanos Maduros and Alcapurrias. Unfortunately, they did not have any pastels. The plantains were nice and sweet and the  Picadillio was well seasoned. We each ordered a main dish. The Lechon and the Bistec. Everything tasted great, it just lacked flavor. Both meats were tender. The reason I give this place 4 stars is because their service was superb and their drink specials (pitcher of Sangria) was just what we needed to quench our Sunday thirst. I would say, give it a try, it's probably the closest in Puerto Rican/Cuban food you will come in contact with in the Bay Area.

excerpts: Mofongo and alcapurrias and tostones.
My family also orders pasteles from them every year at Christmas time to bring home.
alcapurrias.author: Hunter G.
alcapurrias.review:
There are only 10 and a half Puerto Ricans in the Bay Area, I am one of them and "nine" of them are related to me. Not even the owners of Fruliandia are Puerto Rican. The only Puerto Rican restaurant in S.F. and they're not Puerto Rican. That gives me an idea.

OK, maybe there are more boricua but I don't know them and it hasn't stopped this place from making great food. I usually get the same thing everytime. Mofongo and alcapurrias and tostones. My family also orders pasteles from them every year at Christmas time to bring home. Pasteles are a type of plantain dumpling that can have pork and other things and are usually wrapped in banana leaves (like my grandmother used to do) or cooking parchment.

Everything I've had there has tasted authentic and I like to bring out of town guests there to let them sample the food of my people. It's a small place in the Mission and there only ever seems to be two people working so it's not good for large groups.

There are a couple of other places I found on the other side of the bridge but that is a separate review. For now, Frutilandia is the best place to go for Puerto Rican food. Oh yeah, and I guess Cuban food too.

excerpts: The empanadas de espinacas were quite good and one of my meat eating friends liked the alcapurrias.
alcapurrias.author: Gina R.
alcapurrias.review: The service was pretty bad but it was a busy Friday night so not overly surprised. The food was good, the surtido which has tostones, maduros (ripe plantains) and yucca were all really good. Mofongo was a bit dry and there was only maybe three shrimp in there made it a little less dry with the sauce on it. Black beans were decent, could have used a little more flavor but it was better than the last time I went which was almost 5 years ago (judging from the review I am looking at). Also, on the menu it should say that the pink beans have pork in it because friend of mine almost ate it and she is vegetarian. She discovered this after a bite and could taste the pork. At least the server should have informed us but they were fairly busy when we got there so I guess some important details were missed. Life goes on. I would go back but not during the weekend or at least during a time that they're not so busy. I am Puerto Rican so I know what this food should taste like, so I think there's definitely room for improvement. The empanadas de espinacas were quite good and one of my meat eating friends liked the alcapurrias.

excerpts: but I miss the regular just plantain alcapurrias, these are made with yucca also.
alcapurrias.author: Yamil A.
alcapurrias.review:
We just finished another great dinner at El Nuevo Frutilandia.  I'm even more impressed because we got to chat a bit with the waitress.  Just learned this restaurant has been open for over 25 years, that the friendly cute waitress Irene (EE reh neh) has been working there for the past 9 and they are not Puerto Ricans or Cubans...  This is why we were both even more impressed.  The food is well done!

I've been craving PR cooking for a while, so I got a fix tonight.  I went with my friend Rita C who is from the Dominican Republic; you can say we know Caribbean food!

We ordered mostly tapas stile entrees and we started with the famous MOFONGO, excellent!

Followed by ALCAPURRIAS- not bad but I miss the regular just plantain alcapurrias, these are made with yucca also.

We also had a YUCCA AL MOJO dish and followed by a BACALAO GISAU WITH RICE (stew of cod fish with steam rice) which came with the chicken soup or green salad.  The yucca was perfect and the bacalao less salty than I'm used to, but flavorful.  

I most say, their chicken soup is darn good.  The most authentic Puerto Rican chicken soup I've had outside of the island.

This was a Thursday evening and they were not crowded.  However, the mofongo usually takes a while to prepare, so order it as soon as you are seated.  While you wait, enjoy some warm bread!

===================================================

The only Puerto Rican restaurant I've been able to find in the city.  And trust me, I've looked!
Not disappointing, try the mofongo, I love their version.  Maybe not before a hot date/night...  Two words - garlic breath.
Small, cozy, friendly waitress and good inexpensive menu selection - I'm coming back!

excerpts: i also had the puerto rican pasteles and alcapurrias and
they where on hit
i once had a spacial
alcapurrias.author: Jose C.
alcapurrias.review: i,m not gonna even say i,m an expert on puerto rican cuisine but i have been here quite a few times and the food is preatty good not the best but good i really like there tostones i also had the puerto rican pasteles and alcapurrias and they where on hit i once had a spacial it was lechon with arroz con gandules they also sell some cuban dishes they sell good ropa vieja and there vaca frita is hella good i also had a cuban sandwhich it was on hit i met quite a few boricuas in the bay area hopefully one day one of them will open up a new puerto rican restaurant in san fran one day it,s long over due but for right now if you find your self in the city this is the only place that i know of that sells puerto rican food  on a last note the staff is very freindly....

excerpts: Fortunately, we were well fed with empanadas, mofongo, and lechon.
empanadas.author: Sara M.
empanadas.review:
A fun spot for a good meal!

I came for dinner and was sad to see that they stop serving Cuban sandwiches after 7pm. Fortunately, we were well fed with empanadas, mofongo, and lechon. There isn't a ton of Caribbean food in the area as far as I know, so this was a good opportunity to order something a little different.

There's no liquor here, but the sangria is tasty. I'd come back for a casual dinner when I don't have a reservation and don't feel like waiting in line. The service was also very good.

excerpts: The ceviche, tostones, and mofongo are some of my favorite dishes along with their dessert empanadas.
empanadas.author: Nancy L.
empanadas.review:
I love El Nuevo Frutilandia. I've been coming here for years, especially for family celebrations.

Let's me just say, my father hates eating out and is very particular of where we go if we do eat out, but yet this is one of the few places he loves coming to. 

The food is delicious and better than the few places around for Puerto Rican / Cuban food in the city. The ceviche, tostones, and mofongo are some of my favorite dishes along with their dessert empanadas. 

The management is very nice and beyond accommodating. And unlike other reviews have mentioned, I've never had an issue with the food quality, wait time, or service regardless of how slow or busy they are.

I will continue coming here and getting my Puerto Rican/Cuban food fix as long as I can.

excerpts: We started out with chicken and picadillo empanadas with a side of tostones.
That already set the bar high for our entrees, it was so delicious!
Filled with flavor and the meats were cooked so well.
The empanadas were both crispy and golden, yum.
empanadas.author: Vanessa D.
empanadas.review:
My boyfriend and I passed by this restaurant a few months ago and we FINALLY got the chance to try it. We were so excited and the location is beautiful, right in the heart of Mission District.

We started out with chicken and picadillo empanadas with a side of tostones. That already set the bar high for our entrees, it was so delicious! Filled with flavor and the meats were cooked so well. The empanadas were both crispy and golden, yum.

Our entrees came, he got the ropa vieja and I got the Chile relleno with chicken. They both came with sides of white rice and taro chips. The white rice had a nice kick of flavor, it was a perfect side and so were the chips. The whole meal evened each other out. Along with the great food was friendly smiles of our servers. they were all so kind to us!! Thank you very much for a delicious meal, we look forward to coming back.

excerpts: From the pork mofongo, ceviche, and beef& chicken empanadas!
empanadas.author: Brittany C.
empanadas.review:
Second time here and the food was Amazing! 
From the pork mofongo, ceviche, and beef& chicken empanadas! 

Service was pretty slow but I understand there was one server on one of the hottest days of summer who ran out of ice.

Food came out fast and it was delicious! I also enjoyed the white wine guava sangria!

excerpts: To start we ordered the Picadillo, Chicken, and Veggie Empanadas.
All of them were good!
empanadas.author: Caro S.
empanadas.review:
This is a great spot in the Mission with authentic Puerto Rican and Cuban food.

To start we ordered the Picadillo, Chicken, and Veggie Empanadas. All of them were good! Loved the Chicken especially!

We ordered Pasteles which my Husband loved. For our main dishes we had the Pollo Española which had great flavors. It was similar to the Chicken in the empanada. Completely different than anything I have had but totally yummy! 

We had the Lechón, and shared a side of Habichuelas. The Lechón was very yummy. All of the plates were very generous and super tasty. We had delish leftovers for two additional meals.

I loved the ambiance and the music made us want to get up and dance salsa! Our server was very attentive and even brought out flan to celebrate a birthday in our party. For dessert I really enjoyed the Guava Turnover. It was fabulous, save room or take one to go!

excerpts: On a date we ordered the empanadas, which came out hot and tasty, yummy; It was two
so it's basically an appetizer.
empanadas.author: Santiago E.
empanadas.review: Sangria sangria, we tried the white sangria and it was really good. You always have to try the sangria in a latin/Hispanic/cubano culture lol, it helps to judge the rest of the night. On a date we ordered the empanadas, which came out hot and tasty, yummy; It was two so it's basically an appetizer. Then we ordered the Mofongo which was fulfilling and cooked with love. Then we had the Ropa Vieja! We shared all three plates so it was the right amount, obviously you can order just one plate for yourself and still have a great meal. I would definitely recommend those 3 to try out, however I have to go back and give the Yuka a try again. Wasn't impressed considering in Mother land Nicaragua they are cooked a certain way. The vibe was welcoming and homey so I'll give it another shot. Recommend for something low key and good vibes

excerpts: We ordered the mofongo with shrimp and the spinach empanadas.
Everything was amazing, but those empanadas were BOMB!
The service was also excellent, and the waitress was very helpful with choice selection.
There is also music, which creates a nice vibe.
I'll definitely be back!!!
empanadas.author: Tish H.
empanadas.review: This place is truly a gem. Having been to Cuba and Puerto Rico, it was an amazing treat to relive those cultures here. We ordered the mofongo with shrimp and the spinach empanadas. Everything was amazing, but those empanadas were BOMB! The service was also excellent, and the waitress was very helpful with choice selection. There is also music, which creates a nice vibe. I'll definitely be back!!!

excerpts: I ordered the Picadillo a La Havana and my husband got the Cuban sandwich and we shared a craft of sangria with some empanadas (chicken ones were the best).
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
empanadas.author: Brittany M.
empanadas.review: My husband and I were staying in a near by Airbnb and it just so happened that the owner of El Nuevo Frutilandia was our host and mentioned stopping by during our stay. I am SOOO happy we did! I had never had never had Cuban food prior to this experience, and all I can say is it was an amazing experience! Delicious food/sangria, affordable, and friendly. I ordered the Picadillo a La Havana and my husband got the Cuban sandwich and we shared a craft of sangria with some empanadas (chicken ones were the best). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

excerpts: I had the empanadas!
I definitely recommend this place !!!
empanadas.author: Lorena P.
empanadas.review: My family & I went to Frutilandia today, I was our first time going here & out experience was amazing! We got there right before they closed but they still welcomed us in and served us food. The hosts Jennifer was so kind & patient with us, she made our experience unforgettable. She also gave us some free desert. The food tasted amazing I had the empanadas! I definitely recommend this place !!!

excerpts: I ordered the garlic shrimp with rice dish and empanadas to start.
As soon as we tried the empanadas we ordered another round they were so amazing.
At the end of our meal we ordered a sweet empanada as dessert which was covered in condensed milk.
This place is amazing and I will definitely make the trip to eat here again!
empanadas.author: Renee R.
empanadas.review: I randomly walked into this place by chance and it was such a good choice. I ordered the garlic shrimp with rice dish and empanadas to start. As soon as we tried the empanadas we ordered another round they were so amazing. At the end of our meal we ordered a sweet empanada as dessert which was covered in condensed milk. This place is amazing and I will definitely make the trip to eat here again!

excerpts: The empanadas de plántano were flaky and paired perfectly w my café cubano.
Mmm.
Mmm.
Mmm
empanadas.author: Jocelyn A.
empanadas.review: I came here because I had a craving for fried plaintains, and they did not disappoint. I ordered both the side dish version AND the dessert plaintains. Both were delicious. With a side of sour creme and a splash of Tabasco, the plantanos maduros were a sweet, sour, and spicy delight to my tastbuds. The empanadas de plántano were flaky and paired perfectly w my café cubano. Mmm. Mmm. Mmm

excerpts: Beef Empanadas-very tasty and cooked perfect.
The dough was nice light brown color and flaky.
empanadas.author: Will E.
empanadas.review:
Well, this would be the first 5 that I've given out.  Heard about the place so of course I had to try it.  

Beef Empanadas-very tasty and cooked perfect. The dough was nice light brown color and flaky. Only wish more came with the order. 

Vaca frita-was tender and delicious. Cooked perfect as well. 

Lechon-so tender, flavor was awesome

Beans two different ones, both very good. Yummy. 

Mofungo-good flavor, very good. 

Tres leche-to die for. Wth. Have to try it. 

Okay enough about the food, the waitress was great with great service.

excerpts: We loved the chicken empanadas, the beef are great too.
Owner sat and chatted with us after our meal, and made us feel very welcome.
We are never disappointed with the amazing food, sangria, dessert and, especially, the service.
empanadas.author: Margaret P.
empanadas.review: Traditional Cuban and Puerto Rican food with fast service. Friendly staff is welcoming. We loved the chicken empanadas, the beef are great too. Owner sat and chatted with us after our meal, and made us feel very welcome.  We are never disappointed with the amazing food, sangria, dessert and, especially, the service.

excerpts: We went with our two little children, and all of the Empanadas (chicken, Beef, and the desert Plantain one) were very good.
The black beans and rice are flavored to perfection and if I closed my eyes, I felt like was back in Miami with my family!
We will be back, to try the Ropa Viella and the Cuban Sandwich (which we called Media Noche' in Miami) .
Fantastic place, perfect location, great food and friendly staff.....
what else can you ask for?
empanadas.author: M. R.
empanadas.review: Loved this place!  We have walked past this little gem in the mission, many many times and finally went in after all the good reviews from Yelp!  Well! we should have gone in long ago, because it was a FANTASTIC FIND!  Its a small, homey, space that is very inviting and the staff is very friendly!  We went with our two little children, and all of the Empanadas (chicken, Beef, and the desert Plantain one) were very good.  The black beans and rice are flavored to perfection and if I closed my eyes, I felt like was back in Miami with my family!  We will be back, to try the Ropa Viella and the Cuban Sandwich (which we called Media Noche' in Miami) .  Fantastic place, perfect location, great food and friendly staff.....what else can you ask for?

excerpts: You must try the vaca frita, alcapurria's, empanadas de platano maduro.
Happy eating.
empanadas.author: Maria C.
empanadas.review: Wonderful place to eat authentic Puerto Rican food. The staff is friendly and totally love the salsa music in the background. Charming place that you all should definitely visit in the mission. You must try the vaca frita, alcapurria's, empanadas de platano maduro. Happy eating.

excerpts: Very good empanadas, ceviche, shrimp dishes with different marinades of rice (as well as chicken, steaks, and pork in same manner), lots of bean sides, and yucca and plantains galore!
The empanadas come with a great sauce!!
Good portion sizes too and fun, local vibe.
empanadas.author: Emily R.
empanadas.review:
Great spot! 
So they have great happy hour deals on tapas and drinks (Wed thru Fri 5pm-7pm & sun 4pm-7pm) and THE BEST SANGRIA. I don't even like white wine and they make a guava white wine sangria and a mango red wine one, which are both to die for. 

As for food, it's a fusion of Cuban and Puerto Rican food. Very good empanadas, ceviche, shrimp dishes with different marinades of rice (as well as chicken, steaks, and pork in same manner), lots of bean sides, and yucca and plantains galore! The empanadas come with a great sauce!! Good portion sizes too and fun, local vibe. My friend spoke highly of the Cubano Sandwich. 

Guy Fieri filmed here for Food Network and they are super modest about it, which is cool because I'd brag about my restaurant being on TV. 

Total great date/group place and be ready to share because food envy gets real here.

excerpts: The chicken empanadas.
Wow.
The ceviche?
Yum!
empanadas.author: Marilyn O.
empanadas.review: Hands down, one of the best PRican/Cuban restaurants in SF! Better than Sol and Havana Cuba.  The food was delicious and bursting with flavor! We ordered a little bit of everything. The pork mofongo was to die for.  Soooo much flavor! The chicken empanadas.  Wow.  The ceviche? Yum! We ordered lechon (so tender and loaded with flavor), ropa vieja (the sauce tasty) and shrimp platter, which came with arroz con gandules and habichuelas.  Soooo delicious.  I just can't say enough about this place.  It's a little hole in the wall on the Mission, with beautiful decor of PR and my favorite salsa music playing in the background.  Very friendly and welcoming staff (I can't remember her name) but she took the time to chat with us for a while and getting to know us.  Never have I experienced such attention.  My only disappointment was they ran out of pasteles (my favorite) and flan.  No worries.  I'll be back!  You will not be disappointed!

excerpts: The mofongo is awesome, chicken empanadas is crispy with a light dressing on the side.
The arroz condule rice is dry.
empanadas.author: Arasi H.
empanadas.review: Service is slow, server did not greet our table or take our order until 15+ minutes later. I went on a Sunday there was hardly anybody in the restaurant. The mofongo is awesome, chicken empanadas is crispy with a light dressing on the side. The arroz condule rice is dry.

excerpts: It took us a while to decide and I ended up ordering the vegetarian mofongo and she ordered chicken empanadas, arroz con gandules, and platanos maduros.
I eat A LOT of food and the vegetarian mofongo has been the best thing I have eaten so far!
I have never tried this dish before and it blew my mind.
The crispy/crunchy/ soft combination of textures of the mofongo and the burst of flavor from the sauce gave me a mouthgasm.
empanadas.author: Stephanie L.
empanadas.review:
My girlfriend wanted me to try some puerto rican/ cuban food so we decided to come here since we were in the area.

It was a sunday night after 8, but they still let us come in.

It took us a while to decide and I ended up ordering the vegetarian mofongo and she ordered chicken empanadas, arroz con gandules, and platanos maduros. We ordered the mate soda and finished off with café con leche.

Considering I am vegetarian I could only try the platanos and they were pretty good. But let me tell you...I eat A LOT of food and the vegetarian mofongo has been the best thing I have eaten so far! I have never tried this dish before and it blew my mind. The vegetable filled mashed fried plaintain dish was topped with this creamy garlic sauce and served with white rice and beans. The crispy/crunchy/ soft combination of textures of the mofongo and the burst of flavor from the sauce gave me a mouthgasm. Even the rice tasted fantastic and was textured perfectly.

The service was phenomenal. The owner came over to chat and was super friendly! He gave us some background information on the restaurant and explained to us the food we ordered. The waitress was friendly, patient, and helpful with us ordering.

Hands down the best food and service I have experienced. I will be coming back here again for sure!

excerpts: We ordered (2) papa rellena, mofongo, alcapurrias, empanadas, and the appetizer combo (tostones, yucca con mojo, platanos maduros).
And another appetizer like a tamal, Puerto Rican version.
Made with plantains/platanos, tara root, and more!
We ordered one main dish we shared - paella.
We both ordered tropical smoothie drinks.
Like smooth tropical milkshakes.
Made with Caribbean tropical fruits.
I'm lactose intolerant, so I ditched the milk, and replaced with water.
Still so good.
All that was mentioned, you're going to have to cross-reference the menu to the pics posted on Yelp!
empanadas.author: Roger S.
empanadas.review:
I have been going to El Nuevo Fruitilandia for about 25 years! When it was kind of a dive, but great food. When I moved into the neighborhood. Yes, it's been around that long. Shows how old I am! I haven't been there in a couple of years. So I took my niece - her first time to El Nuevo Fruitilandia. As much as I love this restaurant, when operated by the former owners, I really believe the new owners have tweaked some dishes, making them just as good or better. And added some new dishes and appetizers on the menu.

My niece and I went mostly for appetizers (tapas). We ordered (2) papa rellena, mofongo, alcapurrias, empanadas, and the appetizer combo (tostones, yucca con mojo, platanos maduros). And another appetizer like a tamal, Puerto Rican version. Made with plantains/platanos, tara root, and more! We ordered one main dish we shared - paella. We both ordered tropical smoothie drinks. Like smooth tropical milkshakes. Made with Caribbean tropical fruits. I'm lactose intolerant, so I ditched the milk, and replaced with water. Still so good. All that was mentioned, you're going to have to cross-reference the menu to the pics posted on Yelp! to see the actual plates.

Did I eat everything we ordered? I could have! But I just wanted to sample and gave the rest to my niece to take home.

The decor hasn't changed much since the last owners' remodel. Actually, some of the same wall decor from the very orignal restaurant, 25 years ago. The restaurant is clean and quaint. They no longer have a guitar player in the front window area, like they used to on Friday and Saturday nights. Would be nice to have. The waiter/server was very friendly and helpful.  We ate lunch when they opened. I know dinner must get crowded.

El Nuevo Fruitilandia is an even more special place to dine for me. If you want to try Puerto Rican-Cuban cuisine, El Nuevo Fruitilandia stands out! I give them a high-5 rating! They compete well with all the new restaurants on lower 24th St (Calle 24/Veinticuatro). I think they surpass a lot of the newer trendy places. And it still has the flavor of the Mission heritage. El Nuevo Fruitilandia has been there longer than folks know. And I hope it will be there for many more years!

I showed my Yelp! coupon on my smartphone and got the discount. That paid for an appetizer+. So don't forget to mention and show when your first order. And check if they're Groupon-friendly too.

excerpts: Saturday Lechon special was great as was picadillo, chicken & beef empanadas and mango sangria!
We'll definitely be back!
empanadas.author: Angelique V.
empanadas.review: Very good Cuban & Puerto Rican food and warm, friendly service and atmosphere! Saturday Lechon special was great as was picadillo, chicken & beef empanadas and mango sangria! We'll definitely be back!

excerpts: The ground beef empanadas and papa rellenas (mashed potatoes with a bit of ground beef deep fried together) also happen to be a couple of our favorites, and they were done well.
We were very happy to see that they were served with the Thousand Island type sauce also known as "pink mayo" that is the perfect complement to both these tapas.
empanadas.author: Joanna M.
empanadas.review: We love Puerto Rican food, with Husband having grown up with it and all. We can't find any place that serves mofongo near our home in Placer County, so when we are out of town we often look for a great place to get our "mofongo fix."  Husband likes his very traditional, with pork, so this place was perfect. It serves it with pork or vegetarian. I prefer it with chicken, but the pork was very tender and, after all it IS the "other" white meat, so I can live with pork just fine. The ground beef empanadas and papa rellenas (mashed potatoes with a bit of ground beef deep fried together) also happen to be a couple of our favorites, and they were done well. We were very happy to see that they were served with the Thousand Island type sauce also known as "pink mayo" that is the perfect complement to both these tapas. It is the mofongo that you really need to come here for, though. It is not easy to find and it is so delicious!

excerpts: Empanadas were good, service was nice , but it is not worth to go back
empanadas.author: Yulia M.
empanadas.review:
Unfortunately, that place didn't work well for us. We went there around 4 o'clock on Sunday , but they already "run out" of iced tea. Restaurant was empty.
Beans were overcooked , ceviche looked like a plate of onions sprinkled with oil, we had to return it, but the waitress was very nice and she took that dish without any problems. Empanadas were good, service was nice , but it is not worth to go back

excerpts: From the beans to the salad to the empanadas.
empanadas.author: Spencer L.
empanadas.review:
This place is awesome!  Super tasty and the servers are really nice.  I had the vaca frita and it was incredible!!!  

Also their passion fruit is superb.

Was totally surprised with how good everything was.  From the beans to the salad to the empanadas. 

Overall amazing!!

excerpts: We got the Ropa vieja empanadas (crispy outside, meaty inside, with nicely cooked red peppers), the Empanadas del Espinacas (ala carte), the Plàtanos Maduros (yes, fried plantains can be even better with a little butter and Kahlua), and the Papa Rellena (Mashed potatoes filled with nicely seasoned ground beef & green peppers, fried golden brown).
empanadas.author: Vicki B.
empanadas.review:
We tried El Neuvo Fruitlandia for the first time today because we'd been looking for a place to get ropa vieja. They have it as an empanada, a sandwich, or an entree.

We got the Ropa vieja empanadas (crispy outside, meaty inside, with nicely cooked red peppers), the Empanadas del Espinacas (ala carte), the Plàtanos Maduros (yes, fried plantains can be even better with a little butter and Kahlua), and the Papa Rellena (Mashed potatoes filled with nicely seasoned ground beef & green peppers, fried golden brown).

All tasty. Service was good. We plan to return to try some of the items we had to forgo this time.

Vegetarian entrees and appetizers available as well as beef, pork, and chicken.

excerpts: The empanadas are sooo good.
empanadas.author: Me R.
empanadas.review: I love this place. Never had Puerto Rican food before eating here and they have the best. The empanadas are sooo good. I love the Ropa Vieja here. Will go here time and time again.

excerpts: We improvised and ordered vegetarian empanadas and salad and asked for any dish at all that they could make with fish or with chicken, whether or not it was on the menu.
(I don't eat pork and my friend doesn't eat shell fish).
When the server came back, she informed us there was no chicken or fish improv options AND that the vegetarian empanadas were also unavailable.
The cook did improvise a Maduro empanada for us, which was delicious.
The server was extremely kind and apologetic and they gave us a significant discount on the sangria and appetizers we ate.
Still, by the time we finished our drinks, it was too late to get food anywhere else
and I went home hungry.
I would give this place another try to see if this was a fluke.

The menu *looked* exciting and the server was really nice, but otherwise this was a total bummer for us, and probably for them too because they lost significant sales and it must have been really hard for the server too!
empanadas.author: Gabby G.
empanadas.review: Went here last night. I've been meaning to try this place for years and was really excited. When we sat down, the server informed us that several menu items were unavailable. Okay, totally normal. We ordered two entrees from the available menu items and then later were told by the server both dishes were also unavailable. Since we already had our drinks, we decided to stay. We improvised and ordered vegetarian empanadas and salad and asked for any dish at all that they could make with fish or with chicken, whether or not it was on the menu. (I don't eat pork and my friend doesn't eat shell fish). When the server came back, she informed us there was no chicken or fish improv options AND that the vegetarian empanadas were also unavailable. The cook did improvise a Maduro empanada for us, which was delicious. The server was extremely kind and apologetic and they gave us a significant discount on the sangria and appetizers we ate. Still, by the time we finished our drinks, it was too late to get food anywhere else and I went home hungry. I would give this place another try to see if this was a fluke. The menu *looked* exciting and the server was really nice, but otherwise this was a total bummer for us, and probably for them too because they lost significant sales and it must have been really hard for the server too!

excerpts: The tostonas with lemon and garlic; the spinach empanadas; the Cuban sandwiches; and flan were soooo good.
I would go back any time.
It was like being in Miami.
empanadas.author: Harvey H.
empanadas.review: Friendly, attentive service combined with delicious, authentic Cuban food. The tostonas with lemon and garlic; the spinach empanadas; the Cuban sandwiches; and flan were soooo good. I would go back any time. It was like being in Miami.

excerpts: The empanadas de espinacas were quite good and one of my meat eating friends liked the alcapurrias.
empanadas.author: Gina R.
empanadas.review: The service was pretty bad but it was a busy Friday night so not overly surprised. The food was good, the surtido which has tostones, maduros (ripe plantains) and yucca were all really good. Mofongo was a bit dry and there was only maybe three shrimp in there made it a little less dry with the sauce on it. Black beans were decent, could have used a little more flavor but it was better than the last time I went which was almost 5 years ago (judging from the review I am looking at). Also, on the menu it should say that the pink beans have pork in it because friend of mine almost ate it and she is vegetarian. She discovered this after a bite and could taste the pork. At least the server should have informed us but they were fairly busy when we got there so I guess some important details were missed. Life goes on. I would go back but not during the weekend or at least during a time that they're not so busy. I am Puerto Rican so I know what this food should taste like, so I think there's definitely room for improvement. The empanadas de espinacas were quite good and one of my meat eating friends liked the alcapurrias.

excerpts: We ordered tapas (empanadas, mofongo, sweet plantains), as well as the slow roasted pork.
We topped it off with sangria.
Everything was delicious!
empanadas.author: Nia A.
empanadas.review: Great food! We ordered tapas (empanadas, mofongo, sweet plantains), as well as the slow roasted pork. We topped it off with sangria. Everything was delicious!

excerpts: We ordered (2) papa rellena, mofongo, alcapurrias, empanadas, and the appetizer combo (tostones, yucca con mojo, platanos maduros).
And another appetizer like a tamal, Puerto Rican version.
Made with plantains/platanos, tara root, and more!
We ordered one main dish we shared - paella.
We both ordered tropical smoothie drinks.
Like smooth tropical milkshakes.
Made with Caribbean tropical fruits.
I'm lactose intolerant, so I ditched the milk, and replaced with water.
Still so good.
All that was mentioned, you're going to have to cross-reference the menu to the pics posted on Yelp!

excerpts: Yucca con mojo is always perfectly cooked, creamy and so tasty with the lemon they give you squeezed on top.
yucca con mojo.author: Suzanne S.
yucca con mojo.review:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed El Nuevo Fruitlandia yet. This place is probably the first hidden treasure I found when moving to the Mission a few years ago. My father lived in Puerto Rico and has always grumbled about the lack of Puerto Rican food in the bay area. So when he requested Carne Guisada (a slow cooked pork stew) for his birthday dinner, I thought, "hey, I'm in the Mission, I can figure this out." We were not dissapointed. El Nuevo Fruitlandia is now a family staple.

Theres a whole list of fried goodness for appetizers: the tostones (smooshed and fried slices of platano) are my favorite, although I wish they had some homemade salsa and not just tapatio. They bring you warm toasted water bread while you're waiting, too, which my sister adores. 

You can tell they've made an effort to cater to vegetarians, which I really appreciate. The chile rellenos (about $7) are the best I've had, in a rich tomato and chile sauce with bell pepers and onions. The mofongo (smashed fried yucca)we get the vegetarian) is also very good, if a bit greasy. The platanos maduros (sweet) are reminiscent of fried bananas but somehow savory and delicious with lots of hot sauce and the white rice and black beans that come with every entree. Yucca con mojo is always perfectly cooked, creamy and so tasty with the lemon they give you squeezed on top. We usually order the salad, too, which is simple but fresh and good, with cucumbers, corn, onions and romaine.

They also have lots of juices and shakes. I like the juices, but last time I got the shake and it tasted like frothy milk and sugar -- I could barely taste the fruit at all, which was weird. 

The service is very slow but that's because they make everything fresh right when you order it.

This is one of those unique little gems that reminds me how damn lucky I am to live in San Francisco.

excerpts: Had the platanos maduros which were great, but $6.50 for 6 pieces was a bit much to charge for such a small side.
platanos maduros.author: Caroline K.
platanos maduros.review:
Service was good and so was the food.  Nothing crazy good that I would cross the Bay Bridge for.

Had the veggie mofongo which was tasty and the lemon garlic shrimp.  The shrimp was good and cooked well, but it tasted more like Italian fare than Puerto Rican/Cuban.  Portion was small.  Had the platanos maduros which were great, but $6.50 for 6 pieces was a bit much to charge for such a small side.

excerpts: Checked out their menu and they had me at sangria y platanos maduros (plantains).
platanos maduros.author: Ozzy T.
platanos maduros.review: In south San Francisco for business, I ventured to explore what the city has to offer. I walked by Frutilandia as I was checking out 24th street restaurants. Checked out their menu and they had me at sangria y platanos maduros (plantains). Ordered ropa vieja after my red sangria. Sangria is delicious. I could have had maybe 2 more after my third one. Ropa vieja was very good accompanied with my fried platanos. Yum! The owner Rafeal introduced himself & made me feel more welcome in his restaurants. It was like being at a friends house. This place is worth checking out because I'm definitely going to frequent when in the city. Hasta pronto Rafa!

excerpts: However, this is the only Puerto Rican food I've found in the mission, and the platanos maduros were pretty delicious.
I wish I had ordered the soup instead of salad!
I'll be back, but the value isn't great.
platanos maduros.author: Cecilia C.
platanos maduros.review:
I ordered the Pierna de Puerco Horneada and it was pretty tastey but lacked that down-home-abuela-made-it taste. I feel like maybe it's the 80s generation in the kitchen. It does have some soul to it but not 100%. I found the portions are too small for this style of restaurant. A $15 plate of rice, beans, and pork done right should be hard to finish, if not impossible. But I ordered on GrubHub, maybe that's why it was small? Anyway I picked it up, walked two blocks home, and when I got there most of the food was cold. It wasn't cold out either. I asked for pink beans but they were black. BUT I also picked it up 15 minutes before closing, so I didn't take points off for that.

However, this is the only Puerto Rican food I've found in the mission, and the platanos maduros were pretty delicious. I wish I had ordered the soup instead of salad! I'll be back, but the value isn't great.

excerpts: We ordered quite a bit as we wwere starving: Pastel Puertorriquenos, Platanos Maduros, Alcapurria, Tostones con Mojo de Ajo, Cubano sandwich, Passion fruit shake, and sweet potato fries.
Everything tasted fine.. just not out of this world.
On the other hand, service was really good.
The place is cute, I like the location at the Mission.
Not a bad place at all.
platanos maduros.author: Vol T.
platanos maduros.review: I'm a fan of Puerto Rican/ Cuban food and have eaten quite a bit of it. This was just ok. We ordered quite a bit as we wwere starving: Pastel Puertorriquenos, Platanos Maduros, Alcapurria, Tostones con Mojo de Ajo, Cubano sandwich, Passion fruit shake, and sweet potato fries. Everything tasted fine.. just not out of this world. On the other hand, service was really good. The place is cute, I like the location at the Mission. Not a bad place at all.

So when he requested Carne Guisada (a slow cooked pork stew) for his birthday dinner, I thought, "hey, I'm in the Mission, I can figure this out." We were not dissapointed. El Nuevo Fruitlandia is now a family staple.

Theres a whole list of fried goodness for appetizers: the tostones (smooshed and fried slices of platano) are my favorite, although I wish they had some homemade salsa and not just tapatio. They bring you warm toasted water bread while you're waiting, too, which my sister adores. 

You can tell they've made an effort to cater to vegetarians, which I really appreciate. The chile rellenos (about $7) are the best I've had, in a rich tomato and chile sauce with bell pepers and onions. The mofongo (smashed fried yucca)we get the vegetarian) is also very good, if a bit greasy. The platanos maduros (sweet) are reminiscent of fried bananas but somehow savory and delicious with lots of hot sauce and the white rice and black beans that come with every entree. Yucca con mojo is always perfectly cooked, creamy and so tasty with the lemon they give you squeezed on top. We usually order the salad, too, which is simple but fresh and good, with cucumbers, corn, onions and romaine.

They also have lots of juices and shakes. I like the juices, but last time I got the shake and it tasted like frothy milk and sugar -- I could barely taste the fruit at all, which was weird. 

The service is very slow but that's because they make everything fresh right when you order it.

This is one of those unique little gems that reminds me how damn lucky I am to live in San Francisco.

excerpts: We ordered quite a bit as we wwere starving: Pastel Puertorriquenos, Platanos Maduros, Alcapurria, Tostones con Mojo de Ajo, Cubano sandwich, Passion fruit shake, and sweet potato fries.
Everything tasted fine.. just not out of this world.
On the other hand, service was really good.
The place is cute, I like the location at the Mission.
Not a bad place at all.
tostones con mojo de ajo.author: Vol T.
tostones con mojo de ajo.review: I'm a fan of Puerto Rican/ Cuban food and have eaten quite a bit of it. This was just ok. We ordered quite a bit as we wwere starving: Pastel Puertorriquenos, Platanos Maduros, Alcapurria, Tostones con Mojo de Ajo, Cubano sandwich, Passion fruit shake, and sweet potato fries. Everything tasted fine.. just not out of this world. On the other hand, service was really good. The place is cute, I like the location at the Mission. Not a bad place at all.

excerpts: Tostones con Mojo de ajo

: Your date will thank you 
Sopa de Pollo:
tostones con mojo de ajo.author: Jonathan C.
tostones con mojo de ajo.review:
I'm not Puerto Rican, but does it really matter? 

Good food is good food & Fruitlandia hasn't disappointed in the two times I've been in a 4-day period. 

Order this and you'll be happy: 
Molfondo w/Gravy: Totally F-yeah worthy & the server loves to say how good it is (and you'll love when she does). 
Tostones con Mojo de ajo: Your date will thank you 
Sopa de Pollo: Better than anything your mother makes (seriously, pass on the dinner salad and get the damn soup)

By the way, whoever said the wine is expensive is a total dummy. $3 is like less than 2 bus rides.

excerpts: The ceviche mixto was pretty delicious.
Came here with a groupon.
The one waitress was very nice, welcoming, but seemed kind of flustered.
The food was Okay to good.
I wouldn't rave about it, but I wouldn't mind coming back here again.
ceviche mixto.author: Josie W.
ceviche mixto.review:
This place was cute. The ceviche mixto was pretty delicious. Came here with a groupon. The one waitress was very nice, welcoming, but seemed kind of flustered. The food was Okay to good. I wouldn't rave about it, but I wouldn't mind coming back here again. Food seemed fresh.

I got the shrimp with Creole camarones (Shrimp with the creole Caribbean sauce). It was good, but kind of salty. My brother got the Wednesday special Pork chop with mango sauce. The pork itself was not bad, but the sauce was AMAZING to me! My brother thought it was okay, so we switched plates :D

Beans were good. Rice was good. Place seemed authentic and quaint.

-1 star for the wait time. Our ceviche came out right away (within 5-10 minutes), but we waited ~45 minutes for our food to come out, which is a little ridiculous considering we were the second table to be seated right as they opened. We also came on a Tuesday once, and they weren't open. We waited 10 minutes past 6PM and I didn't see anyone, no signs, nothing.

-0.5 stars for it being above average food, but not the best I've ever had. 3.5 stars but will round to 4 because this place is cute.

excerpts: Out of Ceviche Mixto.
ceviche mixto.author: Ziyan C.
ceviche mixto.review:
This is a cute hole-in-the-wall spot for some Cuban fare. I enjoyed my food but didn't love it; then again, I don't think I generally love Cuban food. Our server wasn't completely reliable for a casual meal it's not a huge deal. 

THE WAIT: None on a Thursday night at about 7:30pm.

THE SERVICE: Not amazing. When our server first came around, she asked me three times in one conversation if I wanted a drink. Either she really wanted me to order a drink, or she legitimately forgot. She would forget little things--for example, she brought our Mofongo out and said she'd bring share plates but never did. 

COST: $68 total for 2 drinks, 1 app, 2 entrees, 1 dessert. A little pricey for the quality. Our dinner receipt: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#jsa9v2WGbdsloXiu0HJg_Q

MUST-HAVES: Tres Leches! The Mofongo was pretty good too.

Out of Ceviche Mixto.

TAPAS, SANDWICHES, DAILY SPECIALS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#AmMGmTKSA9KMKYDcDCLp5A
* Mofongo (garlic mashed plantains filled w/ our "Signature" roasted pork, topped w/ a tomato sofrito $10) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#dSuEbtPP887h3bE4-_RRiQ
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#jf6UgPeC9TJKuiTVsW2DLg
pork filling: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#qqrslAHkj0NxfUjCvLcrXQ
Normally I'm not overly impressed with mashed plantains, but the fact that this was filled with this tasty roasted pork, the plantains had soaked up the meaty flavor, and the pork had soaked up all these great flavors, made this really unique and tasty!


SALADS, ENTREES (pt. 1): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w
* Lechon Horneado (succulent slow roast pork marinated in garlic, pineapple, Caribbean spices $14) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#-jA4oaVrkuxWf5FcYfflsA
Very juicy, tender pork. For this cut of meat, it's still a little on the dry side. Compared to my pork chops, this was much more moist. It's drenched in sauce, but biting through a thick chunk of meat, you do get to the dryer (though still soft) meat in the middle. Just me being picky. Rice & black beans were good.


ENTREES (pt. 2), SANGRIA: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#N3MQSz_pOTi4bB1_t4mniQ
* Chuletas de Cerdo Fritas (pork chops spiced w/ garlic & mango sauce, topped w/ sauteed onions $14) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#6hlk7Zo3gw5cQfxC1n3ibg
I was intrigued by the mango sauce, but couldn't taste this at all in the end. This ended up being a very basic pork chop dish, nothing too special. Came with rice & black beans.

* Guava Sangria (white wine, guava $6.50) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#hBXdP8R1BC4DPL6I4LnHjA
Light flavor-wise, like a tropical sangria. My boyfriend got a glass of this and moved to the Mango Sangria, which basically tasted like a red sangria.

Mango Sangria

SWEET TREATS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#nY5oZV87SJF1MUdHPKlSog
* Tres Leches Cake (sponge cake soaked in evaporated milk, condensed milk & heavy cream, topped w/ cream cheese frosting $7) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#bpTQFcVHPgRVu6w1u1pOsQ
Wow, that was a *thick* layer of cream cheese frosting on top! I love my sweets but that was a little too intense. However, on the cake--I've been on the hunt for an amazing tres leches in SF and I think I've found my holy grail. This was intensely soft, moist, and heaven in our mouths.

yucca frita.review: The food was really good. I enjoyed the ropa vieja, the meat was tender and just right. The service is soooooo warm and inviting.
Food is great!
Can't wait to come back to this beautiful gem on 24th street...
yucca frita.author: Jill P.
yucca frita.review: This place is amazing.  I went here for the first time back in 2008 and food was not all that great.  Kind of dry, the alcapurrias were oily and it didn't really appeal to my palate.  Fast forward 9 years later, and under new ownership, the place is awesome.  Food is fresh and cooked made to order, the setting is cute and quaint and displays the flags of Cuba and Puerto Rico adjacent to each other.  We ordered the plantains, pollo a la española, pasteles, yucca frita, and they gave us tostones on the house! The service is soooooo warm and inviting.  Food is great! Can't wait to come back to this beautiful gem on 24th street...

On the walls you can see that Marc Anthony and Jennifer Lopez have already eaten there. Not much has changed from the time I was a six to now, except they added "Nuevo" to its name.

The sangria was yummy too!
Can't wait to go back!!
chuletas.author: Diane F.
chuletas.review: Delicious Cuban and Puerto Rican food!  I was searching for a PR restaurant serving alcapurria, finally found it here and it was delicious!!!!!  Mofongo, was excellent and moist!  (most places I've had it make it too dry, not here!!). Chuletas were moist and perfectly seasoned!!  The sangria was yummy too!  Can't wait to go back!!

excerpts: For my entree, I happened to be there on a Wednesday, so I took advantage of the daily special, the $12.25 Arroz con Pollo.
arroz con pollo.author: Ed U.
arroz con pollo.review:
Even though there has been a cafe of one kind or another in this space for over three decades, it wasn't until I passed by during the recent Sunday Streets event that I happen to notice there are new owners who now serve Cuban and Puerto Rican cuisine. That's great news in a city seriously bereft of it. There's Paladar on Kearny, but they don't serve hot food after 3PM. There's Chan Chan west of the Castro - which I've never tried - but am a bit wary because of their constant Groupon deals. There was Charanga in the Mission and Laurel's in Hayes Valley, but both quietly closed. I didn't realize I missed them until they were gone. Gee, I sound like Joni Mitchell. Cuban, when done wrong, can get pretty greasy, a calorific nightmare, but when done right, I've liked it a lot like at the late, lamented Charanga.

Maybe Cuban food is too rarefied to catch on here, but owners Rafael and Tyrisha Frias and their chef Gary Millar are certainly putting their best foot forward in this space. From my recent solo dining experience there, the results are promising. I started with a house specialty, the $4.50 small bowl of Chicken Soup (Sopa de Pollo) which was definitely chock full of vegetables, a bit disintegrated from probably being in the pot for a while. There was also a tad too much oil in the broth since I noticed bubbles, but the soup was hot and flavorful with plenty of shards of chicken to satisfy and pepper sauce on the side for an optional extra kick (see photo). For my entree, I happened to be there on a Wednesday, so I took advantage of the daily special, the $12.25 Arroz con Pollo.

That was a nice plate of chicken pieces cooked with sauteed peppers and onions, and lots of spices. The saffron rice, which I assumed was cooked with the chicken, was especially delicious when mixed with the black beans (see photo). Satisfying home cooking for sure, although I was hoping the chicken parts were a bit bigger than they were, just my preference. It's a nice casual place, sadly not that busy, and the owners are quite friendly. Rafael is from Mexico, but he, his wife and Millar appear to have a sure hand in preparing and presenting these dishes. The $5 Yelp deal was definitely a good move, though they may want to up the amount like Arabian Nights does if they want to bring in more new business. Some trova musicians could liven the place up, too. I'll be back when I feel like a touch of Habana in my soul.

FOOD - 4 stars...solid home cooking, Cuban style, just needs a tad more refinement
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...pretty low key, maybe a bit more music from the Buena Vista Social Club could help
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...really friendly and attentive
TOTAL - 4 stars...I liked it and I think Ricky Ricardo would, too

excerpts: I got the slow roasted pork the first time and the second time I asked for Arroz con pollo (which wasn't on the menu that day but they made it for me!).
The arroz was not the usual kind I am used to eating
arroz con pollo.author: Gordon O.
arroz con pollo.review:
Have been here twice and both were great experiences! I got the slow roasted pork the first time and the second time I asked for Arroz con pollo (which wasn't on the menu that day but they made it for me!). The arroz was not the usual kind I am used to eating but it was definitely delicious, the chicken was tender and very flavorful. 

All entrees come with either soup or salad, the soup is definitely a home run! 

The people who run the place are very nice and sweet. I'd definitely come back to this place.

excerpts: 3.5 The arroz con pollo was fantastic!
arroz con pollo.author: Cassie C.
arroz con pollo.review: 3.5 The arroz con pollo was fantastic! The mofongo was good. Cool spot...kinda slow service, but not super expensive either. Biggest disappointment: they gave us styrofoam boxes.

excerpts: The LECHON HORNEADO was a nice  dish with good amount of pork.
Both main courses came with Puerto Rican rice and black beans.
To begin our meal our server took our order and just left the menu on the table which I though was odd.
The sever came back and told us one of our appetizers was sold out but was not taken off our bill .
Our food was given to us without plates We asked for  some and was given 2 small appetizer plates for the main courses.
Finally right before we were about to finish our meal the manager came over and said "cash only".
Our credit card system is down.
Since my credit card company gives double points per dollar I lost out pretty good on a $60 tab.
A little annoying since I don't like to carry cash on hand.
We were never asked if our food was good or needed anything else.
Poor customer service.
Your not going to get repeat business with that kind of service.
lechon horneado.author: Alan L.
lechon horneado.review:
In reading some past reviews my fellow yelpers hit the nail on the head. The food is good, the server / management is suspect to some criticism. 
We ordered the TOSTONES CON MOJO which were tasty. The 
MOFONGO with shrimp was a bit over priced for the amount of shrimp given. 2 whole shrimp with a small amount of chopped up shrimp.The POLLO A LA ESPAÑOLA had  a nice  house Caribbean butternut carrot spiced sauce. The white chicken was a little dry of the sauce saved the day. The LECHON HORNEADO was a nice  dish with good amount of pork. Both main courses came with Puerto Rican rice and black beans.
To begin our meal our server took our order and just left the menu on the table which I though was odd. The sever came back and told us one of our appetizers was sold out but was not taken off our bill . Our food was given to us without plates We asked for  some and was given 2 small appetizer plates for the main courses. 
Finally right before we were about to finish our meal the manager came over and said "cash only". Our credit card system is down. Since my credit card company gives double points per dollar I lost out pretty good on a $60 tab. A little annoying since I don't like to carry cash on hand.
We were never asked if our food was good or needed anything else. Poor customer service.
Your not going to get repeat business with that kind of service.

excerpts: I still stuck with the plan and ordered the Lechon Horneado, and then decided on splitting their specialty Veggie Mofongo with my friends.

Veggie Mofongo -- http://bit.ly/2a49ngu
Hand mashed garlic plantains topped with a tomato sofrito
This was really good!
The plantain mash was moist and had some good flavor together with the tomato sofrito
I was really surprised with the portion size because it was huge!
If you're dining here solo, unless you have a huge appetite, I wouldn't order this if you plan to order an entree after it.
This really could be a meal in itself.
Especially if you get one of the mofongos stuffed with meat.

Lechon Horneado -- http://bit.ly/29IaNI4
Slow roasted pork marinated in garlic, pineapple, caribbean spices.

Ordered with Arroz Con Grandules which is Puerto Rican style rice with pigeon peas, smoked ham and bacon
Finally!!
And the first bite I had of the pork took me back to when I enjoyed it at the SF Street Food Fest.
Just like I described earlier, the Lechon is so tender and the flavor just explodes in your mouth!
They have it down to a science!
The Arroz Con Grandules is a must order with the Lechon.
It's almost like a ham and bacon paella and just completes the whole pork trinity.
And I must mention the portion size, it's a lot of food!!
Because I had the mofongo earlier, I was only able to finish half of my dish.
It will be extremely hard to resist ordering another Lechon Horneado though.
It's so good!!!
lechon horneado.author: Rodney H.
lechon horneado.review:
I remember first trying El Nuevo Frutilandia when they were at the San Francisco Street Food Festival a few years back.  I had their Lechon and it blew my mind (bit.ly/1kKi5zG).  The pork was so tender and flavorful!  So after totally enjoying that sampling,  I was really looking forward to visiting their restaurant.  Well it took a while, but I finally made it over with a few friends.

Even though I was completely set on ordering their Lechon, there were a lot of things on the menu that sounded tempting like their Cubano Sandwich, their Tostones Con Mojo, their Garlic Shrimp (Limon Ajo Camarones), and Chile Relleno.  I still stuck with the plan and ordered the Lechon Horneado, and then decided on splitting their specialty Veggie Mofongo with my friends.  We also ordered a pitcher of their Guava Sangria.

Guava Sangria -- http://bit.ly/29VYBpT
White wine, guava
Very refreshing!  And it paired well with everything we ordered.  If you're going with a small group of people, definitely order the pitcher!!

Veggie Mofongo -- http://bit.ly/2a49ngu
Hand mashed garlic plantains topped with a tomato sofrito
This was really good!  The plantain mash was moist and had some good flavor together with the tomato sofrito  I was really surprised with the portion size because it was huge!  If you're dining here solo, unless you have a huge appetite, I wouldn't order this if you plan to order an entree after it.  This really could be a meal in itself.  Especially if you get one of the mofongos stuffed with meat.  I was definitely glad I was splitting this with my friends.

Lechon Horneado -- http://bit.ly/29IaNI4
Slow roasted pork marinated in garlic, pineapple, caribbean spices.  Ordered with Arroz Con Grandules which is Puerto Rican style rice with pigeon peas, smoked ham and bacon
Finally!!  And the first bite I had of the pork took me back to when I enjoyed it at the SF Street Food Fest.  Just like I described earlier, the Lechon is so tender and the flavor just explodes in your mouth!  They have it down to a science!  The Arroz Con Grandules is a must order with the Lechon.  It's almost like a ham and bacon paella and just completes the whole pork trinity.  And I must mention the portion size, it's a lot of food!!  Because I had the mofongo earlier, I was only able to finish half of my dish.

Overall, I say El Nuevo Frutilandia is must try in the Mission!  It's a really good spot when you're in the mood for some Cuban comfort food.  The food is delicious, huge portions, and the prices are easy on your wallet.  I definitely plan on returning again to try their Cubano Sandwich, and also all their other entrees since the whole menu sounds amazing.  It will be extremely hard to resist ordering another Lechon Horneado though.  It's so good!!!

lechon horneado.author: Paolo R.
lechon horneado.review: Damn, what a joy it is to have another Caribbean joint to go to in SF. The shortage of Caribbean and South American food in San Francisco always drives me crazy and Frutilandia capably fills a giant void. Before you balk, let me clarify, Mexico is in North America and El Salvador is in Central America and the cuisine in both is very different from what is common in other regions of Latin America. The only other Caribbean spot in the city that is as authentic being Parada 22. Frutilandia is Caribbean in multiple ways, one of them being that the place is very casual and unrushed, you never feel like you are expected to eat and leave. The emapanadas here are perfectly done, perfect texture and flavor. The lechon horneado (oven roasted pork) is incredibly flavorful and juicy. I highly recommend having a side of yuca with your entree. Be aware, the sangria here is very sweet and fruity which is exactly how I prefer it. There are so many items on the menu I've yet to try that I'm always giddy when I find myself in the area so I can have a new adventure.

lechon horneado.author: Hope A.
lechon horneado.review:
My husband and I tried this place last night. We were greeted by a friendly woman,( I'm assuming she is the owner.) We ordered the tostone's, mmm. They had this delicious garlic lemon sauce and were salted just enough. We also shared the veggie mofongo tapa, which was heartier than expected and smothered in a delicious tomato sauce that was comforting, it had a taste from home. I also tried the mango sangria, I couldn't taste the mango, but the sangria was really refreshing. I had to have a second glass!
For our entree's: I had the Limon Ajo Camarones, I loved this dish. The flavor of the sauce was so good, lemony garlic and the prawns were cleaned and cooked just right! The rice and cuban black beans had a good flavor too. Great portion size. I was stuffed!
My husband enjoyed the Lechon Horneado. So flavorful and moist, also a great portion size.. If you like pork? This dish is absolutely amazing! I tasted it and it had so much flavor. 
We will definitely be going back! This place is a hidden gem. I never had even noticed it until I yelped Cuban food. The interior is really cute, and makes you feel like you are on a mini-vacay. Friendly people and service, and really fresh and tasty quality food!

mofongo vegetariano.author: Denis A.
mofongo vegetariano.review:
Sorry to report: El Nuevo Frutilandia is not even mediocre food at best.  

Unfortunately,  I struggled giving this spot 2 stars. Came here for dinner on 11-25-12; I ordered the Puerto Rico sandwich which was bland and they skimped me on the steak meat (see pics). Also, the fries that came with the my meal were loaded with so much grease they shined.

My wife ordered the Spinach empanada con queso (1 of 3 veggie options). Ten minutes into our wait, our server informs us they are out of empanadas- grrr.  The server then recommended the only other vegetarian options which were the chili relleno or mofongo vegetariano. Since my toddler son was sharing the plate we opted with the mofongo vegetariano (consisting of plaintains, rice, beans). 

My sandwich came soon after we got my wife's order straightened out which left me in a small dilemna.  Either let my food get cold waiting for my wife's meal or chow down in front of her. Our server saw my hesitation and informed me that I should eat since her meal would be a while. 

As I am munching down on my Puerto Rico sandwich, I realize my sandwich looks nothing like the pics on Yelp and how terrible it tastes. With each bite of my sandwich I taste more bread and lettuce than any meat.  Where is all the savory meat? Did they run out of this also? I decide to take inventory, so I open my sandwich to reveal less than six strips of steak meat (see pic). and for over $10. Verdict: F-

The second entree (mofongo vegetariano) eventually arrives and that also is not met with satisfaction-- not much flavor, small portions.  

But a huge plus is in order for the house made sangria (white wine) which I was looking forward to (1st star).  However I was craving a red wine sangria but the white wine sangria was pretty awesome served mixed with apple, orange, lemon slices, etc (see pic). But at $6 a glass... well let's just say, they can do better. 

Space is tight in this restaurant.  My little boy wouldn't sit still and without the availability of a high chair (the only other one was occupied), he had to eat on our lap during dinner.  Tip: Be prepared to wait.  Usually, I am pretty patient when it comes to wait times, but I did observe the couple next to us grow frustrated from the wait, and finally they paid and left without the food they ordered. 

In terms of ambiance/vibe, there was Latin music playing, but with all the yelling and clamor from within the kitchen and amongst staff, it made it hard to have a conversation at the dinner table.

Maybe I came on an off night, but with so many choices in the area, I cannot see myself returning or recommending this spot.
 
The deal (2nd star): Used a groupon deal I purchased for $20 that got me two sangria drinks and two entrees.  

(+) Latin music playing
(-) long wait for dinner
(-) cramped restaurant
(-) limited veggie options
(- -) My Puerto Rico Sandwich was a huge disappointment.  It lacked meat and flavor (see pics).
