excerpts: For our entree's: I had the Limon Ajo Camarones, I loved this dish.
The flavor of the sauce was so good, lemony garlic and the prawns were cleaned and cooked just right!
The rice and cuban black beans had a good flavor too.
Great portion size.
I was stuffed!
limon ajo camarones.author: Hope A.
limon ajo camarones.review:
My husband and I tried this place last night. We were greeted by a friendly woman,( I'm assuming she is the owner.) We ordered the tostone's, mmm. They had this delicious garlic lemon sauce and were salted just enough. We also shared the veggie mofongo tapa, which was heartier than expected and smothered in a delicious tomato sauce that was comforting, it had a taste from home. I also tried the mango sangria, I couldn't taste the mango, but the sangria was really refreshing. I had to have a second glass!
For our entree's: I had the Limon Ajo Camarones, I loved this dish. The flavor of the sauce was so good, lemony garlic and the prawns were cleaned and cooked just right! The rice and cuban black beans had a good flavor too. Great portion size. I was stuffed!
My husband enjoyed the Lechon Horneado. So flavorful and moist, also a great portion size.. If you like pork? This dish is absolutely amazing! I tasted it and it had so much flavor. 
We will definitely be going back! This place is a hidden gem. I never had even noticed it until I yelped Cuban food. The interior is really cute, and makes you feel like you are on a mini-vacay. Friendly people and service, and really fresh and tasty quality food!

excerpts: They both came with sides of white rice and taro chips.
The white rice had a nice kick of flavor, it was a perfect side and so were the chips.
The whole meal evened each other out.
Along with the great food was friendly smiles of our servers.
they were all so kind to us!!
Thank you very much for a delicious meal, we look forward to coming back.
white rice.author: Vanessa D.
white rice.review:
My boyfriend and I passed by this restaurant a few months ago and we FINALLY got the chance to try it. We were so excited and the location is beautiful, right in the heart of Mission District.

We started out with chicken and picadillo empanadas with a side of tostones. That already set the bar high for our entrees, it was so delicious! Filled with flavor and the meats were cooked so well. The empanadas were both crispy and golden, yum.

Our entrees came, he got the ropa vieja and I got the Chile relleno with chicken. They both came with sides of white rice and taro chips. The white rice had a nice kick of flavor, it was a perfect side and so were the chips. The whole meal evened each other out. Along with the great food was friendly smiles of our servers. they were all so kind to us!! Thank you very much for a delicious meal, we look forward to coming back.

excerpts: Finished off with a Vaca Frita with white rice and black beans that brought back some memories of Miami.
It's a small location but highly recommend it to all.
white rice.author: Ruben R.
white rice.review: For a Cuban living in Santa Cruz the trip to the city for this was way worth it.  Had some tostones and yuca frita. Both were great. Finished off with a Vaca Frita with white rice and black beans that brought back some memories of Miami. It's a small location but highly recommend it to all.

excerpts: The vegetable filled mashed fried plaintain dish was topped with this creamy garlic sauce and served with white rice and beans.
white rice.author: Stephanie L.
white rice.review:
My girlfriend wanted me to try some puerto rican/ cuban food so we decided to come here since we were in the area.

It was a sunday night after 8, but they still let us come in.

It took us a while to decide and I ended up ordering the vegetarian mofongo and she ordered chicken empanadas, arroz con gandules, and platanos maduros. We ordered the mate soda and finished off with café con leche.

Considering I am vegetarian I could only try the platanos and they were pretty good. But let me tell you...I eat A LOT of food and the vegetarian mofongo has been the best thing I have eaten so far! I have never tried this dish before and it blew my mind. The vegetable filled mashed fried plaintain dish was topped with this creamy garlic sauce and served with white rice and beans. The crispy/crunchy/ soft combination of textures of the mofongo and the burst of flavor from the sauce gave me a mouthgasm. Even the rice tasted fantastic and was textured perfectly.

The service was phenomenal. The owner came over to chat and was super friendly! He gave us some background information on the restaurant and explained to us the food we ordered. The waitress was friendly, patient, and helpful with us ordering.

Hands down the best food and service I have experienced. I will be coming back here again for sure!

excerpts: I ordered the mofongo vegetariano, plaintanos meduros, and a side of white rice and black beans.
My roommate had the buttermilk chicken and ate ever last bite.
All of the portions are decent sized and the plates are put together beautifully.
The food was amazing.
10000 times better than any other Puerto Rican restaurants in the Bay Area (except for a certain sol food in San Rafael).
The service was meh, but the food trumped all.
We ate every last bite.
After we paid, the chef came out to our table to introduce himself and ask how we liked the food.
He said to ask for anything vegetarian next time and he'll do it (;
white rice.author: Emma G.
white rice.review:
My roommate and I came here around 9 PM on a Saturday night (they close at 10 on sat) and about 1/3rd of the restaurant was full. It's a little hidden gem off of 24th that I've had bookmarked for a while and I'm so glad we finally went. 
 The ambiance is very San Juan and colorful, the whole place is really cute. I'm vegetarian, and everything on the menu sounded amazing to me. Puerto Rican restaurants hardly offer vegetarian dishes, and this place had tons of options. I ordered the mofongo vegetariano, plaintanos meduros, and a side of white rice and black beans. My roommate had the buttermilk chicken and ate ever last bite. All of the portions are decent sized and the plates are put together beautifully. 
The food was amazing. 10000 times better than any other Puerto Rican restaurants in the Bay Area (except for a certain sol food in San Rafael). The service was meh, but the food trumped all. We ate every last bite. 
After we paid, the chef came out to our table to introduce himself and ask how we liked the food. He said to ask for anything vegetarian next time and he'll do it (;

excerpts: It came with a large-ish plate of al dente black beans and steamed white rice, again allowed to shine in subtlety and simplicity.
white rice.author: Ari T.
white rice.review:
My first-ever visit, 1:30pm Saturday lunchtime. Prompt, friendly service, from start to finish. Still, the food was the real star of this experience. Even my own homemade-from-scratch chicken soup can't hold a candle to their delicious chicken soup. It really is a don't-miss.

I was tempted by the Saturday special, but decided to risk fish, which is so hard to get right and so easy to get wrong. Am I glad I went for it! I ordered Filete De Pargo-- red snapper fillet sauteed in olive oil, garlic, lemon and parsley.  It was the best fish dish I've had in years; delicate, moist, skinless, perfect done-ness. The olive oil, garlic, lemon and parsley were so subtle as to allow the fresh fish itself to shine. Yum. 

It came with a large-ish plate of al dente black beans and steamed white rice, again allowed to shine in subtlety and simplicity.

I'm not familiar with Puerto Rican or Cuban cuisines, so can't draw comparisons with other chefs, or with this same restaurant under previous ownership. Today's food was so spectacular and reasonably priced that I will be back. I'm glad that the new (7 months, he said) owners decided to take it over, to keep the restaurant open.

The restaurant is tiny, with very "live" acoustics, so not so easy to carry on a conversation; one happy family with lots of laughter pretty-much dominated the soundscape during my meal. Family-friendly. Clean little restroom.

I asked how the restaurant got its name. He said it began as a fruit smoothies shop. I'd been expecting a more exotic explanation. LOL!

excerpts: Lots of chunks of chicken with a  side of white rice and a cup of black beans.
The Chile Rellenos was a work of art.
Perfect in every way.
We have found another favorite restaurant.
The place is small.
But even on a Saturday night, we managed to get a table right away without a reservation.
It's old, we were told they have been there for 40 years.
But that's was so much of the charm.
I love these "hole in the wall" places that put the fancy schmancy restaurants to shame!
Don't dine in if you're in a hurry.
They must make everything to order
so it takes a little bit to get your dinner.
It's so worth the wait.
If you must be somewhere and you're pressed for time, they do take out and  you can call ahead.
Check out their web site.
And GO!
white rice.author: Reba Jane S.
white rice.review:
Oh My Goodness!  If you ever find yourself in the Mission/Market area, find this place!  We stopped by for dinner because we wanted a place to eat that was going to be near where our main attraction was.  We didn't want Mexican, again.  We have found scrumptious Mexican food in this same area, but we just wanted something a little bit different.
This place served it up!
Not only were the wait staff very friendly, when we pointed at the menu for lack of being able to pronounce what we wanted, we were given head nods and smiles.  Very warm and inviting.
We started with their house shake.  They let us combine fruits so we kind of got a custom shake.  This is a Batidos.  So creamy with finely crushed ice.  Perfect start since we were really thirsty.
Next our salad were brought to us.  Just a little cup of salad.  House dressing was different.  Nothing much to shout about here, but it was good and we ate all our vegetables.
Next came dinner.   We ordered Chile Rellenos and Filete de Pollo a la Española.  Some one in the kitchen was making MAGIC!  The sauce for the chicken dish was so good.  Good is not a strong enough word.  This dish was not spicy.  It was not chili hot.  But it was real down home comfort food.  Lots of chunks of chicken with a  side of white rice and a cup of black beans.   The Chile Rellenos was a work of art.  Perfect in every way.  We have found another favorite restaurant.  
The place is small.  But even on a Saturday night, we managed to get a table right away without a reservation.  It's old, we were told they have been there for 40 years.  But that's was so much of the charm.  I love these "hole in the wall" places that put the fancy schmancy restaurants to shame!
Don't dine in if you're in a hurry.  They must make everything to order so it takes a little bit to get your dinner.  It's so worth the wait.  If you must be somewhere and you're pressed for time, they do take out and  you can call ahead.  Check out their web site.  And GO!

excerpts: It had a tiny scoop of white rice, a tiny cup of black beans and a tiny scoop of meat.
Both plates together would barely have even been enough to feed one hungry person.
We were one hungry person and one filled-up-on-Phil'z person and it was nowhere near enough food.
The server was so nice and we tipped him very generously, of course based on our pre-discounted total and he seemed very grateful.
Unfortunately we will not return though because in order to fill our appetites we would need to spend about $40 and ain't nobody got time for that at lunchtime.
white rice.author: Emma H.
white rice.review:
My husband and I wandered in here because Yelp had a check-in-offer for 15% off our bill ;) We ordered Mofongo and the Ropa Vieja because they are classic Puerto Rican dishes and could serve as a sort of control group. The Mofongo came out a very small portion, molded on the plate in the shape of a dome with a (kinda stale) plantain chip sticking out. It was very good, we thoroughly enjoyed it but it was gone in 4 bites. The really surprising thing was that the Ropa Vieja was even skimpier. It was on a plate that you would expect to hold a side dinner salad. It had a tiny scoop of white rice, a tiny cup of black beans and a tiny scoop of meat. Both plates together would barely have even been enough to feed one hungry person. We were one hungry person and one filled-up-on-Phil'z person and it was nowhere near enough food. 
The server was so nice and we tipped him very generously, of course based on our pre-discounted total and he seemed very grateful. Unfortunately we will not return though because in order to fill our appetites we would need to spend about $40 and ain't nobody got time for that at lunchtime.

excerpts: The dish was served with a side of white rice.
white rice.author: Frida V.
white rice.review:
Don't ask me how I know the owners, but I do.  For all the concerned people questioning the motherland of the owners, they are from El Salvador.  The husband and wife worked for the original owners and learned all the recipes.  Okay enough personal background.  

We went for my mother-in-laws BDay with a party of 10.5 adults (expecting mom) and 1 child.  Because it is only one person cooking we were there forever!  For appetizers we ordered the following

Yucca en ajo.  2 stars.  The yucca was boiled in a garlicky broth but failed to absorb much of the flavor.  The garlic broth was delicious however when we soaked the bread in it.

Tostones  4 stars.  On par with what tostones are supposed to be like.

Platanos fritos con crema Y frijoles fritos (fried plantains w/ refried beans and creme) 5 stars.  Although the bean to platanos ratio was not equal.

I ordered the ropa vieja.  3.5 stars.  I only have a cuban rest. in San Jose to compare it too.  I could tell the meat had been slow cooked for some time in the ingredient's and had absorbed all the flavors wonderfully.  However, the flavors were not unique and did little to distinguish themselves from Mexican flavors.  The dish was served with a side of white rice.

My husband ordered a shrimp dish in a spicy tomatoes broth. 4 stars.  
I sampled a shrimp and it tasted very fresh and well cooked.  The "spicy" broth  sauce was mild.  

Most of the adults ordered the steak sandwich, which I am kicking myself for not ordering instead.  Very big portion, juicy steak, but I did not taste it so I cant rate.

Someone else had the garlic shrimp, but had similar results as the yucca. Again I did not taste, just repeating what the other diner said.

KEY TIP!!

If you have the choice between side salad or soup, ORDER the soup.  I made the mistake of ordering the salad...it was a joke!  It was made up of chopped lettuce, canned vegetable medley (cubed carrots, green beans and peas) with a nonexistent dressing.  It was a waste of food.

The soup on the other hand, was a small bowl of chicken soup.  Very good.

Overall, I would go again to try the steak sandwich and support the owners.

excerpts: * White Rice
white rice.author: Seth R.
white rice.review:
Its a Cuban Restaurant that has some Puerto Rican specialties. 
I had the:
* Puerto Rican Pasteles
* White Rice
* Pink Beans 
* Fried Green Plantains (tostones)

Its a small cozy restaurant with some low volume music that sets the atmosphere. 

The food was well prepared and oh soooooo good. 

The plantains were fried just right. 

The Rice was what I'm used to finding in Dominican and Puerto Rican kitchens.

The Pink Beans (Habichuelas Rosada) were very very well seasoned.

The Puerto Rican Pastel was amazingly good and they sell them frozen as well.  

The combination of cozyness, excellent food and amicable staff made this well worth the trip and I greatly look forward to going back again.

excerpts: White rice, black beans, and steak.
Done.
If that wasn't bad enough, the white rice had some rock-hard, bottom of the dish grains in it.
white rice.author: Gil M.
white rice.review:
1 star seemed too harsh, so I'm going with 2. But the fact that I considered going with 1 star should tell you something.

I'm 1st generation Cuban American, originally from Miami, FL, so I know my way around the Cuban Food block. Now I can't say how they do PR food or sandwiches, but I can tell you they don't do Bistec de Palomilla well at all. And that's enough for me to know not to comeback. Why? Bistec de Palomilla is the quintessential Cuban dish. White rice, black beans, and steak. Done. A Cuban joint messing that dish up is like an Italian restaurant doing lousy spaghetti and meatballs. 

The palomilla at Frutilandia was greasy, the seasoning was all wrong, and it was pounded way too thin. If that wasn't bad enough, the white rice had some rock-hard, bottom of the dish grains in it. As for the black beans, they were passable. 

The entree came with a salad which consisted of lettuce 2 slices of tomato and Veg-all corn, carrots and green beans. It was kind of a travesty, actually. The best part of the meal was the warm bread and the nice server. Everything else was bad and low budget.

Good service and atmosphere go a long way with me and I don't know about their PR food or sandwiches, so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and give them 2 instead of 1 star.

excerpts: The platanos maduros (sweet) are reminiscent of fried bananas but somehow savory and delicious with lots of hot sauce and the white rice and black beans that come with every entree.
white rice.author: Suzanne S.
white rice.review:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed El Nuevo Fruitlandia yet. This place is probably the first hidden treasure I found when moving to the Mission a few years ago. My father lived in Puerto Rico and has always grumbled about the lack of Puerto Rican food in the bay area. So when he requested Carne Guisada (a slow cooked pork stew) for his birthday dinner, I thought, "hey, I'm in the Mission, I can figure this out." We were not dissapointed. El Nuevo Fruitlandia is now a family staple.

Theres a whole list of fried goodness for appetizers: the tostones (smooshed and fried slices of platano) are my favorite, although I wish they had some homemade salsa and not just tapatio. They bring you warm toasted water bread while you're waiting, too, which my sister adores. 

You can tell they've made an effort to cater to vegetarians, which I really appreciate. The chile rellenos (about $7) are the best I've had, in a rich tomato and chile sauce with bell pepers and onions. The mofongo (smashed fried yucca)we get the vegetarian) is also very good, if a bit greasy. The platanos maduros (sweet) are reminiscent of fried bananas but somehow savory and delicious with lots of hot sauce and the white rice and black beans that come with every entree. Yucca con mojo is always perfectly cooked, creamy and so tasty with the lemon they give you squeezed on top. We usually order the salad, too, which is simple but fresh and good, with cucumbers, corn, onions and romaine.

They also have lots of juices and shakes. I like the juices, but last time I got the shake and it tasted like frothy milk and sugar -- I could barely taste the fruit at all, which was weird. 

The service is very slow but that's because they make everything fresh right when you order it.

This is one of those unique little gems that reminds me how damn lucky I am to live in San Francisco.

excerpts: This came with side of white rice and black beans (Cuban frijoles) and some bread.
Ok here come to complaints...
The alcapurria, the "dough" tasted unbalance, meaning they used too much of one ingredient (in this case the baby green bananas) and it was overpowering....
They were also oily.
The pastel was ok, certainly lacking the usual kick of flavor I am used to.
Tostones were ok
, I make better.
Amarillos are impossible to screw up so these were good.
I have never been a fan of frijoles but these were bland.
The camarones were ok... although the criolla sauce was bleh at best.
white rice.author: melisa n.
white rice.review:
Ok so gotta give them 3 stars because they went out of their way to accommodate us but I was expecting better...

Sunday evening, after a trip to MoMA we made a much anticipated trip to Frutilandia.  Keep in mind, I'm Puerto Rican -born and raised- so I know what most of the dishes should taste like.  Trying to be reasonable I don't expect them to be up on "tastes like when grandma makes them" status but at least I expect them to taste like if I went to a hole in the wall place in NYC.

We drive by slowly to check the location around 6:45pm when I see the sign that says CLOSED... Hmm, their website says the hours are until 8pm...  Circled the block and decided to get out of the car and look to see if it was a 4th of July weekend thing but nope, no hours on the door either, hmm.  Then I see her, the waitress inside.  I proceed to knock and signal her to come on over... Success, she heeds my call.  Busted out the Spanish to seem more convincing and she explains that even though they are cleaning they could serve us if we didn't mind.  Score, we go in.

I had looked at the menu online and had pretty much an idea of what I wanted.  There were a couple of things they didn't have (won't hold it against them since they were closing after all) which were the guava juice and the chicken soup that you can have instead of the green salad.  Order for two looked something like this:

- 1 alcapurria
- 1 pastel
- 1 side of amarillos (ripe, fried plantains)
- 1 order of tostones (green, fried plantains)
- Camarones a la criolla (shrimp in creole sauce)
- Ropa Vieja (shredded beef in tomato base sauce)

This came with side of white rice and black beans (Cuban frijoles) and some bread.  Ok here come to complaints...  The alcapurria, the "dough" tasted unbalance, meaning they used too much of one ingredient (in this case the baby green bananas) and it was overpowering....  They were also oily.  The pastel was ok, certainly lacking the usual kick of flavor I am used to.  Tostones were ok, I make better.  Amarillos are impossible to screw up so these were good.  I have never been a fan of frijoles but these were bland.  The camarones were ok... although the criolla sauce was bleh at best.  Ropa vieja was again ok, nothing to bring me back.  The mamey and pineapple shakes we got were yum though.  Too bad they didn't have guava....  All of thise for around $45.

I might come back and try to aim for when they are busier to see if then the quality of the food improves even if the service is slower as some reviews mention.  All in all, super sweet of them to seat us when they were getting ready to go but the food...  If I spend a little extra time and effort, I can make it better myself....

food - 2 stars
service - 1 star

3 stars at best as of now.

excerpts: I never saw just plain white rice served.
The rice always had tomato, or zafron or cooked with chicken broth that gave it real flavor.
If you want an authentice Cuban or Puerto Rican restaurant, this isn't it.
white rice.author: Todd T.
white rice.review:
I've had a lot of Cuban and Puerto Rican food in New York and there was something missing to the point that I didn't recognize the food as either Cuban nor Puerto Rican.  There was no WOW factor to any of the dishes.  I had the Chile Verde Chicken and my guest had the steak.  The chicken dish was boring and the portion of black beans would have been size appropriate for a four year old.  The chicken dish and the overall flavors reminded me of a El Salvadorean restaurant closer to Valencia St.

My guest liked her steak but thought the food was bland.  We looked around and we couldn't figure out why the restaurant was full and we decided that the Americans liked it because it was bland.  Nothing picante here in a neighborhood full of picante restaurants. 

Back to the Cuban restaurants in New York.  I never saw just plain white rice served.  The rice always had tomato, or zafron or cooked with chicken broth that gave it real flavor.   If you want an authentice Cuban or Puerto Rican restaurant, this isn't it.  If you want someone's idea of Cuban or Puerto Rican food that has nothing spicy and you have hours to wait for your food and anything else you order, this place is for you.     

Service was horrible.  The waitress never brought our coffee and gave us butter but the bread never arrived.  We waited 10 minutes before the bill arrived and this is a small restaurant.

excerpts: Carne gizada, with white rice and pink beans, mmmmmm....delicious.
Tamarindo drink perfect, not to sweet, not to tart.
Can't wait to fly into SF this weekend.
white rice.author: yolanda g.
white rice.review: Wow!!!  I will fly in from LA for their authentic Puerto Rican food.  I felt like I was home.....on the island of Puerto Rico.  The slow service is worth the wait, because I know they are cooking from scratch not frozen.  The best alcapuria I have had in years!  Carne gizada, with white rice and pink beans, mmmmmm....delicious.  Tamarindo drink perfect, not to sweet, not to tart.  Can't wait to fly into SF this weekend.

excerpts: I also ordered the habichuelas (red beans) and arroz con gandules as my sides and this was enough for two people.
Both of these sides were really tasty but the arroz con gandules was definitely the highlight.
arroz con gandules.author: Valeria S.
arroz con gandules.review:
I was on the hunt for some good Puerto Rican food in SF and was excited to try this place out. I've had plenty of mofongo in my life and this is definitely one of the better ones! The sauce was so tasty and good and full of flavor with some nice garlic and sazón. The mofongo itself was excellent, not dry at all and the pork that came with it was very well flavored. 

I also ordered the habichuelas (red beans) and arroz con gandules as my sides and this was enough for two people. Both of these sides were really tasty but the arroz con gandules was definitely the highlight. 

Picking the dessert at the end was a very hard choice but I ended up going with the tres leches and was very happy. It was a big portion and really nice and sweet and just everything you'd want from tres leches. Put waiter was super nice and patient, especially since we were being indecisive about a lot of our order. 

Will 100% be coming back to try the Vaca Frita and a few of the other items on the menu. Stop by if you are in the area and make a trip there if you're not!

excerpts: I had the ropa vieja with arroz con gandules, the beef was on point, however the rice lacked the sofrito taste and salty pork flavor I am accustomed to.
We also had the yuca appetizer, which was bland and needed salt.
We were pleasantly surprised by the fried plantains, sweet and nicely cooked.
All in all I would recommend it and will return to taste the other dishes on the menu.
arroz con gandules.author: IRMA C.
arroz con gandules.review:
I have been coming to this restaurant since I was a young girl it has been in my neighborhood for many years. It had been many years since I had returned. 
I came in today and I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the food is still outstanding. The remodel also was very cool. We enjoyed the service Nick provided, he was very pleasant, knowledgeable and had a charismatic way about him. 
We had the Cuban sandwich, tasty, but it needed to be pressed more. We also had both of the shrimp dishes offered, both were very good. I had the ropa vieja with arroz con gandules, the beef was on point, however the rice lacked the sofrito taste and salty pork flavor I am accustomed to. We also had the yuca appetizer, which was bland and needed salt. We were pleasantly surprised by the fried plantains, sweet and nicely cooked. 
All in all I would recommend it and will return to taste the other dishes on the menu.

excerpts: We ordered lechon (so tender and loaded with flavor), ropa vieja (the sauce tasty) and shrimp platter, which came with arroz con gandules and habichuelas.
Soooo delicious.
I just can't say enough about this place.
It's a little hole in the wall on the Mission, with beautiful decor of PR and my favorite salsa music playing in the background.
Very friendly and welcoming staff
(I can't remember her name) but she took the time to chat with us for a while and getting to know us.
Never have I experienced such attention.
My only disappointment was they ran out of pasteles (my favorite) and flan.
No worries.
I'll be back!
You will not be disappointed!
arroz con gandules.author: Marilyn O.
arroz con gandules.review: Hands down, one of the best PRican/Cuban restaurants in SF! Better than Sol and Havana Cuba.  The food was delicious and bursting with flavor! We ordered a little bit of everything. The pork mofongo was to die for.  Soooo much flavor! The chicken empanadas.  Wow.  The ceviche? Yum! We ordered lechon (so tender and loaded with flavor), ropa vieja (the sauce tasty) and shrimp platter, which came with arroz con gandules and habichuelas.  Soooo delicious.  I just can't say enough about this place.  It's a little hole in the wall on the Mission, with beautiful decor of PR and my favorite salsa music playing in the background.  Very friendly and welcoming staff (I can't remember her name) but she took the time to chat with us for a while and getting to know us.  Never have I experienced such attention.  My only disappointment was they ran out of pasteles (my favorite) and flan.  No worries.  I'll be back!  You will not be disappointed!

excerpts: It took us a while to decide and I ended up ordering the vegetarian mofongo and she ordered chicken empanadas, arroz con gandules, and platanos maduros.
I eat A LOT of food and the vegetarian mofongo has been the best thing I have eaten so far!
I have never tried this dish before and it blew my mind.
The crispy/crunchy/ soft combination of textures of the mofongo and the burst of flavor from the sauce gave me a mouthgasm.
arroz con gandules.author: Stephanie L.
arroz con gandules.review:
My girlfriend wanted me to try some puerto rican/ cuban food so we decided to come here since we were in the area.

It was a sunday night after 8, but they still let us come in.

It took us a while to decide and I ended up ordering the vegetarian mofongo and she ordered chicken empanadas, arroz con gandules, and platanos maduros. We ordered the mate soda and finished off with café con leche.

Considering I am vegetarian I could only try the platanos and they were pretty good. But let me tell you...I eat A LOT of food and the vegetarian mofongo has been the best thing I have eaten so far! I have never tried this dish before and it blew my mind. The vegetable filled mashed fried plaintain dish was topped with this creamy garlic sauce and served with white rice and beans. The crispy/crunchy/ soft combination of textures of the mofongo and the burst of flavor from the sauce gave me a mouthgasm. Even the rice tasted fantastic and was textured perfectly.

The service was phenomenal. The owner came over to chat and was super friendly! He gave us some background information on the restaurant and explained to us the food we ordered. The waitress was friendly, patient, and helpful with us ordering.

Hands down the best food and service I have experienced. I will be coming back here again for sure!

excerpts: I loved the mofongo and I was also seriously impressed with the sautéed shrimp and arroz con gandules.
I HIGHLY recommend this quaint but wonderful little restaurant!!!
arroz con gandules.author: DeAnna J.
arroz con gandules.review: The food was truly authentic! I loved the mofongo and I was also seriously impressed with the sautéed shrimp and arroz con gandules. I HIGHLY recommend this quaint but wonderful little restaurant!!!

excerpts: it was lechon with arroz con gandules they also sell some cuban dishes they sell good ropa vieja and there vaca frita is hella good
i also had a cuban sandwhich it was on hit
i met quite a few boricuas in the bay area hopefully
one day one of them will open up a new puerto rican restaurant in san fran one day it,
s long over due but for right now
if you find your self in the city this is the only place that i know of that sells puerto rican food  on a last note the staff is very freindly....
arroz con gandules.author: Jose C.
arroz con gandules.review: i,m not gonna even say i,m an expert on puerto rican cuisine but i have been here quite a few times and the food is preatty good not the best but good i really like there tostones i also had the puerto rican pasteles and alcapurrias and they where on hit i once had a spacial it was lechon with arroz con gandules they also sell some cuban dishes they sell good ropa vieja and there vaca frita is hella good i also had a cuban sandwhich it was on hit i met quite a few boricuas in the bay area hopefully one day one of them will open up a new puerto rican restaurant in san fran one day it,s long over due but for right now if you find your self in the city this is the only place that i know of that sells puerto rican food  on a last note the staff is very freindly....

excerpts: We were quizzed about if we were willing to pay the $1.25 for pink beans instead of black when we'd asked for the former (this at a restaurant where the alcalpurrias are now $9!), and when we confirmed we wanted the pink beans and were fine to pay for them, black beans were still brought to our table - and when the situation was remedied, the beans themselves tasted terribly burned!
Our "appetizer" arrived by the time we had almost finished our entrees.
We asked if the platanos could be cooked without the butter, and were told this was impossible - too bad, since they have accommodated that request before.
We were pretty sad to see what's going on here.
pink beans.author: Lisa K.
pink beans.review:
So we'd come back since 2012, and things had taken a turn for the better. But revisiting tonight showed that once again, things are worse - and worse than ever, sadly. We noticed that the menus have changed - there's no more soup, unfortunately. The alcapurrias were a disturbing orange color (more than just too much annatto) and frankly weren't worth eating. The ropa vieja flavor was heavily dominated by green peppers, was tough, and the sauce was too runny. The cuban sandwich was fine though!

Furthermore, the service was pretty paltry too. We were quizzed about if we were willing to pay the $1.25 for pink beans instead of black when we'd asked for the former (this at a restaurant where the alcalpurrias are now $9!), and when we confirmed we wanted the pink beans and were fine to pay for them, black beans were still brought to our table - and when the situation was remedied, the beans themselves tasted terribly burned! Our "appetizer" arrived by the time we had almost finished our entrees. We asked if the platanos could be cooked without the butter, and were told this was impossible - too bad, since they have accommodated that request before. We were pretty sad to see what's going on here.

excerpts: The Picadillo A La Habana Vieja (cuban style ground sirloin beef cooked with olives, capers, raisins) was a wee bit too salty, but the side pink beans were bomb!
pink beans.author: Susan H.
pink beans.review:
I really wanted to like you more, esp since I've had such good experiences with Puerto Rican food at Parada 22 and El Sol. But the service was soooo slow! There was one waitress for about 5 tables, and she was so inefficient, but sweet. And on the night we went, I guess the chef had ditched work to celebrate his birthday, and a burner was out, so the food came out super slow and the chicken soup was cold. aye dios mio

But the food was good: the tostones (friend plaintains) were fresh and crisp and accompanied by a savory garlic dip. The acalpurria (mashed plantains and yucca wrapped around ground beef) was an interesting little bite. The Picadillo A La Habana Vieja (cuban style ground sirloin beef cooked with olives, capers, raisins) was a wee bit too salty, but the side pink beans were bomb!

They just need to get their act together and they'll get more customers.

excerpts: I asked for pink beans but they were black.
pink beans.author: Cecilia C.
pink beans.review:
I ordered the Pierna de Puerco Horneada and it was pretty tastey but lacked that down-home-abuela-made-it taste. I feel like maybe it's the 80s generation in the kitchen. It does have some soul to it but not 100%. I found the portions are too small for this style of restaurant. A $15 plate of rice, beans, and pork done right should be hard to finish, if not impossible. But I ordered on GrubHub, maybe that's why it was small? Anyway I picked it up, walked two blocks home, and when I got there most of the food was cold. It wasn't cold out either. I asked for pink beans but they were black. BUT I also picked it up 15 minutes before closing, so I didn't take points off for that.

However, this is the only Puerto Rican food I've found in the mission, and the platanos maduros were pretty delicious. I wish I had ordered the soup instead of salad! I'll be back, but the value isn't great.

excerpts:
* Pink Beans 
The Pink Beans (Habichuelas Rosada) were very very well seasoned.
pink beans.author: Seth R.
pink beans.review:
Its a Cuban Restaurant that has some Puerto Rican specialties. 
I had the:
* Puerto Rican Pasteles
* White Rice
* Pink Beans 
* Fried Green Plantains (tostones)

Its a small cozy restaurant with some low volume music that sets the atmosphere. 

The food was well prepared and oh soooooo good. 

The plantains were fried just right. 

The Rice was what I'm used to finding in Dominican and Puerto Rican kitchens.

The Pink Beans (Habichuelas Rosada) were very very well seasoned.

The Puerto Rican Pastel was amazingly good and they sell them frozen as well.  

The combination of cozyness, excellent food and amicable staff made this well worth the trip and I greatly look forward to going back again.

excerpts: Pink beans are ridiculously good.
White sangria was addictive too.
pink beans.author: Geoff R.
pink beans.review:
This place was delicious. Given the affordable menu and delicious sangria, we will be back. Servers were pretty excited but the food was delicious and experience was awesome. 

We had the Chile relleno and the pulled pork. Pink beans are ridiculously good. White sangria was addictive too. Rafael, the owner, was super nice and checked in with us often. 

All around, pleasant experience. A few characters on staff but made for a fun dinner out. We will be back often.

excerpts: Also, on the menu it should say that the pink beans have pork in it because friend of mine almost ate it
and she is vegetarian.
She discovered this after a bite and could taste the pork.
At least the server should have informed us but they were fairly busy when we got there
so I guess some important details were missed.
Life goes on.
I would go back but not during the weekend or at least during a time that they're not so busy.
I am Puerto Rican
so I know what this food should taste like
, so I think there's definitely room for improvement.
pink beans.author: Gina R.
pink beans.review: The service was pretty bad but it was a busy Friday night so not overly surprised. The food was good, the surtido which has tostones, maduros (ripe plantains) and yucca were all really good. Mofongo was a bit dry and there was only maybe three shrimp in there made it a little less dry with the sauce on it. Black beans were decent, could have used a little more flavor but it was better than the last time I went which was almost 5 years ago (judging from the review I am looking at). Also, on the menu it should say that the pink beans have pork in it because friend of mine almost ate it and she is vegetarian. She discovered this after a bite and could taste the pork. At least the server should have informed us but they were fairly busy when we got there so I guess some important details were missed. Life goes on. I would go back but not during the weekend or at least during a time that they're not so busy. I am Puerto Rican so I know what this food should taste like, so I think there's definitely room for improvement. The empanadas de espinacas were quite good and one of my meat eating friends liked the alcapurrias.

excerpts: Carne gizada, with white rice and pink beans, mmmmmm....delicious.
Tamarindo drink perfect, not to sweet, not to tart.
Can't wait to fly into SF this weekend.
pink beans.author: yolanda g.
pink beans.review: Wow!!!  I will fly in from LA for their authentic Puerto Rican food.  I felt like I was home.....on the island of Puerto Rico.  The slow service is worth the wait, because I know they are cooking from scratch not frozen.  The best alcapuria I have had in years!  Carne gizada, with white rice and pink beans, mmmmmm....delicious.  Tamarindo drink perfect, not to sweet, not to tart.  Can't wait to fly into SF this weekend.

excerpts: They both came with sides of white rice and taro chips.
The white rice had a nice kick of flavor, it was a perfect side and so were the chips.
The whole meal evened each other out.
Along with the great food was friendly smiles of our servers.
they were all so kind to us!!
Thank you very much for a delicious meal, we look forward to coming back.
taro chips.author: Vanessa D.
taro chips.review:
My boyfriend and I passed by this restaurant a few months ago and we FINALLY got the chance to try it. We were so excited and the location is beautiful, right in the heart of Mission District.

We started out with chicken and picadillo empanadas with a side of tostones. That already set the bar high for our entrees, it was so delicious! Filled with flavor and the meats were cooked so well. The empanadas were both crispy and golden, yum.

Our entrees came, he got the ropa vieja and I got the Chile relleno with chicken. They both came with sides of white rice and taro chips. The white rice had a nice kick of flavor, it was a perfect side and so were the chips. The whole meal evened each other out. Along with the great food was friendly smiles of our servers. they were all so kind to us!! Thank you very much for a delicious meal, we look forward to coming back.

excerpts: Most of their dishes are served with Taro Chips which is a fried root vegetable sliced like a large flat potato chip and lightly salted.
I think it was the first time that I've had one
taro chips.author: Nick C.
taro chips.review:
A colleague turned me on to this place in the Mission.  It's a classic hole in the wall with little signage out front.  Apparently this Puerto Rican restaurant has been here for many years.

To be honest I know very little about Puerto Rican food as my only other dining experience was at SOL in San Rafael which I enjoyed.  However, El Nuevo Frutilanda was a much different, at least to my taste, cuisine.

And that's a good thing.

We began our evening dinner with the Ceviche a wonderful mix of shrimp and fish that was marinated with a unbelievable tasty pineapple salsa that was heaven to my taste buds.  Most of their dishes are served with Taro Chips which is a fried root vegetable sliced like a large flat potato chip and lightly salted. I think it was the first time that I've had one and I must say that it was delicious

Our entrees consisted of the Pollo A La Espenola which was nice cubes of chicken breast sautéed in onions and red bell peppers in a butternut carrot spiced sauce. The sauce was both sweet and tangy very delicious actually.  The entrée was topped off with a portion of rice. My partner ordered the Ropa Vieja which was marinated shredded beef in a tomato based sauce with rice and black beans. The sauce was very tasty and was totally different than the sauce that my dish had.  Like in all the great regional cuisines such as New Orleans it has been my experience that the sauces really make the dish and at El Nuevo Frutilandia it is all about the sauce.

Our dinner was topped off with a wonderful freshly baked plantain tart which melted in our mouths. 

San Francisco is a fabulous culinary destination full of multi ethnic cuisines  El Nuevo Frutilandia is a fine example of that - offering up great food, at reasonable prices in a neighborhood rich in fantastic dining alternatives.  We found it to be one of the City's best kept secrets.

We will be back.....

excerpts: The taro chips are super tasty.
Wish I had bought a side of them.
taro chips.author: Elizabeth C.
taro chips.review: This is the best food ever!!! A lil pricy but totally worth it. I got the vaca frita as recommended by the waitress and I loved it. The taro chips are super tasty. Wish I had bought a side of them.

excerpts: The food here isn't that great, especially the habichuelas rositas and mofongo.
I just moved to San Francisco, so I guess I still have to find a good Puerto Rican or Dominican restaurant :(
habichuelas rositas.author: David B.
habichuelas rositas.review: You peeps don't know what you are missing. The food here isn't that great, especially the habichuelas rositas and mofongo. I just moved to San Francisco, so I guess I still have to find a good Puerto Rican or Dominican restaurant :(

excerpts: Solid cuban sandwich, the maduros are glazed with this crazy Kahlua reduction that is   freaking awesome and the flan de queso reminds me of the stuff my great grandma used to make.
flan de queso.author: Jose d.
flan de queso.review: Solid cuban sandwich, the maduros are glazed with this crazy Kahlua reduction that is   freaking awesome and the flan de queso reminds me of the stuff my great grandma used to make.

excerpts: Me and my party were celebrating my cousin's birthday and although it was super short notice, the owner was kind enough to give cousin a slice of their delicious tres leches cake.
Me and my party will definetly return and share this amazing place with our friends.
tres leches cake.author: Stephanie R.
tres leches cake.review:
Food was excelent and the servers were super friendly. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
This was one of my first times tasting Cuban/Puerto Rican food and I was not disappointed. Me and my party were celebrating my cousin's birthday and although it was super short notice, the owner was kind enough to give cousin a slice of their delicious tres leches cake. Me and my party will definetly return and share this amazing place with our friends.

excerpts:
I did not try the Mofongo (next time), but the Tres Leches cake was easily among the best I have had anywhere.
Compared to the Cuban corner places in Miami, the food here is a little more - for lack of better words - cleaned up, lighter, and the portions are more "reasonable".
Staff is very friendly and helpful, restaurant is comfortable, small enough to be cozy, just a little prone to noise maybe.
tres leches cake.author: Lars A.
tres leches cake.review:
A while back I spent three months in Miami and got to really appreciate the local cuisine, especially the Cuban restaurants.
Back home in SF I had not been able to have the same experience until I found this place.
The Vaca Frita was as good as anything I had eaten in Miami, and they even offered Mamey milk shake!
The restaurant is jointly Cuban and Puerto Rican, so some dishes are a happy mix of both, Puerto Rican rice with Cuban beef, etc.
I did not try the Mofongo (next time), but the Tres Leches cake was easily among the best I have had anywhere.
Compared to the Cuban corner places in Miami, the food here is a little more - for lack of better words - cleaned up, lighter, and the portions are more "reasonable".
Staff is very friendly and helpful, restaurant is comfortable, small enough to be cozy, just a little prone to noise maybe.

excerpts:
* Tres Leches Cake (sponge cake soaked in evaporated milk, condensed milk & heavy cream, topped w/ cream cheese frosting $7) - 4.5 stars
pic:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#bpTQFcVHPgRVu6w1u1pOsQ
Wow, that was a *thick* layer of cream cheese frosting on top!
I love my sweets but that was a little too intense.
However, on the cake--I've been on the hunt for an amazing tres leches in SF
and I think I've found my holy grail.
This was intensely soft, moist, and heaven in our mouths.
tres leches cake.author: Ziyan C.
tres leches cake.review:
This is a cute hole-in-the-wall spot for some Cuban fare. I enjoyed my food but didn't love it; then again, I don't think I generally love Cuban food. Our server wasn't completely reliable for a casual meal it's not a huge deal. 

THE WAIT: None on a Thursday night at about 7:30pm.

THE SERVICE: Not amazing. When our server first came around, she asked me three times in one conversation if I wanted a drink. Either she really wanted me to order a drink, or she legitimately forgot. She would forget little things--for example, she brought our Mofongo out and said she'd bring share plates but never did. 

COST: $68 total for 2 drinks, 1 app, 2 entrees, 1 dessert. A little pricey for the quality. Our dinner receipt: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#jsa9v2WGbdsloXiu0HJg_Q

MUST-HAVES: Tres Leches! The Mofongo was pretty good too.

Out of Ceviche Mixto.

TAPAS, SANDWICHES, DAILY SPECIALS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#AmMGmTKSA9KMKYDcDCLp5A
* Mofongo (garlic mashed plantains filled w/ our "Signature" roasted pork, topped w/ a tomato sofrito $10) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#dSuEbtPP887h3bE4-_RRiQ
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#jf6UgPeC9TJKuiTVsW2DLg
pork filling: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#qqrslAHkj0NxfUjCvLcrXQ
Normally I'm not overly impressed with mashed plantains, but the fact that this was filled with this tasty roasted pork, the plantains had soaked up the meaty flavor, and the pork had soaked up all these great flavors, made this really unique and tasty!


SALADS, ENTREES (pt. 1): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w
* Lechon Horneado (succulent slow roast pork marinated in garlic, pineapple, Caribbean spices $14) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#-jA4oaVrkuxWf5FcYfflsA
Very juicy, tender pork. For this cut of meat, it's still a little on the dry side. Compared to my pork chops, this was much more moist. It's drenched in sauce, but biting through a thick chunk of meat, you do get to the dryer (though still soft) meat in the middle. Just me being picky. Rice & black beans were good.


ENTREES (pt. 2), SANGRIA: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#N3MQSz_pOTi4bB1_t4mniQ
* Chuletas de Cerdo Fritas (pork chops spiced w/ garlic & mango sauce, topped w/ sauteed onions $14) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#6hlk7Zo3gw5cQfxC1n3ibg
I was intrigued by the mango sauce, but couldn't taste this at all in the end. This ended up being a very basic pork chop dish, nothing too special. Came with rice & black beans.

* Guava Sangria (white wine, guava $6.50) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#hBXdP8R1BC4DPL6I4LnHjA
Light flavor-wise, like a tropical sangria. My boyfriend got a glass of this and moved to the Mango Sangria, which basically tasted like a red sangria.

Mango Sangria

SWEET TREATS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#nY5oZV87SJF1MUdHPKlSog
* Tres Leches Cake (sponge cake soaked in evaporated milk, condensed milk & heavy cream, topped w/ cream cheese frosting $7) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#bpTQFcVHPgRVu6w1u1pOsQ
Wow, that was a *thick* layer of cream cheese frosting on top! I love my sweets but that was a little too intense. However, on the cake--I've been on the hunt for an amazing tres leches in SF and I think I've found my holy grail. This was intensely soft, moist, and heaven in our mouths.

excerpts: You must try the vaca frita, alcapurria's, empanadas de platano maduro.
Happy eating.
empanadas de platano maduro.author: Maria C.
empanadas de platano maduro.review: Wonderful place to eat authentic Puerto Rican food. The staff is friendly and totally love the salsa music in the background. Charming place that you all should definitely visit in the mission. You must try the vaca frita, alcapurria's, empanadas de platano maduro. Happy eating.

excerpts:
The batidos (milkshakes) are delicious
The bistec empanisado is delicious
Cute restaurant
batidos.author: Carina M.
batidos.review:
So my cousins and I came here thanks to a groupon offer. 

Pros:
The batidos (milkshakes) are delicious
The bistec empanisado is delicious
Cute restaurant
The music makes me want to dance 

Cons:
We waited a long time ... only cause the joint is understaffed. However, the service was very friendly! So half con.
The beans...sigh. I'm cuban, I like my beans to be spicy and delicious like they should be. Pero, no go.
It's more Puerto Rican than Cuban. Enough said

Overall, check it out! :) ...I'm probably biased since I'm cuban.

excerpts: This is a Batidos.
So creamy with finely crushed ice.
Perfect start since we were really thirsty.
Next our salad were brought to us.
Just a little cup of salad.
House dressing was different.
Nothing much to shout about here, but it was good and we ate all our vegetables.
Next came dinner.
We ordered Chile Rellenos and Filete de Pollo a la Española.
Some one in the kitchen was making MAGIC!
The sauce for the chicken dish was so good.
Good is not a strong enough word.
This dish was not spicy.
It was not chili hot.
But it was real down home comfort food.
batidos.author: Reba Jane S.
batidos.review:
Oh My Goodness!  If you ever find yourself in the Mission/Market area, find this place!  We stopped by for dinner because we wanted a place to eat that was going to be near where our main attraction was.  We didn't want Mexican, again.  We have found scrumptious Mexican food in this same area, but we just wanted something a little bit different.
This place served it up!
Not only were the wait staff very friendly, when we pointed at the menu for lack of being able to pronounce what we wanted, we were given head nods and smiles.  Very warm and inviting.
We started with their house shake.  They let us combine fruits so we kind of got a custom shake.  This is a Batidos.  So creamy with finely crushed ice.  Perfect start since we were really thirsty.
Next our salad were brought to us.  Just a little cup of salad.  House dressing was different.  Nothing much to shout about here, but it was good and we ate all our vegetables.
Next came dinner.   We ordered Chile Rellenos and Filete de Pollo a la Española.  Some one in the kitchen was making MAGIC!  The sauce for the chicken dish was so good.  Good is not a strong enough word.  This dish was not spicy.  It was not chili hot.  But it was real down home comfort food.  Lots of chunks of chicken with a  side of white rice and a cup of black beans.   The Chile Rellenos was a work of art.  Perfect in every way.  We have found another favorite restaurant.  
The place is small.  But even on a Saturday night, we managed to get a table right away without a reservation.  It's old, we were told they have been there for 40 years.  But that's was so much of the charm.  I love these "hole in the wall" places that put the fancy schmancy restaurants to shame!
Don't dine in if you're in a hurry.  They must make everything to order so it takes a little bit to get your dinner.  It's so worth the wait.  If you must be somewhere and you're pressed for time, they do take out and  you can call ahead.  Check out their web site.  And GO!

excerpts: The tostones are prepared well and they even have Malta - one of my favorite drinks from Puerto Rico.
malta.author: Carlos H.
malta.review:
Puerto Rican and Cuban food isn't as common in San Francisco as on the East Coast - this spot has a little slice of it. The tostones are prepared well and they even have Malta - one of my favorite drinks from Puerto Rico.

Props to them for also having a Cuban Sandwich - tampa staple and tradition - we do host the annual National Cuban Sandwich Fest after all.

excerpts:
They serve Malta
         - Sangria, Mmm
         -Alcapurria outstanding.
-Real
malta.author: Raquel Q.
malta.review:
Excellent food! Almost as good as my grandmothers. Service was great! Love the music & atmosphere. Wish we got a little more food for the price but can't really complain cause it really authentic. You can tell they put a lot of pride into their food.
Pros:- They serve Malta
         - Sangria, Mmm
         -Alcapurria outstanding.
         -Real Puerto Rican Owners & staff!

Cons: -Wish the servings were a little bigger.

We will definitely return. If your looking for authentic Puerto Rican food this is the place!

excerpts: I was excited when I saw they had Malta, a sweet non-alcoholic refreshing beverage,  which goes good with the Puerto Rican Pasteles we had.
My wife who normally is not fond of them was pleasantly surprised.
malta.author: Mike D.
malta.review:
To my great surprise we found this restaurant on the way to a cultural event. 

I was excited when I saw they had Malta, a sweet non-alcoholic refreshing beverage,  which goes good with the Puerto Rican Pasteles we had.  My wife who normally is not fond of them was pleasantly surprised. I explained to her she never had them so well prepared, and flavorful.

We also had shrimp with rice, Papa Relleno (potato balls with meat inside them),  At the time they had run out of Alcapurrias, a tasty fried dish, which didn't surprise me. I could probably clean them out by myself. They also have Coco Rico, a popular coconut soda. I guess we'll have to go back.

excerpts: Overall the food was awesome, not 5 star because the rice and beans was just ok, not great, and the malta was not malta india from Puerto Rico, was some other brand that we dont have in the island.
Hightly recommended!!!
Tell Carmen that John sent you.
malta.author: John Q.
malta.review: I'm a Puerto Rican from Puerto Rico, not 2nd generation or from the east coast so I know as a fact how the food from island taste.  I have to say that when I tasted the mofongo I felt like I was back at home.  Awesome mofongo, the tostones were great, the papa rellena was great, maduros (we call it amarillos) were great, pasteles were great.  Overall the food was awesome, not 5 star because the rice and beans was just ok, not great, and the malta was not malta india from Puerto Rico, was some other brand that we dont have in the island. Hightly recommended!!!  Tell Carmen that John sent you.

excerpts: The greatest crime committed here against Cuban gastrocentricity es el cafe Cubano.
Just skip that menu item altogether.
At best Frutilandia is ok
, other times it is as if the head chef is on vacation and they gave a handful of recipes to the guy at the taqueria down the street who has never even eaten Cuban food.
Speaking from the perspective of a Cuban raised in Miami, this place is disappointingly the most authentic Cuban/Puerto Rican restaurant in SF.
I keep going back because I don't always want to have to cook everything myself, but each time I leave more and more disheartened.
Good Cuban food, like good Cuban people, should give everyone hugs and kisses, but Frutilandia is a cold, weak handshake sin gusto.
cafe cubano.author: Q Q.
cafe cubano.review: The greatest crime committed here against Cuban gastrocentricity es el cafe Cubano.  Just skip that menu item altogether.  At best Frutilandia is ok, other times it is as if the head chef is on vacation and they gave a handful of recipes to the guy at the taqueria down the street who has never even eaten Cuban food.  Speaking from the perspective of a Cuban raised in Miami, this place is disappointingly the most authentic Cuban/Puerto Rican restaurant in SF.  I keep going back because I don't always want to have to cook everything myself, but each time I leave more and more disheartened.  Good Cuban food, like good Cuban people, should give everyone hugs and kisses, but Frutilandia is a cold, weak handshake sin gusto.

excerpts: And if you have room make sure to get a cafe con leche and some flan to end your meal just right!
cafe con leche.author: Ted D.
cafe con leche.review:
Amazing!!  My mom was cuban and my dad was Puerto Rican so I was raised on delicious cuban/puerto rican food!  We recently moved to the area and I have been craving a taste of home.   We found our corner of Miami here in San Francisco!  Everything we ate was FANTASTIC!  My favorite dish is Vaca Frita and it was made exceptionally well here!  Make sure to get black beans and rice and some yuca - delicious!!  The mofongo (you are supposed to eat it with the broth!) as an appetizer was FANTASTIC!  And if you have room make sure to get a cafe con leche and some flan to end your meal just right!

It's a dive but well worth the trip and cheap!   We will be back often I am sure!  One note - they are closed on Mondays.

excerpts: Fortunately, we were well fed with empanadas, mofongo, and lechon.
mofongo.author: Sara M.
mofongo.review:
A fun spot for a good meal!

I came for dinner and was sad to see that they stop serving Cuban sandwiches after 7pm. Fortunately, we were well fed with empanadas, mofongo, and lechon. There isn't a ton of Caribbean food in the area as far as I know, so this was a good opportunity to order something a little different.

There's no liquor here, but the sangria is tasty. I'd come back for a casual dinner when I don't have a reservation and don't feel like waiting in line. The service was also very good.

excerpts: I've had plenty of mofongo in my life and this is definitely one of the better ones!
The sauce was so tasty and good and full of flavor with some nice garlic and sazón.
The mofongo itself was excellent, not dry at all and the pork that came with it was very well flavored.
mofongo.author: Valeria S.
mofongo.review:
I was on the hunt for some good Puerto Rican food in SF and was excited to try this place out. I've had plenty of mofongo in my life and this is definitely one of the better ones! The sauce was so tasty and good and full of flavor with some nice garlic and sazón. The mofongo itself was excellent, not dry at all and the pork that came with it was very well flavored. 

I also ordered the habichuelas (red beans) and arroz con gandules as my sides and this was enough for two people. Both of these sides were really tasty but the arroz con gandules was definitely the highlight. 

Picking the dessert at the end was a very hard choice but I ended up going with the tres leches and was very happy. It was a big portion and really nice and sweet and just everything you'd want from tres leches. Put waiter was super nice and patient, especially since we were being indecisive about a lot of our order. 

Will 100% be coming back to try the Vaca Frita and a few of the other items on the menu. Stop by if you are in the area and make a trip there if you're not!

excerpts: The ceviche, tostones, and mofongo are some of my favorite dishes along with their dessert empanadas.
mofongo.author: Nancy L.
mofongo.review:
I love El Nuevo Frutilandia. I've been coming here for years, especially for family celebrations.

Let's me just say, my father hates eating out and is very particular of where we go if we do eat out, but yet this is one of the few places he loves coming to. 

The food is delicious and better than the few places around for Puerto Rican / Cuban food in the city. The ceviche, tostones, and mofongo are some of my favorite dishes along with their dessert empanadas. 

The management is very nice and beyond accommodating. And unlike other reviews have mentioned, I've never had an issue with the food quality, wait time, or service regardless of how slow or busy they are.

I will continue coming here and getting my Puerto Rican/Cuban food fix as long as I can.

excerpts: From the pork mofongo, ceviche, and beef& chicken empanadas!
mofongo.author: Brittany C.
mofongo.review:
Second time here and the food was Amazing! 
From the pork mofongo, ceviche, and beef& chicken empanadas! 

Service was pretty slow but I understand there was one server on one of the hottest days of summer who ran out of ice.

Food came out fast and it was delicious! I also enjoyed the white wine guava sangria!

excerpts:
The 
MOFONGO with shrimp was a bit over priced for the amount of shrimp given.
2 whole shrimp with a small amount of chopped up shrimp.
The POLLO A LA ESPAÑOLA had  a nice  house Caribbean butternut carrot spiced sauce.
The white chicken was a little dry of the sauce saved the day.
mofongo.author: Alan L.
mofongo.review:
In reading some past reviews my fellow yelpers hit the nail on the head. The food is good, the server / management is suspect to some criticism. 
We ordered the TOSTONES CON MOJO which were tasty. The 
MOFONGO with shrimp was a bit over priced for the amount of shrimp given. 2 whole shrimp with a small amount of chopped up shrimp.The POLLO A LA ESPAÑOLA had  a nice  house Caribbean butternut carrot spiced sauce. The white chicken was a little dry of the sauce saved the day. The LECHON HORNEADO was a nice  dish with good amount of pork. Both main courses came with Puerto Rican rice and black beans.
To begin our meal our server took our order and just left the menu on the table which I though was odd. The sever came back and told us one of our appetizers was sold out but was not taken off our bill . Our food was given to us without plates We asked for  some and was given 2 small appetizer plates for the main courses. 
Finally right before we were about to finish our meal the manager came over and said "cash only". Our credit card system is down. Since my credit card company gives double points per dollar I lost out pretty good on a $60 tab. A little annoying since I don't like to carry cash on hand.
We were never asked if our food was good or needed anything else. Poor customer service.
Your not going to get repeat business with that kind of service.

excerpts: Then we ordered the Mofongo which was fulfilling and cooked with love.
mofongo.author: Santiago E.
mofongo.review: Sangria sangria, we tried the white sangria and it was really good. You always have to try the sangria in a latin/Hispanic/cubano culture lol, it helps to judge the rest of the night. On a date we ordered the empanadas, which came out hot and tasty, yummy; It was two so it's basically an appetizer. Then we ordered the Mofongo which was fulfilling and cooked with love. Then we had the Ropa Vieja! We shared all three plates so it was the right amount, obviously you can order just one plate for yourself and still have a great meal. I would definitely recommend those 3 to try out, however I have to go back and give the Yuka a try again. Wasn't impressed considering in Mother land Nicaragua they are cooked a certain way. The vibe was welcoming and homey so I'll give it another shot. Recommend for something low key and good vibes

excerpts: We ordered the mofongo with shrimp and the spinach empanadas.
Everything was amazing, but those empanadas were BOMB!
The service was also excellent, and the waitress was very helpful with choice selection.
There is also music, which creates a nice vibe.
I'll definitely be back!!!
mofongo.author: Tish H.
mofongo.review: This place is truly a gem. Having been to Cuba and Puerto Rico, it was an amazing treat to relive those cultures here. We ordered the mofongo with shrimp and the spinach empanadas. Everything was amazing, but those empanadas were BOMB! The service was also excellent, and the waitress was very helpful with choice selection. There is also music, which creates a nice vibe. I'll definitely be back!!!

excerpts: There were four of us and we ordered Mofongo, ceviche, yuka fries, the flank steak dish and the shrimp dish.
We all shared.
I can't wait to go back to have the Mofongo all to myself.
Yummmmmmmm!!!!!
mofongo.author: Alicia S.
mofongo.review: The food was exceptionally flavorful.  Simply delicious. There were four of us and we ordered Mofongo, ceviche, yuka fries, the flank steak dish and the shrimp dish. We all shared.   I can't wait to go back to have the Mofongo all to myself. Yummmmmmmm!!!!!

excerpts: I still stuck with the plan and ordered the Lechon Horneado, and then decided on splitting their specialty Veggie Mofongo with my friends.

Veggie Mofongo -- http://bit.ly/2a49ngu
Hand mashed garlic plantains topped with a tomato sofrito
This was really good!
The plantain mash was moist and had some good flavor together with the tomato sofrito
I was really surprised with the portion size because it was huge!
If you're dining here solo, unless you have a huge appetite, I wouldn't order this if you plan to order an entree after it.
This really could be a meal in itself.
Especially if you get one of the mofongos stuffed with meat.

Lechon Horneado -- http://bit.ly/29IaNI4
Slow roasted pork marinated in garlic, pineapple, caribbean spices.

Ordered with Arroz Con Grandules which is Puerto Rican style rice with pigeon peas, smoked ham and bacon
Finally!!
And the first bite I had of the pork took me back to when I enjoyed it at the SF Street Food Fest.
Just like I described earlier, the Lechon is so tender and the flavor just explodes in your mouth!
They have it down to a science!
The Arroz Con Grandules is a must order with the Lechon.
It's almost like a ham and bacon paella and just completes the whole pork trinity.
And I must mention the portion size, it's a lot of food!!
Because I had the mofongo earlier, I was only able to finish half of my dish.
It will be extremely hard to resist ordering another Lechon Horneado though.
It's so good!!!
mofongo.author: Rodney H.
mofongo.review:
I remember first trying El Nuevo Frutilandia when they were at the San Francisco Street Food Festival a few years back.  I had their Lechon and it blew my mind (bit.ly/1kKi5zG).  The pork was so tender and flavorful!  So after totally enjoying that sampling,  I was really looking forward to visiting their restaurant.  Well it took a while, but I finally made it over with a few friends.

Even though I was completely set on ordering their Lechon, there were a lot of things on the menu that sounded tempting like their Cubano Sandwich, their Tostones Con Mojo, their Garlic Shrimp (Limon Ajo Camarones), and Chile Relleno.  I still stuck with the plan and ordered the Lechon Horneado, and then decided on splitting their specialty Veggie Mofongo with my friends.  We also ordered a pitcher of their Guava Sangria.

Guava Sangria -- http://bit.ly/29VYBpT
White wine, guava
Very refreshing!  And it paired well with everything we ordered.  If you're going with a small group of people, definitely order the pitcher!!

Veggie Mofongo -- http://bit.ly/2a49ngu
Hand mashed garlic plantains topped with a tomato sofrito
This was really good!  The plantain mash was moist and had some good flavor together with the tomato sofrito  I was really surprised with the portion size because it was huge!  If you're dining here solo, unless you have a huge appetite, I wouldn't order this if you plan to order an entree after it.  This really could be a meal in itself.  Especially if you get one of the mofongos stuffed with meat.  I was definitely glad I was splitting this with my friends.

Lechon Horneado -- http://bit.ly/29IaNI4
Slow roasted pork marinated in garlic, pineapple, caribbean spices.  Ordered with Arroz Con Grandules which is Puerto Rican style rice with pigeon peas, smoked ham and bacon
Finally!!  And the first bite I had of the pork took me back to when I enjoyed it at the SF Street Food Fest.  Just like I described earlier, the Lechon is so tender and the flavor just explodes in your mouth!  They have it down to a science!  The Arroz Con Grandules is a must order with the Lechon.  It's almost like a ham and bacon paella and just completes the whole pork trinity.  And I must mention the portion size, it's a lot of food!!  Because I had the mofongo earlier, I was only able to finish half of my dish.

Overall, I say El Nuevo Frutilandia is must try in the Mission!  It's a really good spot when you're in the mood for some Cuban comfort food.  The food is delicious, huge portions, and the prices are easy on your wallet.  I definitely plan on returning again to try their Cubano Sandwich, and also all their other entrees since the whole menu sounds amazing.  It will be extremely hard to resist ordering another Lechon Horneado though.  It's so good!!!

excerpts: We also ordered the mofongo to start with and split it 3 ways.
mofongo.author: Jennifer H.
mofongo.review:
Two locals introduced me to this awesome Cuban joint and I am glad they did! The food here is outstanding. We started with the white sangria which I highly recommend! Soo good! We also ordered the mofongo to start with and split it 3 ways. This is a very filling dish so you do not need a lot of it.

I ordered the chile rellenos as my main course. It was also great! I liked all the fresh veggies and the kick from the peppers. You can order any dish with plain rice or have it with meat and beans added in (Spanish style) which is what I did and was very good.

Our waitress was very friendly and made sure everything turned out how we wanted it. The restaurant itself is not large but I was there on a Thursday for dinner and it was mostly empty surprisingly! I highly recommend checking this place out when in the area or if you are searching for some great Cuban food!

excerpts: it's a dry sandwich, but the mofongo on the other hands was great.
Nice staff and 20%tip is on ticket for parties of 6.
Definitely a pricey joint about $$$ or $$$$ for cost.
But try other plates you may enjoy.
mofongo.author: Mace S.
mofongo.review: Don't go there exactly when it opens because sometimes they maybe late. The show was on diners, drivins and dives so it has some good food. We weren't impressed with the Cuban sandwich maybe it's the sandwich, just ham, shredded pork and cheese it's a dry sandwich, but the mofongo on the other hands was great. Nice staff and 20%tip is on ticket for parties of 6. Definitely a pricey joint about $$$ or $$$$ for cost. But try other plates you may enjoy.

excerpts:
I did not try the Mofongo (next time), but the Tres Leches cake was easily among the best I have had anywhere.
Compared to the Cuban corner places in Miami, the food here is a little more - for lack of better words - cleaned up, lighter, and the portions are more "reasonable".
Staff is very friendly and helpful, restaurant is comfortable, small enough to be cozy, just a little prone to noise maybe.
mofongo.author: Lars A.
mofongo.review:
A while back I spent three months in Miami and got to really appreciate the local cuisine, especially the Cuban restaurants.
Back home in SF I had not been able to have the same experience until I found this place.
The Vaca Frita was as good as anything I had eaten in Miami, and they even offered Mamey milk shake!
The restaurant is jointly Cuban and Puerto Rican, so some dishes are a happy mix of both, Puerto Rican rice with Cuban beef, etc.
I did not try the Mofongo (next time), but the Tres Leches cake was easily among the best I have had anywhere.
Compared to the Cuban corner places in Miami, the food here is a little more - for lack of better words - cleaned up, lighter, and the portions are more "reasonable".
Staff is very friendly and helpful, restaurant is comfortable, small enough to be cozy, just a little prone to noise maybe.

excerpts: I got the much touted Mofongo (with pork) out of curiosity, and while it was interesting, I wouldn't order it again.
It was a mush of plantains and pork in garlicky sauce that wasn't evenly seasoned.
mofongo.author: Helen S.
mofongo.review:
Found this place on Yelp purely by chance and decided to come because it was open and we wanted somewhere in the Mission that wasn't crowded and serving Mexican food.

If Wendy is looking after you tonight, you're gonna have a good time. She's friendly, funny, and attentive, a winning combination in a waitress! Skills possibly honed through her past gig as a bartender. ;) Anyways, if you're having trouble deciding, you should trust her judgment. Vaca Frita vs. Ropa Vieja? Hands down, Vaca Frita, said she. And we couldn't get enough of the crispy, citrusy pieces of steak or savory taro root chips. 

Wendy's recommendations turned out to be more winning than my fellow Yelpers. I got the much touted Mofongo (with pork) out of curiosity, and while it was interesting, I wouldn't order it again. It was a mush of plantains and pork in garlicky sauce that wasn't evenly seasoned. A dish that struggled for direction and just sort of collapsed into a heap. 

The portions here are pretty small for what you pay, but there are few places to get a clean but authentic Puerto Rican experience such as the one at Frutilandia. The bright interior is sparingly but charmingly decorated in bright colors and a TV plays soundless channels. Somehow, everything just belongs together, like the coffee can turned silverware container on each table. It's a wonderful place for a peaceful meal before a busy night in the Mission!

excerpts: shirmp mofongo twas
alright you get 2 pieces of shrimp thats it...
parada 22 is way better

mofongo.review: shirmp mofongo twas alright you get 2 pieces of shrimp thats it... parada 22 is way better

What go get:
Pork mofongo

Any of the entrees although I'm partial to the spicy Camarrones creole

mofongo.review:
Fantastic.

Been here twice now and I know I'll be having cravings.

What go get:
