excerpts: Had the veggie mofongo which was tasty and the lemon garlic shrimp.
The shrimp was good and cooked well, but it tasted more like Italian fare than Puerto Rican/Cuban.
Portion was small.
mofongo.author: Caroline K.
mofongo.review:
Service was good and so was the food.  Nothing crazy good that I would cross the Bay Bridge for.

Had the veggie mofongo which was tasty and the lemon garlic shrimp.  The shrimp was good and cooked well, but it tasted more like Italian fare than Puerto Rican/Cuban.  Portion was small.  Had the platanos maduros which were great, but $6.50 for 6 pieces was a bit much to charge for such a small side.

excerpts:
The mofongo and pork were moist and flavorful.

Want to try more, but I imagine the sofrito and ropa vieja will be beautiful since the mofongo has a little sofrito on top (sin carne).
mofongo.author: Ellie M.
mofongo.review:
I'm giving this 5 stars because of flavor.

This is the best PR/Cuban food (Cuba Rican) food I've had away from Miami.

In NY I found PR food but no real Cuban food, so finding this in SF felt like pure luck.

The mofongo and pork were moist and flavorful.

The yucca was good (not dry, not dripping in oil), and the garlic sauce was almost looe my grandma makes it!

Want to try more, but I imagine the sofrito and ropa vieja will be beautiful since the mofongo has a little sofrito on top (sin carne).

Definitely go here!
Only down side: average portions (not large, not tiny) and on the low end of pricey (I usually go to places where main dishes are $8-15 rather than $14-19.

excerpts: The mofongo felt a little dry.
Let's keep in mind, I'm not well versed with Caribbean food.
So I dont think my opinion on the tastyness of the food is valid
but, I did enjoy my meal.
mofongo.author: Fredy V.
mofongo.review: The service was great, the server was very attentive. Food was ready in a flash. Only drawback was the pricing it felt a little pricey. If you check in for your first visit you get a 10% discount. A plus but most likely won't come back due to the price. My wife ordered a ceviche, she said it was good. I ordered the chile relleno, also good. The mofongo felt a little dry. Let's keep in mind, I'm not well versed with Caribbean food. So I dont think my opinion on the tastyness of the food is valid but, I did enjoy my meal.

excerpts: We ordered Lechon (which was great) nice and flavorful, and shrimp mofongo which was not a disappointment!
We left full and satisfied, absolutely coming back!
mofongo.author: Angelica V.
mofongo.review: We had the best service! Miguel was delightful, speedy, efficient and knows his stuff as he helped us with what was best on the menu. We ordered Lechon (which was great) nice and flavorful, and shrimp mofongo which was not a disappointment! We left full and satisfied, absolutely coming back!

excerpts: I've been craving mofongo, alcapurrias (
although a bit overcooked and hard, they were still delicious), and a real deal Cuban Sandwich for quite some time now.
I've had pretty bad luck with Cuban Sandwiches lately in the Bay Area.
The last one had arugula and tomatoes and no Swiss.
It was a hipster ABOMINATION.
Cuban Sandwiches are absolute perfection and the ingredients should NEVER EVER be altered.
The only thing that should vary is the amount of love one puts in em.
And not the amount of arugula like Habanas in Alameda.
Yuck!
We did have to wait 10 minutes to be seen when we sat down.
The young waitress, seemed to be a bit distracted by some young bucks sitting at the bar.
She did, however help us a lot after our 10 min wait.
The co-owner was super helpful and nice as well.
We're from the East Coast and my wife is Boricua
The mofongo was delicious, but they brought us 3 very, very little shrimp with garlic sauce to add.
mofongo.author: Themane D.
mofongo.review:
The food was pretty good. I've been craving mofongo, alcapurrias (although a bit overcooked and hard, they were still delicious), and a real deal Cuban Sandwich for quite some time now. I've had pretty bad luck with Cuban Sandwiches lately in the Bay Area. The last one had arugula and tomatoes and no Swiss. It was a hipster ABOMINATION. Cuban Sandwiches are absolute perfection and the ingredients should NEVER EVER be altered. The only thing that should vary is the amount of love one puts in em. And not the amount of arugula like Habanas in Alameda. Yuck!
We did have to wait 10 minutes to be seen when we sat down. The young waitress, seemed to be a bit distracted by some young bucks sitting at the bar. She did, however help us a lot after our 10 min wait. The co-owner was super helpful and nice as well. 
We're from the East Coast and my wife is Boricua, so we know what to look for.

The mofongo was delicious, but they brought us 3 very, very little shrimp with garlic sauce to add. The cuban sandwich was good, but a bit salty.

Had to drop my review by 2 stars because the restaurant was closed when we showed up at 6 pm on a Wednesday for dinner. Drove all the way from Oakland took 30 mins to find parking and BAM CLOSED for no apparent reason. Sign on the door stated "Open."

Stay thirsty my friends

excerpts:
She would forget little things--for example, she brought our Mofongo out and said she'd bring share plates but never did. 

The Mofongo was pretty good too.

mofongo.author: Ziyan C.
mofongo.review:
This is a cute hole-in-the-wall spot for some Cuban fare. I enjoyed my food but didn't love it; then again, I don't think I generally love Cuban food. Our server wasn't completely reliable for a casual meal it's not a huge deal. 

THE WAIT: None on a Thursday night at about 7:30pm.

THE SERVICE: Not amazing. When our server first came around, she asked me three times in one conversation if I wanted a drink. Either she really wanted me to order a drink, or she legitimately forgot. She would forget little things--for example, she brought our Mofongo out and said she'd bring share plates but never did. 

COST: $68 total for 2 drinks, 1 app, 2 entrees, 1 dessert. A little pricey for the quality. Our dinner receipt: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#jsa9v2WGbdsloXiu0HJg_Q

MUST-HAVES: Tres Leches! The Mofongo was pretty good too.

Out of Ceviche Mixto.

TAPAS, SANDWICHES, DAILY SPECIALS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#AmMGmTKSA9KMKYDcDCLp5A
* Mofongo (garlic mashed plantains filled w/ our "Signature" roasted pork, topped w/ a tomato sofrito $10) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#dSuEbtPP887h3bE4-_RRiQ
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#jf6UgPeC9TJKuiTVsW2DLg
pork filling: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#qqrslAHkj0NxfUjCvLcrXQ
Normally I'm not overly impressed with mashed plantains, but the fact that this was filled with this tasty roasted pork, the plantains had soaked up the meaty flavor, and the pork had soaked up all these great flavors, made this really unique and tasty!


SALADS, ENTREES (pt. 1): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w
* Lechon Horneado (succulent slow roast pork marinated in garlic, pineapple, Caribbean spices $14) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#-jA4oaVrkuxWf5FcYfflsA
Very juicy, tender pork. For this cut of meat, it's still a little on the dry side. Compared to my pork chops, this was much more moist. It's drenched in sauce, but biting through a thick chunk of meat, you do get to the dryer (though still soft) meat in the middle. Just me being picky. Rice & black beans were good.


ENTREES (pt. 2), SANGRIA: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#N3MQSz_pOTi4bB1_t4mniQ
* Chuletas de Cerdo Fritas (pork chops spiced w/ garlic & mango sauce, topped w/ sauteed onions $14) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#6hlk7Zo3gw5cQfxC1n3ibg
I was intrigued by the mango sauce, but couldn't taste this at all in the end. This ended up being a very basic pork chop dish, nothing too special. Came with rice & black beans.

* Guava Sangria (white wine, guava $6.50) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#hBXdP8R1BC4DPL6I4LnHjA
Light flavor-wise, like a tropical sangria. My boyfriend got a glass of this and moved to the Mango Sangria, which basically tasted like a red sangria.

Mango Sangria

SWEET TREATS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#nY5oZV87SJF1MUdHPKlSog
* Tres Leches Cake (sponge cake soaked in evaporated milk, condensed milk & heavy cream, topped w/ cream cheese frosting $7) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-nuevo-frutilandia-san-francisco?select=7z7dSx5OhmVq7libj_0C_w#bpTQFcVHPgRVu6w1u1pOsQ
Wow, that was a *thick* layer of cream cheese frosting on top! I love my sweets but that was a little too intense. However, on the cake--I've been on the hunt for an amazing tres leches in SF and I think I've found my holy grail. This was intensely soft, moist, and heaven in our mouths.

excerpts: The mofongo was good for it being Puerto Rican.
mofongo.author: D F.
mofongo.review:
My  experience at Frutilandia, was a bit of a disappointment. Being myself from Cuba, I expected the food to be as good as I have had in restaurants in Miami . We had for appetizers tostones they where typical, the fried yucca; fried as if you where eating french fries with a mojo that was very bland. The mofongo was good for it being Puerto Rican. My Son had the vaca frita and that was delicious! The rest of us had the Cuban pork. It was tender but had no flavor of the common garlic/ cumin mojo as typically expected in chunks of pork at a Cuban restaurant. In fact it had the flavor of what you would expect carnitas to taste at a Mexican restaurant. We also ordered fried plantains on the side, unfortunately they where so chard/ black they where not edible. Unfortunately they made no attempt to rectify the situation, so I merely told our nice waitress not to charge us for that and they didn't. It does make me sad for me to say I will not eat here again.
Good luck, hope this helps?

excerpts: The pork mofongo was to die for.
Soooo much flavor!
mofongo.author: Marilyn O.
mofongo.review: Hands down, one of the best PRican/Cuban restaurants in SF! Better than Sol and Havana Cuba.  The food was delicious and bursting with flavor! We ordered a little bit of everything. The pork mofongo was to die for.  Soooo much flavor! The chicken empanadas.  Wow.  The ceviche? Yum! We ordered lechon (so tender and loaded with flavor), ropa vieja (the sauce tasty) and shrimp platter, which came with arroz con gandules and habichuelas.  Soooo delicious.  I just can't say enough about this place.  It's a little hole in the wall on the Mission, with beautiful decor of PR and my favorite salsa music playing in the background.  Very friendly and welcoming staff (I can't remember her name) but she took the time to chat with us for a while and getting to know us.  Never have I experienced such attention.  My only disappointment was they ran out of pasteles (my favorite) and flan.  No worries.  I'll be back!  You will not be disappointed!

excerpts: The shrimp mofongo is fantastic.
Good selection of beers.
Very reasonable prices.
Our server Jasmine was fun and took great care of our table.
mofongo.author: Tom P.

The shrimp mofongo is fantastic. Good selection of beers. Very reasonable prices. Our server Jasmine was fun and took great care of our table. We would definitely come back!

Not very crowded or noisy which is a plus. But great ambiance and nice Cuban music.

mofongo.review: Service is slow, server did not greet our table or take our order until 15+ minutes later. I went on a Sunday there was hardly anybody in the restaurant. The mofongo is awesome, chicken empanadas is crispy with a light dressing on the side. The arroz condule rice is dry.

excerpts: Must have mofongo!
Exceptional, tender pieces of pork underneath it all, just the right hint of garlic
, I was throughly satisfied, quite comparable to the mofongo on the island!
Staff was attentive and friendly, and Rafael and Jorge were kind enough to let me see how the magic is all done "All you gotta do is ask!"
Warm and friendly, colorful environment, reminded me of Puerto Rican hospitality

mofongo.review:
Very good food. Mofongo is more than recommended, as well as plantain chips (just make sure they're not included in your main dish as a side, we didn't know so basically we had them twice). The only negative thing is that the portions are too small for their prices.

The service was amazing, both the waitresses were unbelievably kind.

Note: we went there on a Friday with a groupon, but they don't accept it that day of the week...

excerpts: Try the Mofongo.
So good.
mofongo.author: Harrison K.
mofongo.review:
Authentic Cuban food. One of the best meals I've ever had. So many subtle flavors. Every dish is mind blowing. Loved it.

Try the Mofongo. So good.

excerpts: They make excellent Mofongo which is very hard to find.
The owners are very friendly and told me they are locals to the neighborhood.
The food is so good, Guy Fieri even highlighted them on his Food Network show.
I HIGHLY recommend them.
mofongo.author: Joseph M.
mofongo.review: This is one of my favorite places to eat at when I visit the Bay area.  They make excellent Mofongo which is very hard to find.  The owners are very friendly and told me they are locals to the neighborhood.  The food is so good, Guy Fieri even highlighted them on his Food Network show.  I HIGHLY recommend them.

excerpts: We ended up getting the vegetarian mofongo and he got this spicy shrimp dish.
Both came with black beans and rice.
The rice was surprisingly seasoned but the beans weren't!
I usually like beans
The mofongo was a delicious!
I ate the whole thing and the portion was huge!
You HAVE to try it with their house made sauce.
It totally makes the dish!
One odd thing was the mofongo was different temperatures all around making me think it was reheated in the microwave or something.
mofongo.author: Tiffany V.
mofongo.review:
My boyfriend and I were always passing this place so I jumped on the Groupon deal they had! Came for lunch and we were super disappointed their lasagna special was taken off the menu! They apparently had just revamped their menus and took it off. Total bummer since thats what we were most looking forward to!

We ended up getting the vegetarian mofongo and he got this spicy shrimp dish. Both came with black beans and rice. The rice was surprisingly seasoned but the beans weren't! I usually like beans but I thought theirs tasted awful so my boyfriend ate all of them. 

The mofongo was a delicious! I ate the whole thing and the portion was huge! You HAVE to try it with their house made sauce. It totally makes the dish! One odd thing was the mofongo was different temperatures all around making me think it was reheated in the microwave or something. The shrimp on the other hand came piping hot with a really tasty sauce! 

Service was super nice and the decor is super cute!!! I felt like I was on vacation or something haha. Definitely fun to try out a place we've been curious about but will not return to.

excerpts: I finally did and ordered mofongo w/ pork and salad with guava sauce for take-out.
While waiting, ordered a guanabana drink.
All great tasting, will definitely come back here again.
mofongo.author: Miel M.
mofongo.review: They were featured on Food network and wanted to try their food for awhile. I finally did and ordered mofongo w/ pork and salad with guava sauce for take-out. While waiting, ordered a guanabana drink. All great tasting, will definitely come back here again.

excerpts: I got the mofongo, ceviche and my sister got the chicken.. we also ordered the white sangria which was amazingggg!
Small restaurant, had the Salsa music going and the ladies were attentive.
We sat at the bar, so it was nice.
I def plan to go back.
mofongo.author: Katherine R.
mofongo.review: Bought a Groupon for this place. Pretty good food, I enjoyed. I got the mofongo, ceviche and my sister got the chicken.. we also ordered the white sangria which was amazingggg! Small restaurant, had the Salsa music going and the ladies were attentive. We sat at the bar, so it was nice. I def plan to go back.

excerpts: It took us a while to decide and I ended up ordering the vegetarian mofongo and she ordered chicken empanadas, arroz con gandules, and platanos maduros.
I eat A LOT of food and the vegetarian mofongo has been the best thing I have eaten so far!
I have never tried this dish before and it blew my mind.
The crispy/crunchy/ soft combination of textures of the mofongo and the burst of flavor from the sauce gave me a mouthgasm.
mofongo.author: Stephanie L.
mofongo.review:
My girlfriend wanted me to try some puerto rican/ cuban food so we decided to come here since we were in the area.

It was a sunday night after 8, but they still let us come in.

It took us a while to decide and I ended up ordering the vegetarian mofongo and she ordered chicken empanadas, arroz con gandules, and platanos maduros. We ordered the mate soda and finished off with café con leche.

Considering I am vegetarian I could only try the platanos and they were pretty good. But let me tell you...I eat A LOT of food and the vegetarian mofongo has been the best thing I have eaten so far! I have never tried this dish before and it blew my mind. The vegetable filled mashed fried plaintain dish was topped with this creamy garlic sauce and served with white rice and beans. The crispy/crunchy/ soft combination of textures of the mofongo and the burst of flavor from the sauce gave me a mouthgasm. Even the rice tasted fantastic and was textured perfectly.

The service was phenomenal. The owner came over to chat and was super friendly! He gave us some background information on the restaurant and explained to us the food we ordered. The waitress was friendly, patient, and helpful with us ordering.

Hands down the best food and service I have experienced. I will be coming back here again for sure!

excerpts:
The server then recommended the only other vegetarian options which were the chili relleno or mofongo vegetariano. 
Since my toddler son was sharing the plate we opted with the mofongo vegetariano (consisting of plaintains, rice, beans). 

Since my toddler son was sharing the plate we opted with the mofongo vegetariano (consisting of plaintains, rice, beans). 

The second entree (mofongo vegetariano) eventually arrives and that also is not met with satisfaction-- not much flavor, small portions.  

The second entree (mofongo vegetariano) eventually arrives and that also is not met with satisfaction-- not much flavor, small portions.
mofongo.author: Denis A.
mofongo.review:
Sorry to report: El Nuevo Frutilandia is not even mediocre food at best.  

Unfortunately,  I struggled giving this spot 2 stars. Came here for dinner on 11-25-12; I ordered the Puerto Rico sandwich which was bland and they skimped me on the steak meat (see pics). Also, the fries that came with the my meal were loaded with so much grease they shined.

My wife ordered the Spinach empanada con queso (1 of 3 veggie options). Ten minutes into our wait, our server informs us they are out of empanadas- grrr.  The server then recommended the only other vegetarian options which were the chili relleno or mofongo vegetariano. Since my toddler son was sharing the plate we opted with the mofongo vegetariano (consisting of plaintains, rice, beans). 

My sandwich came soon after we got my wife's order straightened out which left me in a small dilemna.  Either let my food get cold waiting for my wife's meal or chow down in front of her. Our server saw my hesitation and informed me that I should eat since her meal would be a while. 

As I am munching down on my Puerto Rico sandwich, I realize my sandwich looks nothing like the pics on Yelp and how terrible it tastes. With each bite of my sandwich I taste more bread and lettuce than any meat.  Where is all the savory meat? Did they run out of this also? I decide to take inventory, so I open my sandwich to reveal less than six strips of steak meat (see pic). and for over $10. Verdict: F-

The second entree (mofongo vegetariano) eventually arrives and that also is not met with satisfaction-- not much flavor, small portions.  

But a huge plus is in order for the house made sangria (white wine) which I was looking forward to (1st star).  However I was craving a red wine sangria but the white wine sangria was pretty awesome served mixed with apple, orange, lemon slices, etc (see pic). But at $6 a glass... well let's just say, they can do better. 

Space is tight in this restaurant.  My little boy wouldn't sit still and without the availability of a high chair (the only other one was occupied), he had to eat on our lap during dinner.  Tip: Be prepared to wait.  Usually, I am pretty patient when it comes to wait times, but I did observe the couple next to us grow frustrated from the wait, and finally they paid and left without the food they ordered. 

In terms of ambiance/vibe, there was Latin music playing, but with all the yelling and clamor from within the kitchen and amongst staff, it made it hard to have a conversation at the dinner table.

Maybe I came on an off night, but with so many choices in the area, I cannot see myself returning or recommending this spot.
 
The deal (2nd star): Used a groupon deal I purchased for $20 that got me two sangria drinks and two entrees.  

(+) Latin music playing
(-) long wait for dinner
(-) cramped restaurant
(-) limited veggie options
(- -) My Puerto Rico Sandwich was a huge disappointment.  It lacked meat and flavor (see pics).

excerpts: I ordered the mofongo vegetariano, plaintanos meduros, and a side of white rice and black beans.
My roommate had the buttermilk chicken and ate ever last bite.
All of the portions are decent sized and the plates are put together beautifully.
The food was amazing.
10000 times better than any other Puerto Rican restaurants in the Bay Area (except for a certain sol food in San Rafael).
The service was meh, but the food trumped all.
We ate every last bite.
After we paid, the chef came out to our table to introduce himself and ask how we liked the food.
He said to ask for anything vegetarian next time and he'll do it (;
mofongo.author: Emma G.
mofongo.review:
My roommate and I came here around 9 PM on a Saturday night (they close at 10 on sat) and about 1/3rd of the restaurant was full. It's a little hidden gem off of 24th that I've had bookmarked for a while and I'm so glad we finally went. 
 The ambiance is very San Juan and colorful, the whole place is really cute. I'm vegetarian, and everything on the menu sounded amazing to me. Puerto Rican restaurants hardly offer vegetarian dishes, and this place had tons of options. I ordered the mofongo vegetariano, plaintanos meduros, and a side of white rice and black beans. My roommate had the buttermilk chicken and ate ever last bite. All of the portions are decent sized and the plates are put together beautifully. 
The food was amazing. 10000 times better than any other Puerto Rican restaurants in the Bay Area (except for a certain sol food in San Rafael). The service was meh, but the food trumped all. We ate every last bite. 
After we paid, the chef came out to our table to introduce himself and ask how we liked the food. He said to ask for anything vegetarian next time and he'll do it (;

excerpts: We ordered (2) papa rellena, mofongo, alcapurrias, empanadas, and the appetizer combo (tostones, yucca con mojo, platanos maduros).
And another appetizer like a tamal, Puerto Rican version.
Made with plantains/platanos, tara root, and more!
We ordered one main dish we shared - paella.
We both ordered tropical smoothie drinks.
Like smooth tropical milkshakes.
Made with Caribbean tropical fruits.
I'm lactose intolerant, so I ditched the milk, and replaced with water.
Still so good.
All that was mentioned, you're going to have to cross-reference the menu to the pics posted on Yelp!
mofongo.author: Roger S.
mofongo.review:
I have been going to El Nuevo Fruitilandia for about 25 years! When it was kind of a dive, but great food. When I moved into the neighborhood. Yes, it's been around that long. Shows how old I am! I haven't been there in a couple of years. So I took my niece - her first time to El Nuevo Fruitilandia. As much as I love this restaurant, when operated by the former owners, I really believe the new owners have tweaked some dishes, making them just as good or better. And added some new dishes and appetizers on the menu.

My niece and I went mostly for appetizers (tapas). We ordered (2) papa rellena, mofongo, alcapurrias, empanadas, and the appetizer combo (tostones, yucca con mojo, platanos maduros). And another appetizer like a tamal, Puerto Rican version. Made with plantains/platanos, tara root, and more! We ordered one main dish we shared - paella. We both ordered tropical smoothie drinks. Like smooth tropical milkshakes. Made with Caribbean tropical fruits. I'm lactose intolerant, so I ditched the milk, and replaced with water. Still so good. All that was mentioned, you're going to have to cross-reference the menu to the pics posted on Yelp! to see the actual plates.

Did I eat everything we ordered? I could have! But I just wanted to sample and gave the rest to my niece to take home.

The decor hasn't changed much since the last owners' remodel. Actually, some of the same wall decor from the very orignal restaurant, 25 years ago. The restaurant is clean and quaint. They no longer have a guitar player in the front window area, like they used to on Friday and Saturday nights. Would be nice to have. The waiter/server was very friendly and helpful.  We ate lunch when they opened. I know dinner must get crowded.

El Nuevo Fruitilandia is an even more special place to dine for me. If you want to try Puerto Rican-Cuban cuisine, El Nuevo Fruitilandia stands out! I give them a high-5 rating! They compete well with all the new restaurants on lower 24th St (Calle 24/Veinticuatro). I think they surpass a lot of the newer trendy places. And it still has the flavor of the Mission heritage. El Nuevo Fruitilandia has been there longer than folks know. And I hope it will be there for many more years!

I showed my Yelp! coupon on my smartphone and got the discount. That paid for an appetizer+. So don't forget to mention and show when your first order. And check if they're Groupon-friendly too.

excerpts: I had the veggie Mofongo and it was really good.
Very authentic and filling.
I will be going back to try other items on the menu.
Was very reasonable as well.
Under $20 for a drink and meal is a great deal IMO.
mofongo.author: Milesh J.
mofongo.review: This is a cozy and casual restaurant in Mission serving Cuban and Puerto Rican meal. My server was Raven and she was very friendly, attentive and provided some great suggestions for drinks and food. I had the veggie Mofongo and it was really good. Very authentic and filling. I will be going back to try other items on the menu. Was very reasonable as well. Under $20 for a drink and meal is a great deal IMO.

excerpts: I loved the mofongo and I was also seriously impressed with the sautéed shrimp and arroz con gandules.
I HIGHLY recommend this quaint but wonderful little restaurant!!!
mofongo.author: DeAnna J.
mofongo.review: The food was truly authentic! I loved the mofongo and I was also seriously impressed with the sautéed shrimp and arroz con gandules. I HIGHLY recommend this quaint but wonderful little restaurant!!!

excerpts: I ordered a Cuban sandwich and my Wife ordered the Mofongo .
We also had lots of plantains/platanos.
The food was pretty good and the pepper infused vinegar on the table went well on my sandwich.
Overall we though the food was good, but just a little pricey
mofongo.author: Bruce S.
mofongo.review: We recently met a group of friends at El Nuevo Fruitlandia for an early dinner. There were 6 of us and we all had eaten here before it changed hands. The old Fruitlandia served Salvadorian food and it was very good. Now it features Cuban and Puerto Rican food. Where the old restaurant was kind of funky the way it was decorated and it has changed a little. I noticed the photo of my Wife in her head dress costume for Carnaval was missing from the wall. She is pretty attractive so maybe someone wanted a memento of the Carnaval parade?  I ordered a Cuban sandwich and my Wife ordered the Mofongo . We also had lots of plantains/platanos. The food was pretty good and the pepper infused vinegar on the table went well on my sandwich. Overall we though the food was good, but just a little pricey

excerpts: We ordered the tostones, mofongo, pastel for appetizers and for dinner we had the ropa vieja, pierna de puerco horneada...
it was all delicious!!
Make sure you ask for the Puerto Rican hot sauce...
sorry we emptied the bottle.
Order the flan con queso...
it was so good...cheesy and worth it!!!
We will be back...
Can't wait.
mofongo.author: hac h.
mofongo.review: Cute restaurant...we had the same photo of a house in Puerto Rico as they did! We ordered the tostones, mofongo, pastel for appetizers and for dinner we had the ropa vieja, pierna de puerco horneada...it was all delicious!! Make sure you ask for the Puerto Rican hot sauce...sorry we emptied the bottle. Order the flan con queso...it was so good...cheesy and worth it!!! We will be back...Can't wait.

excerpts: We can't find any place that serves mofongo near our home in Placer County, so when we are out of town we often look for a great place to get our "mofongo fix."
Husband likes his very traditional, with pork, so this place was perfect.
It serves it with pork or vegetarian.
I prefer it with chicken, but the pork was very tender and, after all it IS the "other" white meat, so I can live with pork just fine.
It is the mofongo that you really need to come here for, though.
It is not easy to find and it is so delicious!
mofongo.author: Joanna M.
mofongo.review: We love Puerto Rican food, with Husband having grown up with it and all. We can't find any place that serves mofongo near our home in Placer County, so when we are out of town we often look for a great place to get our "mofongo fix."  Husband likes his very traditional, with pork, so this place was perfect. It serves it with pork or vegetarian. I prefer it with chicken, but the pork was very tender and, after all it IS the "other" white meat, so I can live with pork just fine. The ground beef empanadas and papa rellenas (mashed potatoes with a bit of ground beef deep fried together) also happen to be a couple of our favorites, and they were done well. We were very happy to see that they were served with the Thousand Island type sauce also known as "pink mayo" that is the perfect complement to both these tapas. It is the mofongo that you really need to come here for, though. It is not easy to find and it is so delicious!

excerpts: We ordered Mofongo and the Ropa Vieja because they are classic Puerto Rican dishes and could serve as a sort of control group.
The Mofongo came out a very small portion, molded on the plate in the shape of a dome with a (kinda stale) plantain chip sticking out.
It was very good, we thoroughly enjoyed it
but it was gone in 4 bites.
The really surprising thing was that the Ropa Vieja was even skimpier.
It was on a plate that you would expect to hold a side dinner salad.
mofongo.author: Emma H.
mofongo.review:
My husband and I wandered in here because Yelp had a check-in-offer for 15% off our bill ;) We ordered Mofongo and the Ropa Vieja because they are classic Puerto Rican dishes and could serve as a sort of control group. The Mofongo came out a very small portion, molded on the plate in the shape of a dome with a (kinda stale) plantain chip sticking out. It was very good, we thoroughly enjoyed it but it was gone in 4 bites. The really surprising thing was that the Ropa Vieja was even skimpier. It was on a plate that you would expect to hold a side dinner salad. It had a tiny scoop of white rice, a tiny cup of black beans and a tiny scoop of meat. Both plates together would barely have even been enough to feed one hungry person. We were one hungry person and one filled-up-on-Phil'z person and it was nowhere near enough food. 
The server was so nice and we tipped him very generously, of course based on our pre-discounted total and he seemed very grateful. Unfortunately we will not return though because in order to fill our appetites we would need to spend about $40 and ain't nobody got time for that at lunchtime.

excerpts: After a friend raved about a restaurant in Miami that served amazing Mofongo, I went on a mission to find a restaurant in California that served it.
So while I was on a trip to San Francisco I paid a visit to El Nuevo Frutilandia in the Mission District for their Mofongo.
I ordered the Vegetarian Mofongo (which on their menu is only listed as an entree with sides, but our server let us order it a la carte as the appetizer).
Granted, this was my first experience with Mofongo, so I have nothing to compare it to,
but I wasn't overly impressed.

I didn't think it tasted like it had too much garlic, but to be honest, my sister and I suffered the remainder of the night with awful garlic breath (sorry for the overshare, but if you come here on a date, best to avoid the Mofongo).
mofongo.author: Brianna M.
mofongo.review:
After a friend raved about a restaurant in Miami that served amazing Mofongo, I went on a mission to find a restaurant in California that served it. Surprisingly, this proved to be more difficult than I originally thought.

So while I was on a trip to San Francisco I paid a visit to El Nuevo Frutilandia in the Mission District for their Mofongo. I ordered the Vegetarian Mofongo (which on their menu is only listed as an entree with sides, but our server let us order it a la carte as the appetizer). Granted, this was my first experience with Mofongo, so I have nothing to compare it to, but I wasn't overly impressed. I didn't think it tasted like it had too much garlic, but to be honest, my sister and I suffered the remainder of the night with awful garlic breath (sorry for the overshare, but if you come here on a date, best to avoid the Mofongo). 

We also ordered the pulled pork entree. It was good, but the surprising standout was the Sopa de Pollo that came as the side. There were big chunks of chicken and vegetables. If I lived in the neighborhood, I'd come by here and get a bowl every time I was craving something warm, healthy, comfort food.

excerpts: We also shared the veggie mofongo tapa, which was heartier than expected and smothered in a delicious tomato sauce that was comforting, it had a taste from home.
I also tried the mango sangria, I couldn't taste the mango, but the sangria was really refreshing.
I had to have a second glass!
mofongo.author: Hope A.
mofongo.review:
My husband and I tried this place last night. We were greeted by a friendly woman,( I'm assuming she is the owner.) We ordered the tostone's, mmm. They had this delicious garlic lemon sauce and were salted just enough. We also shared the veggie mofongo tapa, which was heartier than expected and smothered in a delicious tomato sauce that was comforting, it had a taste from home. I also tried the mango sangria, I couldn't taste the mango, but the sangria was really refreshing. I had to have a second glass!
For our entree's: I had the Limon Ajo Camarones, I loved this dish. The flavor of the sauce was so good, lemony garlic and the prawns were cleaned and cooked just right! The rice and cuban black beans had a good flavor too. Great portion size. I was stuffed!
My husband enjoyed the Lechon Horneado. So flavorful and moist, also a great portion size.. If you like pork? This dish is absolutely amazing! I tasted it and it had so much flavor. 
We will definitely be going back! This place is a hidden gem. I never had even noticed it until I yelped Cuban food. The interior is really cute, and makes you feel like you are on a mini-vacay. Friendly people and service, and really fresh and tasty quality food!

excerpts: hehehe anyways I will update my review once I go back for some Mofongo and Fricase de Pollo.
mofongo.author: Lannette G.
mofongo.review:
If you go at Lunch, you might want to consider ordering your food before you get there, if you don't mind rolling with Latin Time, or European luncheon hour you'll be just find.

I have yet to try their actual food, I just keep going back for their insanely delicious Cuban Sandwichs. Okay so the bread isn't that flacky yellow baguette you pick up in Miami at Publix or your local Farm Store, but who cares they load up this sucker with so much marinated amazing Pork (the most important part of the Cuban Wich) by the end you forget sandwiches come with bread. 

Oh the Mother land...hehehe anyways I will update my review once I go back for some Mofongo and Fricase de Pollo.

excerpts:
We had  vaca frita: too dry and too  shreeded lacked mojo and   the portion was small, but the black beans were on point
Mofongo:
I could not taste the pork or chicharron at all but

the tomato sauce for it was amazing
Chicken soup:

Was nice great broth
Tostones: Were very good and right on point  but they should of being served with a dipping sauce
mofongo.author: Manny R.
mofongo.review:
So If i was eating this back in South Florida it would only get 3  stars but since it is in San Francisco the land of the taqueria,  I'll give it 4 for being different and offering a unique cuisine to the city.

We had  vaca frita: too dry and too  shreeded lacked mojo and   the portion was small, but the black beans were on point
Mofongo:  I could not taste the pork or chicharron at all but the tomato sauce for it was amazing
Chicken soup: Was nice great broth
Tostones: Were very good and right on point  but they should of being served with a dipping sauce
Maduros were good and fried correctly

Overall  it was okay but much room for improvement.

On another note the server was very attentive and seem to know her menu well

excerpts: If you go here, get the mofongo and enjoy!
And compared to the mofongo, they paled in comparison.
but I hope it won't be too long before I'll be getting the mofongo again.
mofongo.author: Art O.
mofongo.review:
If you go here, get the mofongo and enjoy! The unique garlicky flavors of the fried plantains will bring joy to your taste buds.

The other items we tried - some pork chops and steak cooked in a wine sauce with peppers - were a bit on the tough, dry side. And compared to the mofongo, they paled in comparison.

Service was friendly but a bit on the slow side. We came a little after they opened up, there was only one family there beside the two of us but it took a while to get the food. 

I'd be willing to try some other items but I hope it won't be too long before I'll be getting the mofongo again.

excerpts: Authentic, friendly, casual and the best Mofongo
I've had in 20 years!
Always my birthday favorite.
mofongo.author: DrRich W.
mofongo.review: Authentic, friendly, casual and the best Mofongo I've had in 20 years! Always my birthday favorite.

excerpts: We ordered many different items (alcapurria, mofongo, papa rellena, pastel, maduros, roast pork, etc.) and everything was perfect.
mofongo.author: Cin W.
mofongo.review:
I've been eating here for a few years now...I love Puerto Rican / Cuban food, and this is one of the only PR/Cuban restaurants in the city.  I haven't been here for a while, and finally went back for some dinner with friends on Friday night.  To my surprise, the restaurant is under new management now....and it's GREAT.  We ordered many different items (alcapurria, mofongo, papa rellena, pastel, maduros, roast pork, etc.) and everything was perfect.  

The previous owners were El Salvadorean...which never bothered me (you don't have to be Puerto Rican or Cuban to know how to cook the food); but I know it bothered some people, because the food didn't seem "authentic".  You'll be happy to know that the new owners are indeed Puerto Ricans.  The new owners and staff were so delightful, accommodating and friendly...I absolutely LOVE good service.

The only thing I'm worried about is that this is a really tiny place, and it seems like they will become more popular under this new management...so in the future, wait times might be kinda hectic.  With the previous owners, they were never too crowded, and I was always able to get a table anytime of the day/evening.  I suppose it wouldn't be too bad if I go super early right when they open.  Kinda sucks that the location is right in the heart of hipster-ville (I'm a Mission native, and I'm against the hipster invasions).

excerpts: The food here isn't that great, especially the habichuelas rositas and mofongo.
I just moved to San Francisco, so I guess I still have to find a good Puerto Rican or Dominican restaurant :(
mofongo.author: David B.
mofongo.review: You peeps don't know what you are missing. The food here isn't that great, especially the habichuelas rositas and mofongo. I just moved to San Francisco, so I guess I still have to find a good Puerto Rican or Dominican restaurant :(

excerpts: Mofongo starter was excellent as well as all meat entrees we ordered (pork and beef).
I can see myself coming here often.
mofongo.author: Marina R.
mofongo.review: Came here with friends through a groupon reserve program (25% off the bill) to have some puerto rican food. The place looks like an honest local business, not too big, not too fancy, just very pleasant, like you're at a friend's place. Waiters were nice, helped with recommendations and didn't bother us unnecesarily. Mofongo starter was excellent as well as all meat entrees we ordered (pork and beef). I can see myself coming here often.

excerpts: Their Mofongo is AMAZING!...along with the garlic shrimp salad, bistec, white sangria and red sangria.
Everything I've ordered here has been delicious!!!!
I am now a REGULAR at "El Nuevo Frutilandia!
mofongo.author: Claire K.
mofongo.review: Love, Love, Love this place! Best Boriqua cuisine in SF!!!! Their Mofongo is AMAZING!...along with the garlic shrimp salad, bistec, white sangria and red sangria. Everything I've ordered here has been delicious!!!! I am now a REGULAR at "El Nuevo Frutilandia!" =)

excerpts: the mofongo was the only good thing that we ordered, even the sangría didn't taste right.
Way over-priced!!!
Not coming back!
mofongo.author: Liliana B.
mofongo.review: Flavors of the food are not the correct ones for puertorrican plates...the mofongo was the only good thing that we ordered, even the sangría didn't taste right. Way over-priced!!! Not coming back!

excerpts: I ordered the sangria and the Vegetarian Mofongo and was not disappointed.
Can't wait to drop by again!
mofongo.author: Whitney W.
mofongo.review: Finally a Cuban/Puerto Rican restaurant in SF! This east coast/southern gal has missed this type of authentic cuisine. I ordered the sangria and the Vegetarian Mofongo and was not disappointed. Can't wait to drop by again!

excerpts: I got the mofongo, which was alright, but nothing compared to the version at Parada 22, another 2.5 stars.
The wifey got the special of the day, fricase de pollo.
This dish was alright, 3 stars is fair.
mofongo.author: Miguel V.
mofongo.review:
Ouch, this really hurts. I so wanted to love this place. Disappointed is a strong word. Perhaps too strong for the food in this case. Underwhelmed might be more appropriate. However, disappointed is probably not a strong enough descriptor of the service. 

I arrived about 30 minutes before my wife and ordered a beer while I waited. Knowing that she would be starving when she got there, I also ordered one alcapurria and some maduros. When my wife arrived, I had finished my beer and the waittress came over. We ordered another beer, a water for my wife, and she commented that the apps would be right out. 10 minutes later when she finally came to get our food order, none of those three things had come out yet. She said they would be right out. 10 minutes later, my beer came. My wife asked again for her water. 10 minutes later, still no water and no apps. We asked again and finally got the water. Eventually the apps came as well, but by that time it had been almost an hour since I ordered them and they were really no longer necessary. No apology or even acknowledgement of the wait. I cook maduros all the time at home. They take 5 minutes; cut and fry, it's really that simple. 

Unfortunately, the maduros were not very good either. They were really dry and not greasy or juicy at all like they are usually served, negative stars for the wait and disappointing presentation. The alcapurria was alright, but lacked a bit of flavor, 3 stars. I also ordered a pastel, which I had gotten to go before, so I knew not to expect much, meh, 2.5 stars. I got the mofongo, which was alright, but nothing compared to the version at Parada 22, another 2.5 stars. The wifey got the special of the day, fricase de pollo. This dish was alright, 3 stars is fair. I make a better version, in both of our opinions, but it had decent flavor. 

The services just really killed it. It literally took an hour to get the apps. The waittress must have been newish. She seemed very uncomfortable with the names of the dishes on the menu, not to mention the Spanish pronunciations, always referring to them by their English descriptions (e.g., "oh, so you want the sweet plantains?"). She seemed confused a lot and, for some reason, was struggling despite there being three servers and only 5 small tables. 

We will not be back for dinner. I could return for pasteles to go, but only if I get really desperate.

excerpts: the mofongo lacked the pork fat that is usually added to it.
and the pernil lacked so much flavor.
mofongo.author: michelle r.
mofongo.review:
Okay so I 'm Puerto Rican from NYC and I was excited to come and try the food here. Since we are a minority on this side and there are'nt many places to try Puerto Rican food I thought I was excited to try this place . Well firstly the people who cook here are not PR's....the food is okay nothing that is going to make me crave for this place at all. - food lacks flavor...service was okay

the mofongo lacked the pork fat that is usually added to it. and the pernil lacked so much flavor.

excerpts: Was excited to try the mofongo, but it was not impressive.
All the other dishes (when the food finally did come) were incredibly bland and tasteless.
mofongo.author: Sam G.
mofongo.review: I live in the neighborhood and have been meaning to try this place for awhile.  Honestly, don't bother.  Considering the place was nearly empty the service was terrible.  Was excited to try the mofongo, but it was not impressive.  All the other dishes (when the food finally did come) were incredibly bland and tasteless.

excerpts: Great vegetarian mofongo, but disappointed they don't serve fried pork.
The service was a little slow, but everything was delicious.
We'll be back.
mofongo.author: Kitzzy A.
mofongo.review: Great vegetarian mofongo, but disappointed they don't serve fried pork. The service was a little slow, but everything was delicious. We'll be back.

excerpts: I lived in Puerto Rico for 2 years and never enjoyed mofongo, but the food here has a definate Island flavor.
mofongo.author: Brenda B.
mofongo.review:
Must haves:
  Chicken soup
  Platano maduro
  Tostones

The rest of food was very delicious- but the above were excellent.  I lived in Puerto Rico for 2 years and never enjoyed mofongo, but the food here has a definate Island flavor.  

Sit by the window and enjoy the food traffic on 24th street, especially nice on a sunny day!

excerpts: Mofongo, was excellent and moist!
(most places I've had it make it too dry, not here!!).
mofongo.author: Diane F.
mofongo.review: Delicious Cuban and Puerto Rican food!  I was searching for a PR restaurant serving alcapurria, finally found it here and it was delicious!!!!!  Mofongo, was excellent and moist!  (most places I've had it make it too dry, not here!!). Chuletas were moist and perfectly seasoned!!  The sangria was yummy too!  Can't wait to go back!!

excerpts: I have to say that when I tasted the mofongo I felt like I was back at home.
Awesome mofongo, the tostones were great, the papa rellena was great, maduros (we call it amarillos) were great, pasteles were great.
mofongo.author: John Q.
mofongo.review: I'm a Puerto Rican from Puerto Rico, not 2nd generation or from the east coast so I know as a fact how the food from island taste.  I have to say that when I tasted the mofongo I felt like I was back at home.  Awesome mofongo, the tostones were great, the papa rellena was great, maduros (we call it amarillos) were great, pasteles were great.  Overall the food was awesome, not 5 star because the rice and beans was just ok, not great, and the malta was not malta india from Puerto Rico, was some other brand that we dont have in the island. Hightly recommended!!!  Tell Carmen that John sent you.

excerpts: My favorite was the Mofongo, I would eat this all day every day when Im at home.
and this one was very delicious as well and the presentation was super cute.
Portions were big, big, big!
The chef is Puerto Rican
so he knows about which flavors to incorporate one each dish.
IS definitely a most go if you are craving a delicious meal from the island.
Prices are good as well.
I will probably come to Frutilandia every weekend now that i have discovered it.
mofongo.author: Elizabeth D.
mofongo.review: I finally found a place for my days when Im homesick and Im craving some of my mom's food. Delicious Caribbean flavors! I was craving Cuban food on a sunday night and found this place here on Yelp. I saw the menu and immediately jumped on Bart and walked the streets of the Mission to find this small and cozy Cuban/PR joint. Since the minute I walked it I was like, ok, this looks good! the music and the art in the walls was authentic from the island. I ordered the Papa Rellena which is Cuabn and it was very flavorful. My favorite was the Mofongo, I would eat this all day every day when Im at home. and this one was very delicious as well and the presentation was super cute. Portions were big, big, big! The chef is Puerto Rican so he knows about which flavors to incorporate one each dish. IS definitely a most go if you are craving a delicious meal from the island. Prices are good as well. I will probably come to Frutilandia every weekend now that i have discovered it.

excerpts: Mofongo and alcapurrias and tostones.
My family also orders pasteles from them every year at Christmas time to bring home.
mofongo.author: Hunter G.
mofongo.review:
There are only 10 and a half Puerto Ricans in the Bay Area, I am one of them and "nine" of them are related to me. Not even the owners of Fruliandia are Puerto Rican. The only Puerto Rican restaurant in S.F. and they're not Puerto Rican. That gives me an idea.

OK, maybe there are more boricua but I don't know them and it hasn't stopped this place from making great food. I usually get the same thing everytime. Mofongo and alcapurrias and tostones. My family also orders pasteles from them every year at Christmas time to bring home. Pasteles are a type of plantain dumpling that can have pork and other things and are usually wrapped in banana leaves (like my grandmother used to do) or cooking parchment.

Everything I've had there has tasted authentic and I like to bring out of town guests there to let them sample the food of my people. It's a small place in the Mission and there only ever seems to be two people working so it's not good for large groups.

There are a couple of other places I found on the other side of the bridge but that is a separate review. For now, Frutilandia is the best place to go for Puerto Rican food. Oh yeah, and I guess Cuban food too.

excerpts: Excellent dishes enjoyed that night include  Mofongo (mashed plantains and pork sauteed with garlic and olive oil...
mofongo.author: LaSha G.
mofongo.review:
This is probably THE only SF restaurant that specializes in Puerto Rican food from what I can tell, but don't hold me to that.  I went here with a friend on Friday night before a jazz concert at the Red Poppy Art House, and the restaurant is tiny but in a cozy way as opposed to a clausterphobic way.  The night I went there was only one lady manning the bar, taking orders, and serving food but she was really sweet and patient since I didn't know what I wanted to order and we didn't have to wait too long for anything.

Excellent dishes enjoyed that night include  Mofongo (mashed plantains and pork sauteed with garlic and olive oil...that you dip in a secret sauce), Pierna de Puerco Horneado (really tender pork with carribean spices) served with a tasty side of dish of rice and beans and my friend had the Ropa Vieja (flank steak in a creole sauce) even though I meant to tell him that I heard the Vaca Frita (fried shredded flank steak) was the way to go.  He enjoyed his dish regardless.

At $9.95 for an entre, I thought the prices here were cheap.    I'm glad I found this place (via Yelp btw) ...I'll definitely bring some friends here in the future....especially since the Red Poppy is right around the corner.

excerpts: They give you cup of sauce with your mofongo
mofongo.author: Michael S.
mofongo.review:
Before anything else this place is 3.3 to 3.5 stars...

The sandwiches are really tasty. I didn't order a sandwich but ended up getting one anyways, I guess the waitress misheard me. It was really good so how can I complain? Maybe she secretly knew I wanted a sandwich and changed it for me :)? They give you cup of sauce with your mofongo that's really tasty, I recommend using it in conjunction with the sandwich for maximum taste utility. 

The service isn't super quick so have the expectation when you go in and it will help.

I'm usually a tortas man but this sandwich is in the top 3 of latin sandwiches.

excerpts: Mofongo was a bit dry and there was only maybe three shrimp in there made it a little less dry with the sauce on it.
Black beans were decent, could have used a little more flavor but it was better than the last time I went which was almost 5 years ago (judging from the review I am looking at).
mofongo.author: Gina R.
mofongo.review: The service was pretty bad but it was a busy Friday night so not overly surprised. The food was good, the surtido which has tostones, maduros (ripe plantains) and yucca were all really good. Mofongo was a bit dry and there was only maybe three shrimp in there made it a little less dry with the sauce on it. Black beans were decent, could have used a little more flavor but it was better than the last time I went which was almost 5 years ago (judging from the review I am looking at). Also, on the menu it should say that the pink beans have pork in it because friend of mine almost ate it and she is vegetarian. She discovered this after a bite and could taste the pork. At least the server should have informed us but they were fairly busy when we got there so I guess some important details were missed. Life goes on. I would go back but not during the weekend or at least during a time that they're not so busy. I am Puerto Rican so I know what this food should taste like, so I think there's definitely room for improvement. The empanadas de espinacas were quite good and one of my meat eating friends liked the alcapurrias.

excerpts: We ordered tapas (empanadas, mofongo, sweet plantains), as well as the slow roasted pork.
We topped it off with sangria.
Everything was delicious!
mofongo.author: Nia A.
mofongo.review: Great food! We ordered tapas (empanadas, mofongo, sweet plantains), as well as the slow roasted pork. We topped it off with sangria. Everything was delicious!

excerpts: The mofongo (smashed fried yucca)we get the vegetarian) is also very good, if a bit greasy.
mofongo.author: Suzanne S.
mofongo.review:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed El Nuevo Fruitlandia yet. This place is probably the first hidden treasure I found when moving to the Mission a few years ago. My father lived in Puerto Rico and has always grumbled about the lack of Puerto Rican food in the bay area. So when he requested Carne Guisada (a slow cooked pork stew) for his birthday dinner, I thought, "hey, I'm in the Mission, I can figure this out." We were not dissapointed. El Nuevo Fruitlandia is now a family staple.

Theres a whole list of fried goodness for appetizers: the tostones (smooshed and fried slices of platano) are my favorite, although I wish they had some homemade salsa and not just tapatio. They bring you warm toasted water bread while you're waiting, too, which my sister adores. 

You can tell they've made an effort to cater to vegetarians, which I really appreciate. The chile rellenos (about $7) are the best I've had, in a rich tomato and chile sauce with bell pepers and onions. The mofongo (smashed fried yucca)we get the vegetarian) is also very good, if a bit greasy. The platanos maduros (sweet) are reminiscent of fried bananas but somehow savory and delicious with lots of hot sauce and the white rice and black beans that come with every entree. Yucca con mojo is always perfectly cooked, creamy and so tasty with the lemon they give you squeezed on top. We usually order the salad, too, which is simple but fresh and good, with cucumbers, corn, onions and romaine.

They also have lots of juices and shakes. I like the juices, but last time I got the shake and it tasted like frothy milk and sugar -- I could barely taste the fruit at all, which was weird. 

The service is very slow but that's because they make everything fresh right when you order it.

This is one of those unique little gems that reminds me how damn lucky I am to live in San Francisco.

excerpts: Vegetarian mofongo!
Yucca!
Plantains!
Food is made to order, so expect a bit of a wait.
mofongo.author: Andi T.
mofongo.review: It's a cozy little place and has a great selection of traditional Cuban/Puerto Rican cuisine, including a number of veggie options.  Vegetarian mofongo!  Yucca!  Plantains!  Food is made to order, so expect a bit of a wait.

excerpts: We ordered mostly tapas stile entrees and we started with the famous MOFONGO, excellent!
However, the mofongo usually takes a while to prepare, so order it as soon as you are seated.
Not disappointing, try the mofongo, I love their version.
Maybe not before a hot date/night...
Two words - garlic breath.
Small, cozy, friendly waitress and good inexpensive menu selection - I'm coming back!
mofongo.author: Yamil A.
mofongo.review:
We just finished another great dinner at El Nuevo Frutilandia.  I'm even more impressed because we got to chat a bit with the waitress.  Just learned this restaurant has been open for over 25 years, that the friendly cute waitress Irene (EE reh neh) has been working there for the past 9 and they are not Puerto Ricans or Cubans...  This is why we were both even more impressed.  The food is well done!

I've been craving PR cooking for a while, so I got a fix tonight.  I went with my friend Rita C who is from the Dominican Republic; you can say we know Caribbean food!

We ordered mostly tapas stile entrees and we started with the famous MOFONGO, excellent!

Followed by ALCAPURRIAS- not bad but I miss the regular just plantain alcapurrias, these are made with yucca also.

We also had a YUCCA AL MOJO dish and followed by a BACALAO GISAU WITH RICE (stew of cod fish with steam rice) which came with the chicken soup or green salad.  The yucca was perfect and the bacalao less salty than I'm used to, but flavorful.  

I most say, their chicken soup is darn good.  The most authentic Puerto Rican chicken soup I've had outside of the island.

This was a Thursday evening and they were not crowded.  However, the mofongo usually takes a while to prepare, so order it as soon as you are seated.  While you wait, enjoy some warm bread!

===================================================

The only Puerto Rican restaurant I've been able to find in the city.  And trust me, I've looked!
Not disappointing, try the mofongo, I love their version.  Maybe not before a hot date/night...  Two words - garlic breath.
Small, cozy, friendly waitress and good inexpensive menu selection - I'm coming back!

excerpts: the mofongo is dry and kind of bland,
mofongo.author: Gretchen F.
mofongo.review:
Soooo...again, I am BORICUA.  I have gone to Fruitilandia several times over the years.  And like the other reviews, I so desperately want to give this place a great rating, BUT i just can't....

The pastellas are homemade and scrumptious.  Just like my great grandmother used to make.  If nothing else, at least try this place for the pastellas, because EVERYONE on this planet would be a happier, better person for having ate a homemade pastellas...

Now....back to the rest of the place... the mofongo is dry and kind of bland, BUT the garlic sauce is tasty.....

But the service is soooooooo slow here....don't go starving, cause you just might start chewing your left arm off while your waiting...

I highly suggest getting appetizers there...because the main dishes are just iffy....

to bad Sofrito in Oakland has closed.   Now THAT is authentic Puerto Rican food....

excerpts: Anyway, on my one visit, I was delighted by the vegetarian mofongo.
Mofongo is a dish I had not tried before and it was fantastic.
mofongo.author: Jere K.
mofongo.review:
Okay, so I've only been here once, but it's not my fault. I want to come back, but it seems that every time I wander by, they're closed. What's up with the funky hours?

Anyway, on my one visit, I was delighted by the vegetarian mofongo. Mofongo is a dish I had not tried before and it was fantastic.

The place is cozy and the staff was super friendly despite a bit of language barrier. We ended up saying "thank you" to each other A LOT. Anyway, I'll keep walking by hoping to see if it's ever open again at any point other than while I'm at work.

excerpts: We heard this place had mofongo, a wonderful mash of plantains, spices and pork that we enjoyed in Puerto Rico several years ago.
And it did, but it wasn't that good.
It was dry and tasteless until we poured some mystery broth over it -- not sure if that was the right thing to do, but it worked.
The picadillo was bland.
The ropa viejo was OK.
The appetizer dumplings, however, were unique + tasty.
Cheap eats.
Not sure it's worth visiting again, though.
mofongo.author: Rufus X.
mofongo.review:
We heard this place had mofongo, a wonderful mash of plantains, spices and pork that we enjoyed in Puerto Rico several years ago.  And it did, but it wasn't that good.  It was dry and tasteless until we poured some mystery broth over it -- not sure if that was the right thing to do, but it worked.

The picadillo was bland.  The ropa viejo was OK.  The appetizer dumplings, however, were unique + tasty.  Cheap eats.  Not sure it's worth visiting again, though.

excerpts:
Mofongo -- 
HELL YES!  
So good.  
Chicken Soup -- yummy, yummy, if I were sick, I would want this.
Pierna de Puerco Horneada -- so tender, delicious green marinade...
mofongo.author: Dwayne A.
mofongo.review:
Definitely coming back and trying more menu items!

Mofongo -- HELL YES!  So good.  
Chicken Soup -- yummy, yummy, if I were sick, I would want this.
Pierna de Puerco Horneada -- so tender, delicious green marinade...
Ropa Vieja -- deliciously flavored, my friend loved it.

Loved hearing someone chopping something all to hell in the back.  

Closed on Mondays and no special on Wednesday...

Yes, service is slow but this is an island restaurant...also they were out of several of the beers, but again this feels *authentic* to me.  And can someone please.  Please.  PLEASE direct me to a location where I can get a can of Medalla Light?  I drank that stuff like water in PR.

excerpts: IF you LOVE garlic and LOVE plantain ... you have got to try the MOFONGO at this place!
The first time I ever tried PR food was here --- at Fruitilandia ... that was about 3 years ago ...
BOY ...
when I took my first bite of that MOFONGO ...
OMG!
so much going on in my mouth ...
flavor bud wise
I've yet to have better mofongo ...
the other stuff on the menu is good ~ nothing FANTABULOUS ... but the MONFONGO is indescribably delicious!!!
Overall~I would def.
recommend!!
mofongo.author: Bravo J.
mofongo.review: IF you LOVE garlic and LOVE plantain ... you have got to try the MOFONGO at this place! The first time I ever tried PR food was here --- at Fruitilandia ... that was about 3 years ago ... BOY ... when I took my first bite of that MOFONGO ... OMG! so much going on in my mouth ... flavor bud wise ~~  I've yet to have better mofongo ... the other stuff on the menu is good ~ nothing FANTABULOUS ... but the MONFONGO is indescribably delicious!!!  Overall~I would def. recommend!!

excerpts: other good stuff includes, ropa vieja, baca frita, mofongo, pollo en
salsa verde
, those are the ones i have tried, and will try some more stuff when i go back.
the little tamal-like pasteles are yummy too.
mofongo.author: Charlie M.
mofongo.review: I have been here a few times, and im always satisfied.  my cuban and puerto rican coworkers swear by it as authentic, and authentic or not, i know good food when i taste it.  not to mention, its easy on the wallet.  good lunch specials too, sandwiches are yummy.  other good stuff includes, ropa vieja, baca frita, mofongo, pollo en salsa verde, those are the ones i have tried, and will try some more stuff when i go back.  the little tamal-like pasteles are yummy too.

excerpts: 2# had the mofongo and that was good but not good!..
3# i had a sangria and that was
mofongo.author: Ivan C.
mofongo.review: so where do i start....1# the salsa music playing gave it a latin welcome vibe..2# had the mofongo and that was good but not good!..3# i had a sangria and that was bla!!..4# i had the ropa vieja with puertorican rice and lets just say i wish i rather had gone to the taco truck instead..5# if i was running the place i make it a priority that when the guest are done to make sure the waiters remove the plates before bringing out the bill..6#bottom line only reason i go bk is if i was walking near by and had to use the bathroom other then that this place let me down...but ill let u make ur own call..

excerpts: We loaded up instead on plaintains at El Nuevo Frutilandia, in the form of their Aperitivos Surtidos and Mofongo.
I'm not sure which item was what, but
the tamale looking thing on the combo dish was great, and the Mofongo (it was like hash) was REALLY good with the accompanying tomato-ey/brothy sauce.
Okay - we are talking about MY bday -
so there was plenty of protein coming thru the kitchen.
The Fried Pork Chops were AWESOME, just like grandma used to make.
Yes, my grandma is Chinese, but nevertheless, it was JUST like how she used to fry it up - simple salt and pepper yumminess.
I got the Picadillo a La Habana Vieja - which I enjoyed - can't go wrong with ground beef, tomato sauce and pimiento olives.
mofongo.author: CINDY K.
mofongo.review:
With every passing year, I think my metabolism slows down another critical increment.  And so, no way was there going to be a ridiculous MEATFEST for my bday this time!  We loaded up instead on plaintains at El Nuevo Frutilandia, in the form of their Aperitivos Surtidos and Mofongo.  I'm not sure which item was what, but the tamale looking thing on the combo dish was great, and the Mofongo (it was like hash) was REALLY good with the accompanying tomato-ey/brothy sauce.
Okay - we are talking about MY bday - so there was plenty of protein coming thru the kitchen.  The Fried Pork Chops were AWESOME, just like grandma used to make.  Yes, my grandma is Chinese, but nevertheless, it was JUST like how she used to fry it up - simple salt and pepper yumminess. I got the Picadillo a La Habana Vieja - which I enjoyed - can't go wrong with ground beef, tomato sauce and pimiento olives. I also got a bite of their Ropa Vieja - which was just ok to me; I mean it was moist and flavorful, but over-hyped to me.
I wish I could say how the dishes my other companions tried were, but they ate it all :-\
In conclusion, it was classic home-cooking w/Puerto Rican spices.  I could probably make a lot of the stuff myself, but being the lazy fuck that I am, I'll pay the very reasonable prices to have El Nuevo do it for me.  Just be forewarned they take that treat-you-like-family-thing to heart: they'll take their time, you gotta bug the waitress for what you want, but she's gonna give you a big ol' kiss and hug if it's your bday.

As I get older...but not really wiser...that worked out just right.  Having some good food, and spending time with people (some I see everyday, and some I don't get to see enough of) who warm my otherwise dead insides....there was no better way to spend my bday.

*WTF with the happy sappy shit? Finds a little kid to push down*

excerpts: The mofongo is growing on me and is quite tasty
but it's not enough to outweigh the slow service and other mediocre food.
This recent visit I had plantains, beans, and rice.
The beans were surprisingly disappointing.
Who screws up beans?
They were watery and bland.
The plantains were just okay, too.
Much prefer the plantains at Bissap Baobab or ChaChaCha.
mofongo.author: Susan L.
mofongo.review: I'm sticking with 2 stars on this one. The mofongo is growing on me and is quite tasty but it's not enough to outweigh the slow service and other mediocre food. This recent visit I had plantains, beans, and rice. The beans were surprisingly disappointing. Who screws up beans? They were watery and bland. The plantains were just okay, too. Much prefer the plantains at Bissap Baobab or ChaChaCha.

excerpts: I  started with the Mofongo, which had a delicious garlic sauce
but I couldnt taste any of the bits of pork, and the large pieces of fried tostones nearly chipped my teeth.
My sis had the Yuca Con Mojo (yucca with garlic).
She really loved that dish and I thought it had a great flavor but the yucca is way to rich for me.
My little nephew had the french fries, which were the best fries I've ever had anywhere, yummy!
Next, I tried the fried pork chops with rice and black beans.
Again, flavor was fabulous but the chops were fried to a crisp.
mofongo.author: Lauren S.
mofongo.review:
I had such high hopes for this place. Since it's the only Puerto Rican restaurant in SF (that anyone can find) I really wanted to give it as much praise as I possibly could.  

Unfortunately, I'd have to rate the food at Fruitilandia as so-so at best.  I  started with the Mofongo, which had a delicious garlic sauce but I couldnt taste any of the bits of pork, and the large pieces of fried tostones nearly chipped my teeth.  My sis had the Yuca Con Mojo (yucca with garlic).  She really loved that dish and I thought it had a great flavor but the yucca is way to rich for me.  My little nephew had the french fries, which were the best fries I've ever had anywhere, yummy!  Next, I tried the fried pork chops with rice and black beans.  Again, flavor was fabulous but the chops were fried to a crisp.  Sis had the Camarones Al Ajillo, Shrimp with Garlic.  The only problem with this dish was that it should've been described as shrimp with wine sauce because the wine was soooo overpowering, that was all we could taste.  The mango juice was refreshing and the chicken soup was good.  I am willing to give this place a 2nd chance, if someone on yelp can recommend a few of the outstanding dishes to try out.

excerpts: and so are the mofongo and tostones.
I ordered the milanesa plate and was very pleased.
We come here every time we are in town.
mofongo.author: Jackie J.
mofongo.review: This place is amazing. The food is made to order, it takes a while but is very worth the wait. Order the soup it is very tasty and so are the mofongo and tostones. I ordered the milanesa plate and was very pleased. We come here every time we are in town.

excerpts: I ordered the fried plantains, YUMMY, Mofongo, Yummy, but the Beef shredded dish was a bit disappointing, a bit dry and not so tasty..
I had to hot sauce everything.
But since it was hanging with friends, the place was nice and quiet!!
we came at like noon, no one was there..
but it was a random Wednesday for lunch .
mofongo.author: Tulie L.
mofongo.review: The place was cozy, the lady was nice- she even let me cancel the mango shake which I originally ordered but then decided to slurp some of my friends instead. I ordered the fried plantains, YUMMY, Mofongo, Yummy, but the Beef shredded dish was a bit disappointing, a bit dry and not so tasty.. I had to hot sauce everything. But since it was hanging with friends, the place was nice and quiet!! we came at like noon, no one was there.. but it was a random Wednesday for lunch .

excerpts: With the exception of the Mofongo, which was really tasty, I thought the food was pretty bland, but not bad.
When I think Latin I want spice.
I want heat.
There was none of that.
Just simple Puerto Rican and Cuban comfort food.
mofongo.author: Kent T.
mofongo.review: I had a friend visiting from Puerto Rico. He wanted to sample local Puerto Rican fair. This was all I was able to find. So off we went. With the exception of the Mofongo, which was really tasty, I thought the food was pretty bland, but not bad. When I think Latin I want spice. I want heat. There was none of that. Just simple Puerto Rican and Cuban comfort food.

excerpts: The Mofongo was delicious!
I ordered the Bistek de Palomilla which was a bit lemony for me.
It was still good, but having only tasted a few different versions, I could not say if it was more or less authentic than the other.
The Mofongo though was the hit for me!
mofongo.author: Berna P.
mofongo.review: I went to this place with a couple of friends for a birthday celebration, and I really enjoyed it. The Mofongo was delicious! I ordered the Bistek de Palomilla which was a bit lemony for me. It was still good, but having only tasted a few different versions, I could not say if it was more or less authentic than the other. I will definitely return to this place as I want to try the ropa vieja and other entrees. My friends had the vaca frita and a pork dish The pork was a bit dry, but I also enjoyed the vaca frita. The Mofongo though was the hit for me!

excerpts: The mofongo (you are supposed to eat it with the broth!)
as an appetizer was FANTASTIC!
mofongo.author: Ted D.
mofongo.review:
Amazing!!  My mom was cuban and my dad was Puerto Rican so I was raised on delicious cuban/puerto rican food!  We recently moved to the area and I have been craving a taste of home.   We found our corner of Miami here in San Francisco!  Everything we ate was FANTASTIC!  My favorite dish is Vaca Frita and it was made exceptionally well here!  Make sure to get black beans and rice and some yuca - delicious!!  The mofongo (you are supposed to eat it with the broth!) as an appetizer was FANTASTIC!  And if you have room make sure to get a cafe con leche and some flan to end your meal just right!

It's a dive but well worth the trip and cheap!   We will be back often I am sure!  One note - they are closed on Mondays.

excerpts: We had the mofongo appetizer - yummy but a little on the heavy side; the ceviche - great flavor, lots of fish and hot peppers; and the special, which was a roasted pork dish called Lechon Horneado.
That was the bomb.
Melt in your mouth succulent.
Amazing flavor that easily rivaled a cubano pork dish I had in Little Havana.
And the meat was also extremely lean.
I didn't see a speck of fat.
Service was a little slow.
Good prices, lots of food.
I'd go back and try other things on the menu.
mofongo.author: Lisa M.
mofongo.review: Ate here for the first time the other night. We had the mofongo appetizer - yummy but a little on the heavy side; the ceviche - great flavor, lots of fish and hot peppers; and the special, which was a roasted pork dish called Lechon Horneado. That was the bomb. Melt in your mouth succulent. Amazing flavor that easily rivaled a cubano pork dish I had in Little Havana. And the meat was also extremely lean. I didn't see a speck of fat. Service was a little slow. Good prices, lots of food. I'd go back and try other things on the menu.

excerpts: The mofongo was good.
Cool spot...kinda slow service, but not super expensive either.
Biggest disappointment: they gave us styrofoam boxes.
mofongo.author: Cassie C.
mofongo.review: 3.5 The arroz con pollo was fantastic! The mofongo was good. Cool spot...kinda slow service, but not super expensive either. Biggest disappointment: they gave us styrofoam boxes.

excerpts: My wife had the Mofongo and enjoyed it.
Not being an expert on this kind of food--nor ever wanting to gain an expertise on it--I defer to the other critics on this page.
But it was a pleasant experience, especially for my wife.
mofongo.author: Murray S.
mofongo.review: My wife really likes Cuban and Puerto Rican food and so we tried out this restaurant.  (I prefer spicier fare, e.g. Mexican or Jamaican).  We went on a Sat. nite and the restaurant had only a few customers.  Which is too bad because the food was good, the prices reasonable, and the service efficient.  I had the Ropa Vieja and added lots of hot sauce--the server seemed a bit insulted.  My wife had the Mofongo and enjoyed it.  Not being an expert on this kind of food--nor ever wanting to gain an expertise on it--I defer to the other critics on this page.  But it was a pleasant experience, especially for my wife.

excerpts: Our entrees came, he got the ropa vieja
and I got the Chile relleno with chicken.
ropa vieja.author: Vanessa D.
ropa vieja.review:
My boyfriend and I passed by this restaurant a few months ago and we FINALLY got the chance to try it. We were so excited and the location is beautiful, right in the heart of Mission District.

We started out with chicken and picadillo empanadas with a side of tostones. That already set the bar high for our entrees, it was so delicious! Filled with flavor and the meats were cooked so well. The empanadas were both crispy and golden, yum.

Our entrees came, he got the ropa vieja and I got the Chile relleno with chicken. They both came with sides of white rice and taro chips. The white rice had a nice kick of flavor, it was a perfect side and so were the chips. The whole meal evened each other out. Along with the great food was friendly smiles of our servers. they were all so kind to us!! Thank you very much for a delicious meal, we look forward to coming back.

excerpts: I enjoyed the ropa vieja, the meat was tender and just right.
ropa vieja.author: Faith W.
ropa vieja.review: The food was really good. I enjoyed the ropa vieja, the meat was tender and just right. For appetizer I got the yucca Frita ( It was my first time trying it and it was definitely interesting taste. Kind of taste like fries but it wasn't.) Lastly, I had the Alcapurrias and I would recommend people to try that one also.

excerpts: Then we had the Ropa Vieja!
We shared all three plates so it was the right amount, obviously you can order just one plate for yourself and still have a great meal.
