I would definitely recommend those 3 to try out, however I have to go back and give the Yuka a try again.
Wasn't impressed considering in Mother land Nicaragua they are cooked a certain way.
The vibe was welcoming and homey
so I'll give it another shot.
Recommend for something low key and good vibes
ropa vieja.author: Santiago E.
ropa vieja.review: Sangria sangria, we tried the white sangria and it was really good. You always have to try the sangria in a latin/Hispanic/cubano culture lol, it helps to judge the rest of the night. On a date we ordered the empanadas, which came out hot and tasty, yummy; It was two so it's basically an appetizer. Then we ordered the Mofongo which was fulfilling and cooked with love. Then we had the Ropa Vieja! We shared all three plates so it was the right amount, obviously you can order just one plate for yourself and still have a great meal. I would definitely recommend those 3 to try out, however I have to go back and give the Yuka a try again. Wasn't impressed considering in Mother land Nicaragua they are cooked a certain way. The vibe was welcoming and homey so I'll give it another shot. Recommend for something low key and good vibes

excerpts: My partner ordered the Ropa Vieja which was marinated shredded beef in a tomato based sauce with rice and black beans.
The sauce was very tasty and was totally different than the sauce that my dish had.
Like in all the great regional cuisines such as New Orleans it has been my experience that the sauces really make the dish and at El Nuevo Frutilandia
ropa vieja.author: Nick C.
ropa vieja.review:
A colleague turned me on to this place in the Mission.  It's a classic hole in the wall with little signage out front.  Apparently this Puerto Rican restaurant has been here for many years.

To be honest I know very little about Puerto Rican food as my only other dining experience was at SOL in San Rafael which I enjoyed.  However, El Nuevo Frutilanda was a much different, at least to my taste, cuisine.

And that's a good thing.

We began our evening dinner with the Ceviche a wonderful mix of shrimp and fish that was marinated with a unbelievable tasty pineapple salsa that was heaven to my taste buds.  Most of their dishes are served with Taro Chips which is a fried root vegetable sliced like a large flat potato chip and lightly salted. I think it was the first time that I've had one and I must say that it was delicious

Our entrees consisted of the Pollo A La Espenola which was nice cubes of chicken breast sautéed in onions and red bell peppers in a butternut carrot spiced sauce. The sauce was both sweet and tangy very delicious actually.  The entrée was topped off with a portion of rice. My partner ordered the Ropa Vieja which was marinated shredded beef in a tomato based sauce with rice and black beans. The sauce was very tasty and was totally different than the sauce that my dish had.  Like in all the great regional cuisines such as New Orleans it has been my experience that the sauces really make the dish and at El Nuevo Frutilandia it is all about the sauce.

Our dinner was topped off with a wonderful freshly baked plantain tart which melted in our mouths. 

San Francisco is a fabulous culinary destination full of multi ethnic cuisines  El Nuevo Frutilandia is a fine example of that - offering up great food, at reasonable prices in a neighborhood rich in fantastic dining alternatives.  We found it to be one of the City's best kept secrets.

We will be back.....

excerpts: I had the ropa vieja with arroz con gandules, the beef was on point, however the rice lacked the sofrito taste and salty pork flavor I am accustomed to.
We also had the yuca appetizer, which was bland and needed salt.
We were pleasantly surprised by the fried plantains, sweet and nicely cooked.
All in all I would recommend it and will return to taste the other dishes on the menu.
ropa vieja.author: IRMA C.
ropa vieja.review:
I have been coming to this restaurant since I was a young girl it has been in my neighborhood for many years. It had been many years since I had returned. 
I came in today and I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the food is still outstanding. The remodel also was very cool. We enjoyed the service Nick provided, he was very pleasant, knowledgeable and had a charismatic way about him. 
We had the Cuban sandwich, tasty, but it needed to be pressed more. We also had both of the shrimp dishes offered, both were very good. I had the ropa vieja with arroz con gandules, the beef was on point, however the rice lacked the sofrito taste and salty pork flavor I am accustomed to. We also had the yuca appetizer, which was bland and needed salt. We were pleasantly surprised by the fried plantains, sweet and nicely cooked. 
All in all I would recommend it and will return to taste the other dishes on the menu.

excerpts: Vaca Frita vs. Ropa Vieja?
Hands down, Vaca Frita, said she.
ropa vieja.author: Helen S.
ropa vieja.review:
Found this place on Yelp purely by chance and decided to come because it was open and we wanted somewhere in the Mission that wasn't crowded and serving Mexican food.

If Wendy is looking after you tonight, you're gonna have a good time. She's friendly, funny, and attentive, a winning combination in a waitress! Skills possibly honed through her past gig as a bartender. ;) Anyways, if you're having trouble deciding, you should trust her judgment. Vaca Frita vs. Ropa Vieja? Hands down, Vaca Frita, said she. And we couldn't get enough of the crispy, citrusy pieces of steak or savory taro root chips. 

Wendy's recommendations turned out to be more winning than my fellow Yelpers. I got the much touted Mofongo (with pork) out of curiosity, and while it was interesting, I wouldn't order it again. It was a mush of plantains and pork in garlicky sauce that wasn't evenly seasoned. A dish that struggled for direction and just sort of collapsed into a heap. 

The portions here are pretty small for what you pay, but there are few places to get a clean but authentic Puerto Rican experience such as the one at Frutilandia. The bright interior is sparingly but charmingly decorated in bright colors and a TV plays soundless channels. Somehow, everything just belongs together, like the coffee can turned silverware container on each table. It's a wonderful place for a peaceful meal before a busy night in the Mission!

excerpts: Service was awesome, make sure to get the carafe of red sangria, ropa vieja and ceviche.
ropa vieja.author: Rob A.
ropa vieja.review:
Service was awesome, make sure to get the carafe of red sangria, ropa vieja and ceviche. NEW fave place in the mission. 

Update: another 5 stars!

excerpts: Ropa Vieja, was spiced just right and even has a small but nice wine list.
ropa vieja.author: George H.
ropa vieja.review:
What a great neighborhood find!  After seeing a movie that served Cuban food we found this cool spot.  Great inside space, looks like it could be in Little Havana in Cuba. Ropa Vieja, was spiced just right and even has a small but nice wine list.  

A gem...

excerpts: Want to try more, but I imagine the sofrito and ropa vieja will be beautiful since the mofongo has a little sofrito on top (sin carne).
ropa vieja.author: Ellie M.
ropa vieja.review:
I'm giving this 5 stars because of flavor.

This is the best PR/Cuban food (Cuba Rican) food I've had away from Miami.

In NY I found PR food but no real Cuban food, so finding this in SF felt like pure luck.

The mofongo and pork were moist and flavorful.

The yucca was good (not dry, not dripping in oil), and the garlic sauce was almost looe my grandma makes it!

Want to try more, but I imagine the sofrito and ropa vieja will be beautiful since the mofongo has a little sofrito on top (sin carne).

Definitely go here!
Only down side: average portions (not large, not tiny) and on the low end of pricey (I usually go to places where main dishes are $8-15 rather than $14-19.

excerpts: The ropa vieja flavor was heavily dominated by green peppers, was tough, and the sauce was too runny.
ropa vieja.author: Lisa K.
ropa vieja.review:
So we'd come back since 2012, and things had taken a turn for the better. But revisiting tonight showed that once again, things are worse - and worse than ever, sadly. We noticed that the menus have changed - there's no more soup, unfortunately. The alcapurrias were a disturbing orange color (more than just too much annatto) and frankly weren't worth eating. The ropa vieja flavor was heavily dominated by green peppers, was tough, and the sauce was too runny. The cuban sandwich was fine though!

Furthermore, the service was pretty paltry too. We were quizzed about if we were willing to pay the $1.25 for pink beans instead of black when we'd asked for the former (this at a restaurant where the alcalpurrias are now $9!), and when we confirmed we wanted the pink beans and were fine to pay for them, black beans were still brought to our table - and when the situation was remedied, the beans themselves tasted terribly burned! Our "appetizer" arrived by the time we had almost finished our entrees. We asked if the platanos could be cooked without the butter, and were told this was impossible - too bad, since they have accommodated that request before. We were pretty sad to see what's going on here.

excerpts: We ordered lechon (so tender and loaded with flavor), ropa vieja (the sauce tasty) and shrimp platter, which came with arroz con gandules and habichuelas.
Soooo delicious.
I just can't say enough about this place.
It's a little hole in the wall on the Mission, with beautiful decor of PR and my favorite salsa music playing in the background.
Very friendly and welcoming staff
(I can't remember her name) but she took the time to chat with us for a while and getting to know us.
Never have I experienced such attention.
My only disappointment was they ran out of pasteles (my favorite) and flan.
No worries.
I'll be back!
You will not be disappointed!
ropa vieja.author: Marilyn O.
ropa vieja.review: Hands down, one of the best PRican/Cuban restaurants in SF! Better than Sol and Havana Cuba.  The food was delicious and bursting with flavor! We ordered a little bit of everything. The pork mofongo was to die for.  Soooo much flavor! The chicken empanadas.  Wow.  The ceviche? Yum! We ordered lechon (so tender and loaded with flavor), ropa vieja (the sauce tasty) and shrimp platter, which came with arroz con gandules and habichuelas.  Soooo delicious.  I just can't say enough about this place.  It's a little hole in the wall on the Mission, with beautiful decor of PR and my favorite salsa music playing in the background.  Very friendly and welcoming staff (I can't remember her name) but she took the time to chat with us for a while and getting to know us.  Never have I experienced such attention.  My only disappointment was they ran out of pasteles (my favorite) and flan.  No worries.  I'll be back!  You will not be disappointed!

excerpts: I split the ropa vieja with my dining companion.
It was well cooked and with a little hot sauce spritz quite tasty.
Oh and don't pass on the sangria.
I liked it because it was a nice fruity compliment to the food and
not too much for me since I don't frequently drink.
I definitely plan to eat here again on my next trip to SF.
ropa vieja.author: Oni B.
ropa vieja.review: I travel to San Francisco quite a bit for work and I am always looking for new places to try.  I went to this place for the first time two weeks ago because I was in the mood for Cuban.  It's in the Mission/Latin Cultural District.  The staff and the owner were so welcoming and friendly it was like visiting friends.  It is by no means a big or fancy place but the food was solid.  I had the yucca and veggie empanada as starters.  I love yucca and it's hard to find a restaurant that gets it right.  The yucca here was perfectly fried and came with a nice sauce for dipping.  The empanada was also tasty and the crust was near perfection. It also came with a good sauce. I mixed it with the yucca sauce and the combo of the two was even better.  I split the ropa vieja with my dining companion. It was well cooked and with a little hot sauce spritz quite tasty.  Oh and don't pass on the sangria. I liked it because it was a nice fruity compliment to the food and not too much for me since I don't frequently drink.  I definitely plan to eat here again on my next trip to SF.

excerpts: Ordered ropa vieja after my red sangria.
Sangria is delicious.
I could have had maybe 2 more after my third one.
Ropa vieja was very good accompanied with my fried platanos.
Yum!
The owner Rafeal introduced himself & made me feel more welcome in his restaurants.
It was like being at a friends house.
This place is worth checking out because I'm definitely going to frequent when in the city.
Hasta pronto Rafa!
ropa vieja.author: Ozzy T.
ropa vieja.review: In south San Francisco for business, I ventured to explore what the city has to offer. I walked by Frutilandia as I was checking out 24th street restaurants. Checked out their menu and they had me at sangria y platanos maduros (plantains). Ordered ropa vieja after my red sangria. Sangria is delicious. I could have had maybe 2 more after my third one. Ropa vieja was very good accompanied with my fried platanos. Yum! The owner Rafeal introduced himself & made me feel more welcome in his restaurants. It was like being at a friends house. This place is worth checking out because I'm definitely going to frequent when in the city. Hasta pronto Rafa!

excerpts: I saw this restaurant featured on Guy Fieri's show, so I thought I'd take a chance and order the ropa vieja.
I was not disappointed: it lived up to to its excellent reviews and exceeded all expectations.
I wanted another serving when I was finished.
The inside of the restaurant is very welcoming, the female owner greeted me with a big smile, and the music playing in the background makes this the perfect place for lunch, dinner, brunch, whatever.
These are good people serving excellent home-cooked Cuban/Puerto Rican food.
You will not leave hungry.
ropa vieja.author: Maurice R.
ropa vieja.review: I saw this restaurant featured on Guy Fieri's show, so I thought I'd take a chance and order the ropa vieja. I was not disappointed: it lived up to to its excellent reviews and exceeded all expectations. I wanted another serving when I was finished. The inside of the restaurant is very welcoming, the female owner greeted me with a big smile, and the music playing in the background makes this the perfect place for lunch, dinner, brunch, whatever. These are good people serving excellent home-cooked Cuban/Puerto Rican food. You will not leave hungry.

excerpts: The Cubano sandwich with extra mustard will be forever my favorite... or is it the Alcapurrias... or maybe the Ropa Vieja,
ropa vieja.author: Chelsey B.
ropa vieja.review:
This spot is a must to visit when you're around the Mission.
The Cubano sandwich with extra mustard will be forever my favorite... or is it the Alcapurrias... or maybe the Ropa Vieja, I JUST LOVE IT ALL!! 

When my boyfriend and I go here.. he always has to order a Sangria.
This place is awesome for a modern mom and pop type of restaurant.

excerpts: The ropa vieja looked like ropa vieja but tasted like salpicon (a very bland version of salpicon).
ropa vieja.author: carol c.
ropa vieja.review:
This reminded me of the food I had in Cuba- bland!! We have been coming to Fruitlandia on and off for 20+ years and have usually had great experiences here
I LOVE Cuban and Puerto Rican food but this place no longer does it justice at all. The ropa vieja looked like ropa vieja but tasted like salpicon (a very bland version of salpicon). The Cubano sandwich had a slightly sweet but still kind of bland pulled pork in it. WTF? You can't just switch out the roasted pork and still call it a Cubano! On top of that the bread was either stale or over cooked. The maduro had a very strange flavor. How can you mess up fried plantain? On the positive side, service was nice and the habichuelas were good. As i said, I frequented this establishment for 20+ years. We had a great run but it's over now.

excerpts: We ordered the tostones, mofongo, pastel for appetizers and for dinner we had the ropa vieja, pierna de puerco horneada...
it was all delicious!!
Make sure you ask for the Puerto Rican hot sauce...
sorry we emptied the bottle.
Order the flan con queso...
it was so good...cheesy and worth it!!!
We will be back...
Can't wait.
ropa vieja.author: hac h.
ropa vieja.review: Cute restaurant...we had the same photo of a house in Puerto Rico as they did! We ordered the tostones, mofongo, pastel for appetizers and for dinner we had the ropa vieja, pierna de puerco horneada...it was all delicious!! Make sure you ask for the Puerto Rican hot sauce...sorry we emptied the bottle. Order the flan con queso...it was so good...cheesy and worth it!!! We will be back...Can't wait.

excerpts: We ordered Mofongo and the Ropa Vieja because they are classic Puerto Rican dishes and could serve as a sort of control group.
The Mofongo came out a very small portion, molded on the plate in the shape of a dome with a (kinda stale) plantain chip sticking out.
It was very good, we thoroughly enjoyed it
but it was gone in 4 bites.
The really surprising thing was that the Ropa Vieja was even skimpier.
It was on a plate that you would expect to hold a side dinner salad.
ropa vieja.author: Emma H.
ropa vieja.review:
My husband and I wandered in here because Yelp had a check-in-offer for 15% off our bill ;) We ordered Mofongo and the Ropa Vieja because they are classic Puerto Rican dishes and could serve as a sort of control group. The Mofongo came out a very small portion, molded on the plate in the shape of a dome with a (kinda stale) plantain chip sticking out. It was very good, we thoroughly enjoyed it but it was gone in 4 bites. The really surprising thing was that the Ropa Vieja was even skimpier. It was on a plate that you would expect to hold a side dinner salad. It had a tiny scoop of white rice, a tiny cup of black beans and a tiny scoop of meat. Both plates together would barely have even been enough to feed one hungry person. We were one hungry person and one filled-up-on-Phil'z person and it was nowhere near enough food. 
The server was so nice and we tipped him very generously, of course based on our pre-discounted total and he seemed very grateful. Unfortunately we will not return though because in order to fill our appetites we would need to spend about $40 and ain't nobody got time for that at lunchtime.

excerpts: We ordered the Ropa Vieja and it was cold and icky.
We also got the shrimp in garlic butter sauce and it was flavorless and not cooked all the way.
The best thing we ate were the fried plantains and the black beans.
ropa vieja.author: Christine N.
ropa vieja.review:
Honestly, I really wanted to like this place as it is a cute little restaurant a few blocks from my place.  

The service is great, but the food was horrible.  Literally one of the worst meals I have had all year.   The rice was old and so crunchy it hurt my gums. We ordered the Ropa Vieja and it was cold and icky.  We also got the shrimp in garlic butter sauce and it was flavorless and not cooked all the way.   The best thing we ate were the fried plantains and the black beans.  I was a little worried I might get sick from the food, but ended up being fine.

Not only was the food terrible, but it was really expensive!  Almost $40 for two people and no alcohol.

excerpts: We tried El Neuvo Fruitlandia for the first time today because we'd been looking for a place to get ropa vieja.

We got the Ropa vieja empanadas (crispy outside, meaty inside, with nicely cooked red peppers), the Empanadas del Espinacas (ala carte), the Plàtanos Maduros (yes, fried plantains can be even better with a little butter and Kahlua), and the Papa Rellena (Mashed potatoes filled with nicely seasoned ground beef & green peppers, fried golden brown).
ropa vieja.author: Vicki B.
ropa vieja.review:
We tried El Neuvo Fruitlandia for the first time today because we'd been looking for a place to get ropa vieja. They have it as an empanada, a sandwich, or an entree.

We got the Ropa vieja empanadas (crispy outside, meaty inside, with nicely cooked red peppers), the Empanadas del Espinacas (ala carte), the Plàtanos Maduros (yes, fried plantains can be even better with a little butter and Kahlua), and the Papa Rellena (Mashed potatoes filled with nicely seasoned ground beef & green peppers, fried golden brown).

All tasty. Service was good. We plan to return to try some of the items we had to forgo this time.

Vegetarian entrees and appetizers available as well as beef, pork, and chicken.

excerpts: I ordered a really healthy serving of ropa vieja, and my girlfriend ordered a similarly huge yucca dish.
ropa vieja.author: Bill H.
ropa vieja.review:
I had a solid dinner here on Day of the Dead, after failing to get in other spots around 24th street.  I ordered a really healthy serving of ropa vieja, and my girlfriend ordered a similarly huge yucca dish.  I'd rate both dishes as good home cooking, but not great.

That being said -- the prices were reasonable, and service was courteous (not so much prompt, perhaps due to the heavy traffic on a weeknight).

I don't know if I'd go back, though, given alternatives in the neighborhood.

excerpts: I ordered the ropa vieja.
3.5 stars.
I only have a cuban rest.
in San Jose to compare it too.
I could tell the meat had been slow cooked for some time in the ingredient's and had absorbed all the flavors wonderfully.
However, the flavors were not unique and did little to distinguish themselves from Mexican flavors.
ropa vieja.author: Frida V.
ropa vieja.review:
Don't ask me how I know the owners, but I do.  For all the concerned people questioning the motherland of the owners, they are from El Salvador.  The husband and wife worked for the original owners and learned all the recipes.  Okay enough personal background.  

We went for my mother-in-laws BDay with a party of 10.5 adults (expecting mom) and 1 child.  Because it is only one person cooking we were there forever!  For appetizers we ordered the following

Yucca en ajo.  2 stars.  The yucca was boiled in a garlicky broth but failed to absorb much of the flavor.  The garlic broth was delicious however when we soaked the bread in it.

Tostones  4 stars.  On par with what tostones are supposed to be like.

Platanos fritos con crema Y frijoles fritos (fried plantains w/ refried beans and creme) 5 stars.  Although the bean to platanos ratio was not equal.

I ordered the ropa vieja.  3.5 stars.  I only have a cuban rest. in San Jose to compare it too.  I could tell the meat had been slow cooked for some time in the ingredient's and had absorbed all the flavors wonderfully.  However, the flavors were not unique and did little to distinguish themselves from Mexican flavors.  The dish was served with a side of white rice.

My husband ordered a shrimp dish in a spicy tomatoes broth. 4 stars.  
I sampled a shrimp and it tasted very fresh and well cooked.  The "spicy" broth  sauce was mild.  

Most of the adults ordered the steak sandwich, which I am kicking myself for not ordering instead.  Very big portion, juicy steak, but I did not taste it so I cant rate.

Someone else had the garlic shrimp, but had similar results as the yucca. Again I did not taste, just repeating what the other diner said.

KEY TIP!!

If you have the choice between side salad or soup, ORDER the soup.  I made the mistake of ordering the salad...it was a joke!  It was made up of chopped lettuce, canned vegetable medley (cubed carrots, green beans and peas) with a nonexistent dressing.  It was a waste of food.

The soup on the other hand, was a small bowl of chicken soup.  Very good.

Overall, I would go again to try the steak sandwich and support the owners.

excerpts: I love the Ropa Vieja here.
Will go here time and time again.
ropa vieja.author: Me R.
ropa vieja.review: I love this place. Never had Puerto Rican food before eating here and they have the best. The empanadas are sooo good. I love the Ropa Vieja here. Will go here time and time again.

excerpts: ROPA VIEJA ($14.25) - Shredded flank steak cooked in creole sauce, onions, tomatoes, wine, and bell peppers.
includes rice, black beans, and soup or salad.
I chose soup because i see other yelps ranting about how good the chicken soup was.
OMG THE CHICKEN SOUP (even if it was a small side cup of it) WAS THE BEST!!!!
When the dish came out the portion was decent, not sure if thats their average size or they docked off some because I was purchasing on a Living Social deal.
Very good and flavorful.
I think I'll just order the chicken soup by itself next time
LOL.
I didn't really see raisins in my meal, which was fine i prefer to eat raisins by themselves then mixed with a main course.

The meat was tender and shredded easily, the flavors of the sauce mixed well with the meat/rice/beans however kind of lacked the strong flavor that I'm use to when eating cuban food, also came with a side of crunch plantains which i wasn't too fond of.
ropa vieja.author: Jane A.
ropa vieja.review:
deliciosa
(3.25 stars)

Living social deal went into good use.

- Food, good
- Prices, decent
- Service, good
- Ambiance, small and cute

I recall them being a vendor at SF Street Food Festival but did not get a chance to try them out. Craving "cuban food" and came this way to get my fixings. I've had cuban food before and always enjoyed it because the dishes are very flavorful. I wanted to give this place more stars, i really do, but something in the food kind of lacks.

HEFFER STATUS.

ROPA VIEJA ($14.25) - Shredded flank steak cooked in creole sauce, onions, tomatoes, wine, and bell peppers. includes rice, black beans, and soup or salad. I chose soup because i see other yelps ranting about how good the chicken soup was. OMG THE CHICKEN SOUP (even if it was a small side cup of it) WAS THE BEST!!!!  When the dish came out the portion was decent, not sure if thats their average size or they docked off some because I was purchasing on a Living Social deal.Very good and flavorful. I think I'll just order the chicken soup by itself next time LOL. I didn't really see raisins in my meal, which was fine i prefer to eat raisins by themselves then mixed with a main course. The meat was tender and shredded easily, the flavors of the sauce mixed well with the meat/rice/beans however kind of lacked the strong flavor that I'm use to when eating cuban food, also came with a side of crunch plantains which i wasn't too fond of. I prefer the nice cooked plantains, not these plantain chips with no flavor. 

Will I be back? Yes. it may not have been the best cuban food but its still delicious.

Until the next review....

excerpts: My partner had the Ropa Vieja (Shredded flank steak cooked in creole sauce, onions, tomatoes, wine, and bell peppers.
includes rice, black beans, and soup).
It wasn't even actually what he ordered but it was comparable as far as the menu was concerned
so he just went along with it.
I tasted it and though I liked it better then my order, it was certainly nothing to write home about.
Presentation was that of a school cafeteria and there wasn't even a plantano on the plate.
Portions were small.
I may go by there again for the Cuban Sandwich during lunch hours someday if I'm in the hood but don't hold your breath.
We will stick to our favorite in the Haight for this style food from now on.
It has price points, atmosphere, and presentation.
None of which I could vouch for this place.
Go to Parada 22 instead.
ropa vieja.author: John W.
ropa vieja.review:
A little disappointed actually.  After hearing some hype on the joint and remembering I got a quite delicious Cubano sandwich from them at the San Francisco Street Festival, I was excited to try the place especially after being turned away a week ago because its was packed, close to closing time, and claimed "they were out of food".
Tonight there it was only about 20% full, perhaps because its a holiday weekend.
The standard most be low on 24th Street because I ordered the  Bistec De Palomilla (Tender thin top sirloin steak sauteed with orange-lemon sauce garnished with onions and parsley. includes rice, black beans, and soup )and I can't even say it looked good.  It was Not tender and a bit flavorless.  Like a rubbery chip steak.
My partner had the Ropa Vieja (Shredded flank steak cooked in creole sauce, onions, tomatoes, wine, and bell peppers. includes rice, black beans, and soup).  It wasn't even actually what he ordered but it was comparable as far as the menu was concerned so he just went along with it.  I tasted it and though I liked it better then my order, it was certainly nothing to write home about.  Presentation was that of a school cafeteria and there wasn't even a plantano on the plate.  Portions were small.
I may go by there again for the Cuban Sandwich during lunch hours someday if I'm in the hood but don't hold your breath.  
We will stick to our favorite in the Haight for this style food from now on.  It has price points, atmosphere, and presentation.  None of which I could vouch for this place.  Go to Parada 22 instead.

excerpts: that you dip in a secret sauce), Pierna de Puerco Horneado (really tender pork with carribean spices) served with a tasty side of dish of rice and beans and my friend had the Ropa Vieja (flank steak in a creole sauce) even though I meant to tell him that I heard the Vaca Frita (fried shredded flank steak)
was the way to go.
ropa vieja.author: LaSha G.
ropa vieja.review:
This is probably THE only SF restaurant that specializes in Puerto Rican food from what I can tell, but don't hold me to that.  I went here with a friend on Friday night before a jazz concert at the Red Poppy Art House, and the restaurant is tiny but in a cozy way as opposed to a clausterphobic way.  The night I went there was only one lady manning the bar, taking orders, and serving food but she was really sweet and patient since I didn't know what I wanted to order and we didn't have to wait too long for anything.

Excellent dishes enjoyed that night include  Mofongo (mashed plantains and pork sauteed with garlic and olive oil...that you dip in a secret sauce), Pierna de Puerco Horneado (really tender pork with carribean spices) served with a tasty side of dish of rice and beans and my friend had the Ropa Vieja (flank steak in a creole sauce) even though I meant to tell him that I heard the Vaca Frita (fried shredded flank steak) was the way to go.  He enjoyed his dish regardless.

At $9.95 for an entre, I thought the prices here were cheap.    I'm glad I found this place (via Yelp btw) ...I'll definitely bring some friends here in the future....especially since the Red Poppy is right around the corner.

excerpts: Except for Ropa Vieja because that is one big pain in the culito to make.
ropa vieja.author: Liz P.
ropa vieja.review:
Aye, caramba!  My Cuban and Puerto Rican relatives are rolling over in their graves. Sorry folks, this place is such a disappointment.

I'm jaded.  My Grandmother taught my Mom how to cook Cuban food.  My Mom taught me.  I'd rather take the time and cook my own than eat here.  Except for Ropa Vieja because that is one big pain in the culito to make.

I'm still searching for a decent Cuban place in the City other than mi casa.  If anyone finds one, please let me know.

excerpts: The Ropa Vieja (shredded beef) dish was every bit as fantastically fabulous as the other reviewers promised.
Lots of peppers and onions mixed in, and not a hint of fattiness.
Just perfectly cooked, flavorful shredded beef served simply with rice and beans.

Awesome, 
Will definitely be adding this cozy little restaurant to my local rotation.
ropa vieja.author: Becca V.
ropa vieja.review:
This place made me do the Happy Dance!  
The Ropa Vieja (shredded beef) dish was every bit as fantastically fabulous as the other reviewers promised.  Lots of peppers and onions mixed in, and not a hint of fattiness.  Just perfectly cooked, flavorful shredded beef served simply with rice and beans.  Awesome, 
Will definitely be adding this cozy little restaurant to my local rotation.

excerpts: For entrees we had Ropa Vieja (which my parter swore was properly cooked and had an authentic flavor), and Camarones al Ajillo, seven perfectly cooked shrimp in an amazing lemon-butter sauce.

We also tried the Chiles Rellenos just for the sake of comparison, and although they were much wetter than I expected or have had before (served in a casserole dish filled with sauce), they tasted great.
ropa vieja.author: Tim D.
ropa vieja.review:
I had wanted to try this restaurant for some time but was always hesitant due to the inconsistent reviews it's received on here.  My Puerto Rican partner's craving for home cooking and his desire to give this caucasian American a taste of the Island finally won out and I decided to give it a try with an open mind, and I sure am glad I did!  

We arrived Sat. around 1:00 PM and only two of the 12 tables were occupied, with one waitress on duty.  After an hour about half of the tables were filled, all with what appeared to be local Mission folks, including a charming elderly couple, which I took as a good sign of authentic food.  On this day, service seemed casual as opposed to slow (as other reviewers have reported), but I could see it perhaps slowing down if it was too full or if too many people arrived at once.

Food-wise, everything we ordered was delicious, including the each-piece-separately-toasted French table bread.  I ordered the Pastel app. on Yelp's recommendation, which I enjoyed quite a bit but wished was more tamale-like for my personal taste.  The Al Capurria was like a yummy meat-filled yucca donut which I'd definitely order again.  The complimentary chicken soup was as good as I'd want a chicken soup to be, properly salted and with very soft, moist chunks o'chicken.

For entrees we had Ropa Vieja (which my parter swore was properly cooked and had an authentic flavor), and Camarones al Ajillo, seven perfectly cooked shrimp in an amazing lemon-butter sauce.  We also tried the Chiles Rellenos just for the sake of comparison, and although they were much wetter than I expected or have had before (served in a casserole dish filled with sauce), they tasted great.  The breading was of course not crispy due to all the sauce, but it was still discernible and added to the flavor and texture of the peppers.  

Regarding the side of beans which others have reviewed as "watery and bland," my partner says the thinner sauce is the authentic Puerto Rican style.  I don't personally like watery beans, but I found this sauce to be just thick enough on its own and was especially good with the addition of rice, which I mixed in to all the sauces we were served. I felt the beans were "delicately spiced" rather than bland, meant to be a basic accompaniment, not a main flavor feature.

Some reviews on here have negatively critiqued the decor, though I found it to be basic but charming, likening it to a restaurant you'd find along the road while traveling in the Island countryside.  It at least appeared to be very clean.  I didn't give the restrooms a try.

I don't know if time of day or day of week are factors in some of the inconsistencies people have reported, but I'd recommend making your own decision.  Just be open-minded in regards to some of the negative comments and you should be OK.

ropa vieja.author: melisa n.
ropa vieja.review:
Ok so gotta give them 3 stars because they went out of their way to accommodate us but I was expecting better...

Sunday evening, after a trip to MoMA we made a much anticipated trip to Frutilandia.  Keep in mind, I'm Puerto Rican -born and raised- so I know what most of the dishes should taste like.  Trying to be reasonable I don't expect them to be up on "tastes like when grandma makes them" status but at least I expect them to taste like if I went to a hole in the wall place in NYC.

We drive by slowly to check the location around 6:45pm when I see the sign that says CLOSED... Hmm, their website says the hours are until 8pm...  Circled the block and decided to get out of the car and look to see if it was a 4th of July weekend thing but nope, no hours on the door either, hmm.  Then I see her, the waitress inside.  I proceed to knock and signal her to come on over... Success, she heeds my call.  Busted out the Spanish to seem more convincing and she explains that even though they are cleaning they could serve us if we didn't mind.  Score, we go in.

I had looked at the menu online and had pretty much an idea of what I wanted.  There were a couple of things they didn't have (won't hold it against them since they were closing after all) which were the guava juice and the chicken soup that you can have instead of the green salad.  Order for two looked something like this:

- 1 alcapurria
- 1 pastel
- 1 side of amarillos (ripe, fried plantains)
- 1 order of tostones (green, fried plantains)
- Camarones a la criolla (shrimp in creole sauce)
- Ropa Vieja (shredded beef in tomato base sauce)

This came with side of white rice and black beans (Cuban frijoles) and some bread.  Ok here come to complaints...  The alcapurria, the "dough" tasted unbalance, meaning they used too much of one ingredient (in this case the baby green bananas) and it was overpowering....  They were also oily.  The pastel was ok, certainly lacking the usual kick of flavor I am used to.  Tostones were ok, I make better.  Amarillos are impossible to screw up so these were good.  I have never been a fan of frijoles but these were bland.  The camarones were ok... although the criolla sauce was bleh at best.  Ropa vieja was again ok, nothing to bring me back.  The mamey and pineapple shakes we got were yum though.  Too bad they didn't have guava....  All of thise for around $45.

I might come back and try to aim for when they are busier to see if then the quality of the food improves even if the service is slower as some reviews mention.  All in all, super sweet of them to seat us when they were getting ready to go but the food...  If I spend a little extra time and effort, I can make it better myself....

food - 2 stars
service - 1 star

3 stars at best as of now.

Yes, service is slow but this is an island restaurant...also they were out of several of the beers, but again this feels *authentic* to me.  And can someone please.  Please.  PLEASE direct me to a location where I can get a can of Medalla Light?  I drank that stuff like water in PR.

excerpts: I also got a bite of their Ropa Vieja - which was just ok to me; I mean it was moist and flavorful, but over-hyped to me.
I wish I could say how the dishes my other companions tried were, but they ate it all :-\
In conclusion, it was classic home-cooking w/Puerto Rican spices.
I could probably make a lot of the stuff myself, but being the lazy fuck that I am, I'll pay the very reasonable prices to have El Nuevo do it for me.
ropa vieja.author: CINDY K.
ropa vieja.review:
With every passing year, I think my metabolism slows down another critical increment.  And so, no way was there going to be a ridiculous MEATFEST for my bday this time!  We loaded up instead on plaintains at El Nuevo Frutilandia, in the form of their Aperitivos Surtidos and Mofongo.  I'm not sure which item was what, but the tamale looking thing on the combo dish was great, and the Mofongo (it was like hash) was REALLY good with the accompanying tomato-ey/brothy sauce.
Okay - we are talking about MY bday - so there was plenty of protein coming thru the kitchen.  The Fried Pork Chops were AWESOME, just like grandma used to make.  Yes, my grandma is Chinese, but nevertheless, it was JUST like how she used to fry it up - simple salt and pepper yumminess. I got the Picadillo a La Habana Vieja - which I enjoyed - can't go wrong with ground beef, tomato sauce and pimiento olives. I also got a bite of their Ropa Vieja - which was just ok to me; I mean it was moist and flavorful, but over-hyped to me.
I wish I could say how the dishes my other companions tried were, but they ate it all :-\
In conclusion, it was classic home-cooking w/Puerto Rican spices.  I could probably make a lot of the stuff myself, but being the lazy fuck that I am, I'll pay the very reasonable prices to have El Nuevo do it for me.  Just be forewarned they take that treat-you-like-family-thing to heart: they'll take their time, you gotta bug the waitress for what you want, but she's gonna give you a big ol' kiss and hug if it's your bday.

As I get older...but not really wiser...that worked out just right.  Having some good food, and spending time with people (some I see everyday, and some I don't get to see enough of) who warm my otherwise dead insides....there was no better way to spend my bday.

*WTF with the happy sappy shit? Finds a little kid to push down*

ropa vieja.review: I went to this place with a couple of friends for a birthday celebration, and I really enjoyed it. The Mofongo was delicious! I ordered the Bistek de Palomilla which was a bit lemony for me. It was still good, but having only tasted a few different versions, I could not say if it was more or less authentic than the other. I will definitely return to this place as I want to try the ropa vieja and other entrees. My friends had the vaca frita and a pork dish The pork was a bit dry, but I also enjoyed the vaca frita. The Mofongo though was the hit for me!

excerpts: I had the Ropa Vieja and added lots of hot sauce--the server seemed a bit insulted.
ropa vieja.author: Murray S.
ropa vieja.review: My wife really likes Cuban and Puerto Rican food and so we tried out this restaurant.  (I prefer spicier fare, e.g. Mexican or Jamaican).  We went on a Sat. nite and the restaurant had only a few customers.  Which is too bad because the food was good, the prices reasonable, and the service efficient.  I had the Ropa Vieja and added lots of hot sauce--the server seemed a bit insulted.  My wife had the Mofongo and enjoyed it.  Not being an expert on this kind of food--nor ever wanting to gain an expertise on it--I defer to the other critics on this page.  But it was a pleasant experience, especially for my wife.

excerpts: I ordered the Picadillo a La Havana and my husband got the Cuban sandwich and we shared a craft of sangria with some empanadas (chicken ones were the best).
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
picadillo a la havana.author: Brittany M.
picadillo a la havana.review: My husband and I were staying in a near by Airbnb and it just so happened that the owner of El Nuevo Frutilandia was our host and mentioned stopping by during our stay. I am SOOO happy we did! I had never had never had Cuban food prior to this experience, and all I can say is it was an amazing experience! Delicious food/sangria, affordable, and friendly. I ordered the Picadillo a La Havana and my husband got the Cuban sandwich and we shared a craft of sangria with some empanadas (chicken ones were the best). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
